Title: Data Analyst (Payment, Fintech)
Description:
About The Opportunity

We are on the lookout for a Data Analyst (Payment) to join the Fintech team on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

Be part of building the financial backbone of Delivery Hero. Youâ€™ll develop products that empower millions of customers and merchants, from seamless payments to innovative financial solutions like wallets and credit. Your work will support our path to profitability by creating financial flexibility for users and enabling smooth transactions across 70+ countries.

In this role you will:


Partner closely with Fintech Business and Product stakeholders to understand their analytical needs, and execute the roadmap for analytics work for Payment Analytics
Develop and optimize monitoring tools, perform deep-dive analysis and provide insights to facilitate a data-driven decision making
Exploit and analyze high volumes of data in order to quantify and answer questions to improve the business performance. Monitor KPIs, identify user behavior patterns and actively take actions to improve online payment performance across multiple regions
Demonstrate proficiency in coding practices and analytic approaches
Be able to answer the 'What?' question effectively and within reasonable deadlines, but also think about the 'So What?' and 'Now What' portions of the analysis
Proactively bring new ideas and suggestions to the team and our internal clients to improve our Fintech set up


What you need to be successful


You have worked as a data analyst and delivered measurable impact on improving understanding of payments
You have proven experience with daily practice of SQL, and visualization tools such as Tableau, and Looker
You have experience working with online payments and deep knowledge of the PSP, issuer, acquirer, and card scheme data.
You are eager on making business impact through analytics and you understand the product lifecycle
You have strong analytical and problem solving skills
You demonstrate excellent communication and presentation skills


Nice To Have:


Experience with BigQuery, Airflow, and Python
Understanding of real-time data analytics
Good understanding of mathematical and statistical data analysis techniques such as regression, extrapolation, time series analysis, forecasting, statistical hypothesis testing and econometric models


Who we are

As the worldâ€™s pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europeâ€™s largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

What's in it for you

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if youâ€™re in good shape, then weâ€™re in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 â‚¬ Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, weâ€™ll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.




Ready to join our team? If youâ€™re excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the worldâ€™s leading delivery platform, weâ€™d love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experienceâ€”just include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

Title: Product Data Analyst (f/m/x)
Description:
Company Description

We are looking for a Product Data Analyst (f/m/x) to join our Tech - Retail Team, that is responsible for maintaining, optimizing and expending our B2C/retail platform: Autohero in our AUTO1.comTechnology Department. In this Department we disrupt the used car market using cutting-edge technology. As AUTO1.com, a fast growing brand, we are part of AUTO1 Group, Europe's leading digital automotive platform. We are revolutionizing B2B automotive retail through the simplest processes and a digital infrastructure.

Job Description


Work closely with the product management team to track feature success metrics
Understand the functionality of our online platforms by reviewing product and technical requirements
Conduct independent analyses to support the product management team with actionable user behavior and business insights
Perform regular checks to ensure data integrity
Creation of KPI based dashboards for understanding complex business issues to enable strategic and operational decision-making


Qualifications


Bachelor/Masterâ€™s degree in a related field (e.g. business administration, economics, statistics, mathematics)
2+ years of relevant experience in an e-commerce/ internet-based company
Excellent knowledge of MS Excel / Google Sheets
Solid experience writing SQL queries and with a knowledge of Tableau and Google Analytics
High affinity for numbers, unwavering attention to detail and a strong analytical mind


Additional Information


Your life-work balance and home office are part of our culture, you can work from home up to 5 days a week
Relocation support to Germany which includes visa assistance, apartment search and help with costs
Educational budget for your personal growth
Team and company events like Hackathons, International Nights, Company Party, Football and more
More than 90 different nationalities make up for a truly international and diverse working environment


Apply by uploading your CV with a note of your earliest starting date.

Contact

Kaltrina Lasku

At AUTO1 Group we live an open culture, believe in direct communication, and value diversity. We welcome every applicant; regardless of gender, ethnic origin, religion, age, sexual identity, disability, or any other non-merit factor.

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
About Us

Welcome to Baobab Insurance â€“ Your Partner for the Cyber Security of Tomorrow!

The digital world is growing â€“ and with it, the threat of cyberattacks. Every successful attack not only jeopardizes businesses but also undermines trust in our connected society. At Baobab Insurance, we are committed to making the digital world safer â€“ proactively, sustainably, and with cutting-edge technology. Our mission: to protect companies from cyber threats before they arise, contributing to a more secure digital future.

Shape the digital security of tomorrow with us. Join a team that doesnâ€™t just watch but actively protects. Your ideas and commitment can make all the difference.

If thatâ€™s not enough, hereâ€™s what we offer:


Flexible Working: With your MacBook, you can work up to three days per week from home and also have the opportunity to work in our modern offices in Berlin or Cologne.
Attractive Compensation: Competitive salary and VSOP options.
Growth & Career: Grow with us â€“ in a dynamic company with clear advancement opportunities.
And much more


Baobab Insurance â€“ Growing together. Making the digital world safer, together.

Your Mission

Turn complex data into clear insights that drive smarter decisions across the business. Build dashboards, analyze trends, and ensure data accuracy to empower teams and improve performance.

Your Tasks


Collect requirements, design and maintain real-time dashboards to track key business KPIs.
Perform ad hoc data analysis to support strategic and operational decisions.
Work with stakeholders to define and refine regular reporting requirements (for insurers, brokers, investors, etc.).
Analyze broker/client behavior, transactions, and operational processes to identify opportunities for improvement.
Work closely with the Product, Sales, Underwriting and Cyber Security teams to provide data-driven insights that enhance our offerings (pricing models, risk assessment, customer/ broker segmentations, user journeys, etc.).
Ensure data accuracy and consistency across different sources.
Collaborate with the tech team to improve data infrastructure and reporting capabilities.


Your profile


5+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, or a related field.
Hands-on experience with SQL, Python, and BI tools like Looker, Tableau, or Power BI.
Experience with data modeling, transformation (dbt), and cloud data platforms (AWS, GCP) is a plus.
Strong SQL skills for complex querying, transformation, and optimization.
Experience with Python (Pandas, NumPy) for data analysis.
Proficiency in data visualization tools for reporting and dashboarding.
Familiarity with data warehouses, relational/non-relational databases, and ETL/ELT pipelines.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Ability to translate business needs into data insights and reporting solutions.
Clear communication with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.


Why us?


Flexible work options - work from home for up to three days a week an join us in the office for the remaining two days in Berlin
28 Vacation Days - plus Christmas & New Yearâ€™s Eve (half day)
Competitive Compensation - Attractive salary & equity options
Continuous Learning - Support for your professional growth and development
Team & Social Events - Quarterly gatherings, regular socials, and Thursday drinks on the house
Challenging & Supportive Culture - Work with motivated colleagues in an environment where you can grow, achieve, and enjoy the journey
Long-Term Growth - A stable career path in a fast-growing company
Welcoming Team - A people-first culture where joy at work and future prospects come first


Our Values

Customer First: Our customers and partners always come first.

Embrace Speed: Fast decisions and pragmatic solutions.

Data Over Gut Feeling: We make data-driven decisions.

Take Ownership: You get involved, no matter your position.

Continuous Learning: We challenge ourselves and grow together.

Open Culture: We have no rigid hierarchies. We communicate openly, directly, and at eye level.

Application Process


HR interview (30 min)
Founder's Interview with Anton (30min)
Live Case Study with Anand (Data Engineer) at our office in Berlin (60 minutes)
Interview with Manuela (Head of Product) at our office in Berlin (60 minutes)
References check
Offer


About Us

Baobab's mission is to protect SMEs against cyber attacks better.

We rethink Cyber protection for SMEs by integrating Cyber Insurance with preventive cyber security services.

Like the Baobab tree, Baobab stands for security and support in all circumstances. We help our partners, as well as customers, to better understand cyber (risks). We not only focus on remediation after an incident but also reduce the likelihood of such an event.

We are supported by renowned investors such as Project A, and La Famiglia. In Zurich Insurance, we also have a solid partner with whom we have made a dynamic start as a risk carrier in the market.

Why is cyber insurance important for SMEs? Regardless of size, every business has vulnerabilities that cybercriminals can exploit. Just because a company is small doesn't mean it can't be a target of a cyber-attack. The cyber sector is so fast-moving that there is always a residual risk here, which should then be insured.

We believe that diversity in the team makes the company stronger. We do not discriminate on the basis of religion, skin color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, or disability and welcome applications from all backgrounds. Apply now to become part of our team!

We are supported by renowned investors such as Project A, and La Famiglia. In Zurich Insurance, we also have a solid partner with whom we have made a dynamic start as a risk carrier in the market.

Why is cyber insurance important for SMEs? Regardless of size, every business has vulnerabilities that cybercriminals can exploit. Just because a company is small doesn't mean it can't be a target of a cyber-attack. The cyber sector is so fast-moving that there is always a residual risk here, which should then be insured.

We believe that diversity in the team makes the company stronger. We do not discriminate on the basis of religion, skin color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, or disability and welcome applications from all backgrounds. Apply now to become part of our team!

Title: Data Analyst - Digital Marketing (M/W/D)
Description:
Company Description

You'll be joining one of the worldâ€™s largest privately owned real estate tech companies and a subsidiary of Axel Springer. Our mission is to unlock everyoneâ€™s perfect place! You'll work across some of Europeâ€™s best known digital real estate brands including: ðŸ‡«ðŸ‡· Meilleurs Agents, ðŸ‡«ðŸ‡· Groupe SeLoger, ðŸ‡§ðŸ‡ª Immoweb, ðŸ‡©ðŸ‡ª Immowelt, ðŸ‡ªðŸ‡¸ Housell and ðŸ‡®ðŸ‡± Yad2.

Youâ€™re most productive when you have the freedom to work with true flexibility.

Thatâ€™s what we offer you here at AVIV Group.

Job Description

We are looking for a skilled (Senior) Analyst with expertise in (digital) marketing analytics to join our growing Marketing Analytics team.

As a Senior Marketing Analyst, within the Data Division, you will leverage Google Analytics 4, Adjust (MMP) and internal data sources to analyze our websiteâ€™s and mobile appâ€™s performance, identify key trends, and deliver actionable insights to enhance marketing strategy effectiveness.

You will work closely with our marketing teams to uncover insights that directly impact our ability to optimize user acquisition, engagement, and retention across all channels - ultimately boosting performance.

WE ARE LOOKING FOR AN INDIVIDUAL WHO CAN:


Improve and harmonize our measurement capabilities by collaborating with performance marketing, developers, data engineers and tracking experts.
Support our various brands by conducting ad-hoc analysis and providing detailed dashboards and reports on web and app channel performance
Create and maintain insightful dashboards and reports that monitor performance KPIs such as cost per acquisition (CPA), cost per lead (CPL), lifetime value (LTV) retention rate, and engagement metrics across our web and app platforms.
Collaborate with our performance marketing team to enhance paid media strategies and campaigns (e.g., Meta, Google Ads, etc.).
Conduct deep dive analysis into campaign and channel performance, helping the performance marketing team to understand the impact of their campaigns on key metrics like sessions, leads, conversion, and retention.
Perform cohort analysis to assess the effectiveness of marketing initiatives.
Present actionable insights and data-driven recommendations to stakeholders across marketing and growth teams.
Translate complex data findings into clear, business-focused insights for non-technical stakeholders.
Optimize our marketing spends and improve our ROI across channels by supporting our data science team to further enhance our Marketing Mix Modelling (MMM)
Forecast future trends and performance based on historical data, helping inform performance marketing and growth strategies.


Qualifications

AN INDIVIDUAL WHO HAS:


Several years of experience in analytics, with a focus on (digital) marketing analytics.
Strong experience working with Google Analytics 4 (GA4) or other analytics tools.
Profound knowledge of attribution difficulties and app marketing channels.
Hands-on experience in analyzing web and mobile app data, including user acquisition, retention, and LTV metrics.
Experience working with backend data systems like AWS Athena or Redshift and SQL for querying large datasets.
Experience with visualization tools like Looker and Tableau
Ability to communicate complex data insights clearly to non-technical stakeholders.
Strong collaboration skills and experience working cross-functionally with marketing, tracking, data engineering and data science teams.
Experience with Google Tag Manager (GTM), Adjust (MMP) and advanced Google Sheets skills are a plus


Additional Information

NEXT STEPS:

Unlock your perfect job with us today and make an application. The recruitment process includes:


Phone call with recruiter (expectations and circumstances)
Hiring Manager Interview
Case study
Interview with Stakeholders
Conclusion


BENEFITS:


30 days annual leave
Hybrid or remote working options
Flexible working hours
Company pension scheme
â‚¬50 public transport allowance
â‚¬100 allowance for glasses
A mix of Health and Wellbeing benefits
Bicycle leasing (Job Rad)
Berlin only - Subsidised canteen
Berlin only - Kindergarten
Charity fundraisers

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst (all genders)
Description:
THE ROLE & THE TEAM


As Business Intelligence Analyst Data Enablement, you play a pivotal role in driving business growth by unlocking the value of data in Zalando Lounge & Outlets.

As part of the central Data Platform Team and core team of Analytics experts, you will develop and improve the data landscape, data governance and reporting landscape for the second largest part of Zalando business . You will collaborate with diverse teams across Zalando (business, technical, data) to enable the use of our foundational data and analytics competencies, shaping the future of data usage to drive analysis, insights generation and decision making. Your responsibilities will also include supporting and enhancing the integration of our planning tooling (ANAPLAN), ensuring its seamless operation as part of our overall planning and reporting landscape. This involves stewarding data inputs and outputs, enabling strategic modules, and integrating ANAPLAN data with other tools like Tableau.

INCLUSIVE BY DESIGN

At Zalando, our vision is to be inclusive by design. And this vision starts with our hiring - we do not discriminate on the basis of gender identity, sexual orientation, personal expression, ethnicity, religious belief, or disability status. You are welcome to leave out your picture, age, or marital status from your application. We only assess candidates on their qualifications and merit.

We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. Feel free to inform us of any accommodations you may need, so we can best support you throughout the hiring process.

do.BETTER - our diversity & inclusion strategy https //corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/dobetter-our-diversity-and-inclusion-strategy

Our employee resource groups https //corporate.zalando.com/en/our-impact/our-employee-resource-groups


WHAT WEâ€™D LOVE YOU TO DO (AND LOVE DOING)


Business & Data



You identify data requirements and translate into functional requirements for data engineers, following best practices and developing new data products, acting as the data steward for core data domains
Support the design, data modeling, maintenance, and stewardship of key data layers and metrics, including those used in planning and reporting tools such as ANAPLAN (planning tool) and Tableau (BI tool).
Support data quality initiatives, ensuring that datasets meet governance standards and that documentation is up-to-date.



Reporting



Assist in curating data sources and ensuring seamless integration into reporting and planning tools like Tableau and ANAPLAN.



Data Enablement & Governance



Educate end users and data professionals on key data topics, including new datasets, data modeling best practices, reporting principles, and the broader data landscape.
Act as a champion for scalable and efficient data practices, balancing business needs with long-term platform sustainability.




WE'D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF




A degree in Business, Economics, Computer Science, Data Analytics or similar areas
Proven track record of >3 years experience in Business Intelligence or Business Analytics in an enterprise environment
Good understanding of data warehousing and analytical methods (e.g. databases and data structures, descriptive and diagnostic data analysis)
Solid knowledge of SQL and data modeling. Hands-on experience with Tableau > 1 year
Excellent root cause analysis and data related problem-solving skills are your strengths. You are a driver for change and enthusiastic about data, people and processes
Good project management and stakeholder management skills
Exposure to financial planning workflows and data integration is a strong plus.



If you have what it takes, we encourage you to apply even if you don't meet every requirement. You may just be the right candidate for this or other roles!


OUR OFFER


Zalando provides a range of benefits, hereâ€™s an overview of what you can expect. Ask your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about what we offer.



Employee shares program
40% off fashion and beauty products sold and shipped by Zalando, 30% off Zalando, discounts from external partners
Two paid volunteering days a year
Hybrid working model with up to 60% remote per week, actual practice is up to each team to best support their collaboration
Work from abroad for up to 30 working days a year
27 days of vacation a year to start
Relocation assistance available (subject to prior agreement)
Family services, including counseling and support
Health and wellbeing options (including Gympass)
Mental health support and coaching are available
Drive your development through our training platform and biannual peer-to-peer review



Learn all about Zalando and our values here https //jobs.zalando.com/en/?gh_src=22377bdd1us

About Lounge By Zalando

Lounge by Zalando is an online shopping club for fashion and lifestyle products in 17 European countries. We offer our members daily, time-limited sale campaigns with discounts of up to 75% off the recommended retail price. However, Lounge by Zalando is so much more than discounts. Our strength lies in our focus on fashion from sought-after labels to niche brands, from famous international names to trendy luxury brands, we make sure to meet the fashion taste of all our customers, who are always on the hunt for the best products at the best prices. Working with our brand partners, we're pioneering innovative supply-chain and production processes and offer them an impactful and smart solution, creating a new way to shop for fashion - and a new way to sell it.

https //www.zalando-lounge.de


Please note that all applications must be completed using the online form - we do not accept applications via email.

Title: BI Analyst (m/w/d)
Description:
Shape our growth with your expertise and personality.

We are a team of more than 1,600 colleagues with the mission to ensure the reliable and affordable supply of high-quality medicines. Aristo Pharma was founded in 2008 through the merger of several traditional German pharmaceutical companies. Today, the group includes a headquarters in Berlin, its own logistics center, five production sites in Germany and Spain, as well as international sales locations. We market generics, prescription original products, and OTC products in 14 countries, making us a well-established player in the pharmaceutical market.

To support our MB Finance department, we are looking to fill a permanent position at our Berlin location as soon as possible:

BI Analyst (m/w/d)

Title: Data & AI Strategist (f/m/d)
Description:
The role sits at the intersection of IT, business and innovation, developing data & AI strategies within Siemens IT, fundamentally supporting our business, leveraging Data, AI and GenAI to drive transformational change.

What We Offer You


An attractive renumeration package
Access to employee share plans
30 days of paid vacation and a variety of flexible work schedules that allow time off for you and your family
2 to 3 days of mobile working per week as a global standard
Diverse health and wellness offerings
Barrier-free locations


Since each of over 300,000 employees feels that other benefits are particularly important, and we cannot list our entire benefit portfolio here, you can find more information here.

The individual benefits are subject to regulatory, contractual, or corporate conditions.

Youâ€™ll make an impact by


Data & AI Strategy Development
Developing and implementing data and AI strategies that align with our business and IT goals, driving strategic value and ensuring that our AI and data efforts have a measurable impact.
Leading the way in AI adoption â€” moving from initial experiments to fully scaled solutions that improve decision-making and efficiency.
Staying at the forefront of AI innovation, including emerging technologies like agentive AI, large language models, and autonomous systems.
Building and maintaining relationships with key technology partners, research institutions, and industry thought leaders.
AI & Data-Driven Operating Models
Designing operating models that leverage AI and data by integrating automation and predictive insights into our business processes.
Collaborating with business and IT leaders to embed AI and data capabilities into workflows, driving transformation and new business approaches.
Encouraging a culture of data-driven decision-making by ensuring that everyone has access to high-quality, well-governed data.
Developing and implementing change management strategies that support the transition to AI-enhanced operating models.
AI & Data Governance and Enablement
Helping to evolve our frameworks for AI and data governance to ensure that our solutions are scalable, ethical, and compliant.
Fostering AI and data literacy across Siemens by equipping teams with the skills and tools needed to effectively utilize AI and advanced analytics.
Collaboration & Influence
Working closely with relevant Centers of Excellence (CoEs) and internal innovation programs to define and standardize best practices, supporting the acceleration of AI adoption.
Engaging with senior leadership to influence decisions on AI and data investments, ensuring alignment with our long-term goals.
Supporting the continual development of our internal strategy capabilities â€” beyond just data & AI.


This Is How You'll Win Us Over


Education
Masterâ€™s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, Business, or a related field.
Experience & Skills
At least 5 years of experience in AI, data strategy, analytics, or digital transformation, with a strong track record of implementing AI and data projects on an enterprise scale.
Background in consulting, enterprise AI leadership, or AI-first startups.
Proven expertise in change management, guiding organizations through AI-driven transitions.
Strong problem-solving, strategic thinking, and program management abilities.
Excellent communication and stakeholder engagement skills, with the ability for influencing senior executives and cross-functional teams.
Strong interest and extensive knowledge within the topics AI & Data.


You are much more than your qualifications, and we believe in the potential of every single candidate. We look forward to getting to know you!

Your individual personality and perspective are important to us. We create a working environment that reflects the diversity of the society and support you in your personal and professional development. Letâ€™s get to know your authentic personality and create a better future together with us. As an equal-opportunity employer we are happy to consider applications from individuals with disabilities.

About Us

We know that our business thrives only when our people thrive and unlock their full potential. Thatâ€™s why you are always our top priority. Our global, diverse team is ready to support, challenge, and inspire you, helping you grow in countless ways. Together, weâ€™ll embark on an exciting journey of discovery. Who knows where this path will lead? Join us and take an active role in shaping your future!

www.siemens.de/careers â€“ if you would like to find out more about jobs & careers at Siemens.

FAQ â€“ if you need further information on the application process.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst (all genders)
Description:
The role in a Snapshot

Are you passionate about disrupting the future of education and to make a real impact? Do you want a career in an edtech company that is innovative and rewarding? Join us and enjoy working alongside an international team of talented thinkers, doers and magic makers.

We are seeking a passionate and experienced Marketing Data Analyst to join our central Data Team. You will play a key role in developing and maintaining our BI infrastructure, overseeing data governance as well as driving actionable insights and making direct impact on efficiency of marketing expenditures.

Location

Berlin (Hybrid)

Your Role in our Mission


Partner closely with Marketing leaders and stakeholders to shape the marketing strategy through data-driven insights and impactful analysis.
Provide and present reports that are actionable for business departments and support the decision making process.
Work closely with Data Analysts and Data Engineers, support and mentor colleagues within Data & business teams to build, maintain and improve the set of current dashboards applying best Business Intelligence practices.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define, refine, organize and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) that align with business objectives.
Design and develop Data Models that empowers end users to answer their own questions.
Drive adaptation of new tools & technologies in BI area to maintain a clean, accurate, and efficient data governance framework.
Contribute to data-driven decision making through applying advanced analytics and statistics techniques for assessment of marketing and product tests.


What Will You Bring


Approximately 2 years of experience as a Business Intelligence Analyst / Data Analyst or related role.
Strong Marketing analytics background, with proven experience in digital marketing projects and proven experience in building and evaluating attribution models
Proven proficiency in SQL, with strong experience in building clean and meaningful tables.
Exceptional data storytelling skills, a strong understanding of statistics, and hands-on experience with leading BI tools, specifically Tableau and Superset.
Solid understanding of data warehousing concepts, data governance principles, and ETL processes.
Experience with DBT and Amazon Web Services or other cloud computer platforms
Strong problem solving, analytical thinking and organizational qualities.
Strong communication skills, and ability to effectively collaborate with stakeholders at all levels.


Our way to develop your full potential:


Flexible & focused working: Benefit from our hybrid working model with 2-3 flexible days per week and a Meeting Free Friday for undisturbed productivity.
We grow together: Continue your career with clear development paths and our Spark! Growth & Development program. Get access to 1000s of courses on LinkedIn Learning, our Spark! Mentorship program and monthly learning sessions. Take advantage of 30 free learning sessions to experience GoStudent for yourself
Work Smart, Play Hard: Our regular team and office events ensure a good atmosphere. We believe in team spirit, celebrating together and having lots of fun.
Strength through community: Get involved in one of our GoStudent Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) and stand up for issues that are close to your heart.
All-round support: We are there for you 24/7. Benefit from a comprehensive Employee Support Program - not only for you, but also for your loved ones.


Openness Statement

We value your unique skills and passion. We don't hire based on age, gender, nationality or political opinion - we value your talent and motivation. Even if you're a unicorn - just like GoStudent: do you believe in having a positive impact? Then apply, even if you don't meet all the requirements. Diversity makes us more creative, more innovative and stronger.

Want to find out more? Then visit our career page â€œwho we areâ€!

If you are ready to rethink education with us, develop yourself in an ambitious team and have a real impact - then apply now! ðŸš€

Please upload your CV in PDF format, preferably in English as DOC format may not be supported.

Disclose Privacy & Compliance Information

Title: Content Data Analyst
Description:
About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, people from all over the world have booked more than 200 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 800 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 15 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team mission

As a Content Data Analyst, you'll build tooling and perform data analysis to enhance conversion rates and user experience. Working closely with the Merchandising and Category team, you'll ensure data accuracy, create insightful reports, and identify opportunities for content and navigation improvements. You'll develop actionable plans, and support business cases with data insights.

The Merchandising and Category Content Innovation teamâ€™s mission is to enable travelers to easily explore our destinations and categories by providing an intuitive and inspiring discovery experience. Our team curates, organizes and presents our inventory throughout the customer journey, seeding and scaling innovative solutions.

You Will


Design and implement automated data solutions such as dashboards and customized reports.
Ensure the quality, accuracy, and reliability of data through validation processes.
Conduct in-depth analysis of navigation paths and overall performance of our landing pages, gathering insights that uncover opportunities for improvements.
Define targets and track key performance indicators related to content and navigation.
Explore large datasets, give meaning to data and numbers, identify opportunities and issues, and present findings to stakeholders.
Leverage insights to influence roadmaps and create buy-in across departments. Partner with the Merchandising and Categories team to build compelling business cases for new ideas, backed by data and quantitative insights.
Play an active role in the companywide roadmaps (e.g analytics) by identifying and communicating our needs.


Who You Are


4+ years of professional experience in Analytics, Business Intelligence role, or related field in an e-commerce business (hospitality or travel industry is a plus).
Solid experience in tools to extract, analyze and visualize data, such as Looker, Databricks, Indicative, SQL. (Python, nice to have).
Experience in developing and implementing automated reporting solutions.
Strong ability to interpret complex data sets and translate findings into actionable insights.
Ability to understand user behaviour and meaning behind the numbers and a track record in sharing insights to business stakeholders
Attention to detail to ensure data accuracy and reliability.
Problem-solving skills including the ability to navigate ambiguity with an eye for identifying trends and opportunities.
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously, prioritizing tasks to meet deadlines and effectively handling ambiguity within projects.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English.


How We Set You Up For Success


Invest in your development with an annual personal growth budget
Enjoy flexibility with a hybrid work-from-home and telecommuting policy
Save on transportation costs with discounted public transportation tickets
Support your loved ones with generous maternity and paternity leave policies


And more...

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal-opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.

Important notice: Protect yourself from recruitment scams

We want to ensure your safety during the application process. Please be aware of potential scammers impersonating GetYourGuide recruiters. Remember, GetYourGuide never requests payment or sensitive personal information during recruitment. All official job opportunities are exclusively posted on our Careers page. If you suspect fraudulent activity, report it to jobs@getyourguide.com. Stay vigilant and protect yourself from recruitment scams.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
About Yepoda

At Yepoda, Korean effectiveness meets sustainable solutions: our mindfully produced skincare products are made with love in Korea. Our mission is to bring the best beauty innovations from Korea straight to Europe â€“ without ever compromising on our values, quality, and sustainability. All our products are made with the best natural and active ingredients, are vegan and cruelty-free. We aim to make the K-Beauty routine easy, effective, and fun.

Founded in 2020 and located in the heart of Berlin, our beauty start-up is home to a vibrant team of over 80 brilliant human beings from around the globe. Together, we're shaping Yepoda's story.

We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst to support our growing Data team at Yepoda. In this role, you will lead impactful analytics projects across the companyâ€”driving strategic decisions through advanced modeling, cross-functional collaboration, and clear communication of insights.

Your Tasks


Advanced Analytics & Modeling: Build robust data models and perform deep-dive analysis to support initiatives such as forecasting, churn prediction, cohort analysis and marketing performance evaluation.
Cross-functional Collaboration: Partner with teams across marketing, product, and operations to identify data needs and deliver actionable insights.
Marketing Data Expertise: Analyze performance from paid marketing campaigns, influencer activities, and web traffic using platforms like GA4 to optimize ROI and audience engagement.
Dashboard Development: Design and maintain user-friendly dashboards using Looker Studio (or similar tools) to support both high-level KPIs and day-to-day operations.
Self-Service Analytics: Oversee the progress and usage of self-service analytics tools, ensuring they are reliable, accessible, and effective for business users.
Mentorship: Guide and support analytics interns, providing feedback, structure, and learning opportunities.
Stakeholder Engagement: Translate analytical findings into clear, actionable recommendations for both technical and non-technical audiences.
Project Management: Prioritize and manage multiple analytics projects, balancing speed with accuracy and business value.


Your Profile


4+ years of hands-on experience in data analytics or a similar role.
Strong foundation in statistics, data modeling, and data interpretation.
Proficient in Python, SQL, Looker Studio, dbt, git, and Jupyter Notebook.
Experience with marketing analytics, including data from paid ads, influencer marketing, and GA4.
Solid understanding of e-commerce and business intelligence workflows.
Proven ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams and manage stakeholder relationships.
Strong communication, problem-solving, and critical thinking skills.
Self-starter with a proactive mindset and a willingness to mentor others.
Experience managing or supporting small-scale projects with multiple deliverables.


What We Offer


Dynamic Environment: The opportunity to work in a start-up environment surrounded by a passionate and dedicated team.
Accelerate Your Career: Take on responsibility from day 1, with room for professional growth and advancement as the company continues to expand.
Inspiring Workspace: Located in the heart of Berlin's Prenzlauer Berg, a dog-friendly office, with free drinks and snacks.
Hybrid Working: We understand that sometimes you get more stuff done from home and need a change of scenery.
We Value Diversity: We seek to build an inclusive workplace that welcomes people from all different backgrounds. A welcoming, international, dedicated team with flat hierarchies and trust by default.
Employee Discounts: Youâ€™ll get to enjoy the Yepoda products at a discount and share it with friends and family.
Unique add-ons: Enjoy an Urban Sports membership package to help you stay active and healthy.


Would you like to be part of the team? Then we'd love to hear from you! ðŸ«°âœ¨

Make sure to apply by clicking on the â€œApply for this jobâ€ button below. Please upload your CV and Cover Letter in English language. Our Talent Acquisition team will review your application and get back to you as soon as possible.

At Yepoda we are dedicated to providing equal employment opportunities to all individuals, regardless of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, national origin, citizenship, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, parental status, disability, or any other status protected by applicable law.

Title: BESS Data Analyst (m/w/d) for Equipment Health Monitoring
Description:
Job Description

At RollsRoyce Powersystems we develop and build Battery Energy Storage Systems (BESS). Additionally, we offer Long-Term Service Agreements (LTSA). In order to ensure the highest availability possible, we analyze operational data and predict on future scenarios. For this work we need a Data Analyst to develop and improve our Dashboards for our Equipment Health Monitoring (EHM). Therefore, this role is part of our Service Team for BESS.

Tasks â€“ What To Expect From Us


Support our Equipment Health Monitoring Team to create Dashboards for different type of users on our Cloud platform.
Analyzing in-field battery energy storage systems.
Calculating and comparing health and performance KPIs between in-field systems.
In case of on-site problems, perform data analysis and troubleshoot the problems in collaboration with the service team and with engineers.
Create detailed reports describing the issues, root causes, and suggested remedies.
Cooperate with our suppliers and their technical teams.


Qualifications â€“ Who We Are Looking For


Background in electrical engineering and system control and automation.
Very good knowledge of battery energy storage systems and new technologies such as microgrids.
Ideally, previous experience in the battery energy storage system industry.
Very good knowledge of data analysis tools (mainly python) and their different libraries. (Pandas, NumPy, Seaborn and visualization libraries such as Matplotlib, Plotly). Experience in Apache PySpark is a plus.
Proficiency in English and German both written and spoken.
You are able to work independently and have a problem-solving mindset.


Why Rolls-Royce Power Systems â€“ What You Will Get


Company-owned health insurance BKK MTU for our employees and their family members
Comprehensive corporate health management including a company fitness program (EGYM Wellpass)
Attractive company pension scheme â€“ Save for your retirement with us!
Disability insurance â€“ Protection for all cases!
Mobility support in everyday life â€“ JobTicket and JobRad
Corporate benefits program â€“ Great employee discounts on numerous strong brands


We are an equal opportunities employer. Weâ€™re committed to developing a diverse workforce and an inclusive working environment. We believe that people from different backgrounds and cultures give us different perspectives. And the more perspectives we have, the more successful weâ€™ll be. By building a culture of respect and appreciation, we give everyone who works here the opportunity to realise their full potential. You can learn more about our global Inclusion strategy here.

Your contact person

Ana Maria De Los Rios

careers@ps.rolls-royce.com

Note: Please apply exclusively online through our career portal. Applications through other channels (especially via email) cannot be considered.

Type of Contract

Permanent

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst (w/m/d)
Description:
Company Description

At Enpal, we are pursuing the dream of building the largest renewable community in Europe. How do we make that happen? Enpal finally simplifies providing solar energy: We rent out solar systems, electricity storage, and wall boxes at an all-inclusive rate, supplemented by a favorable green electricity tariff; all intelligently connected to form an integrated overall solution. True to the motto "digital, decentralized, and 100% renewable", our heart beats both for the rapid development of a company and for combating the greatest challenge of our generation - climate change.

Job Description


Work closely with the Heat Pump division stakeholders to design, build, and maintain automated data pipelines and ensure the best-in-class reporting infrastructure.
Implement and maintain automated Reporting for different business units to provide visibility and performance tracking across segments.
Develop deep knowledge of customer journey processes and use it to empower the business stakeholders to optimize the conversion funnel and achieve operational excellence.



Qualifications


5+ years of relevant experience in business intelligence, data analytics or similar roles.
Enthusiasm for working in dynamic, rapidly changing environments.
Strong ability to analyse data, identify patterns, and communicate. technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a proven track record in automating data pipelines.
Exposure to Python for data analysis (e.g. pandas).
Our BI stack includes Snowflake, Streamlit, PowerBI and dbt. Familiarity with the two latter ones is required/desired.
High proficiency in SQL and ETL processes.



Additional Information


The chance to be part of a fast-growing and future-oriented startup: we are one of the biggest players in the solar business.
A hybrid work model, the ability to come to our Berlin office every now and then for in person discussions and events, or to be there all the time - you decide.
Work with the best in the industry and grow with us: thereâ€™s plenty of room for your ideas.
Help to make the world a bit better: we are all about green energy.



At Enpal, we are proud of the diversity of our team. No decisions are made based on skin color, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or age, either during recruitment or employment. We strongly encourage women, neurodivergent people, people of color, and LGBTQ(+) people to apply. Enpal stands for a safe workplace and takes action against discrimination and harassment of any kind.

Title: Marketing/Product Data Analyst (m/f/x)
Description:
Carhartt WIP is part of the WIP Trading AG. Our family-owned business group started as a licensee and European distributor of the US workwear manufacturer Carhartt in the early 1990s. Since then, it develops its own collections based on workwear originals.




Carhartt Work In Progress aims to continuously progress and evolve, without ever losing sight of its origins. Over the course of the past two decades, our business has developed organically, along with its customers, the culture that surrounds the brand, and its employees who have helped shape what Carhartt WIP is today.




As a Data & Analytics Specialist (m/f/x) at Carhartt WIP, you will play a key role in enabling data-driven decision-making across our e-commerce teams. From leading analytics projects to managing BI systems and dashboards, you'll turn data into actionable insights that support business growth. This role requires a strong technical foundation, a deep understanding of the e-commerce landscape, and a proactive, hands-on mindset to drive meaningful impact across departments.




Your responsibilities:

Drive and execute analytics projects to support data-driven decision-making across e-commerce teams, including Paid Marketing, CRM, and Product.
Develop and analyze customer segments and audiences to drive personalized marketing, customer retention, and lifetime value.
Collaborate closely with internal stakeholders and external service providers, including ERP and BI teams.
Own and manage BI systems used within e-commerce (i.e. Looker, Power BI, Google Analytics), ensuring scalability, usability, and data integrity.
Design, build, and maintain key performance dashboards that provide actionable insights for e-commerce stakeholders.
Support tracking implementation (i.e. Google Tag Manager, Firebase, Adjust) and define relevant KPIs to effectively monitor and optimize business performance.
Translate complex business questions into analytical approaches. Present insights to stakeholders and product owners, turning data into action and supporting customer strategy.
Promote a data-driven mindset within the team. Provide methodological guidance and mentorship to junior colleagues, contributing to team development and knowledge-sharing.




Your Profile:

Relevant experience leveraging customer data to answer business questions and drive targeting strategies, including advanced statistical analysis. Strong quantitative background with a degree in Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Strong technical understanding of ERP systems, CommerceTools and data warehouse (DWH) architectures.
Deep knowledge of marketing and e-commerce analytics; hands-on experience working with tracking data (web and app) and integrating multiple data sources.
Advanced skills in data methodologies and technologies (Python and SQL) and visualization tools, e.g. Looker and Power BI.
Proven experience in a data-driven role within e-commerce or a similar digital environment.
Fast learner and problem solver; proactive, analytical, and solution-oriented team player.
Strong communicator with the ability to tell data stories and bridge commercial and technical perspectives; excellent written and spoken English; proficiency in German is an advantage.




Your Location:

Berlin / Germany

Show more

  • Du konntest bereits erste Erfahrungen in einer analytischen Position im Umgang mit Daten und in der Erstellung von BI-LÃ¶sungen mit BI-Tools (z.â€¯B. Power BI) sammeln
  • Deine Kenntnisse in Programmiersprachen wie vorrangig SQL, aber auch Python oder R, sind von Vorteil und helfen dir, tiefer in die Analyseprozesse einzutauchen
  • Komplexe ZusammenhÃ¤nge schrecken dich nicht ab â€“ du hast Freude daran, aus Daten verstÃ¤ndliche Erkenntnisse zu machen
  • Du arbeitest gerne strukturiert, denkst eigeninitiativ mit und kommunizierst offen im Team und gegenÃ¼ber Stakeholdern
  • Verhandlungssichere Deutschkenntnisse bringst du ebenso mit, da du im Austausch mit internen und externen Stakeholdern auf Deutsch kommunizierst


Das ist uns wichtig:

Unser Anspruch ist es, allen Kandidat:innen bei gleicher Eignung die gleichen Chancen fÃ¼r den Einstieg bei uns zu bieten. Wir fÃ¶rdern aktiv die Vielfalt und das Miteinander in unseren Teams. Wir schÃ¤tzen jede Bewerbung, unabhÃ¤ngig von Geschlecht, NationalitÃ¤t, ethnischer und sozialer Herkunft, Religion, Weltanschauung, Behinderung, Alter, Dauer der Arbeitslosigkeit sowie sexueller Orientierung und IdentitÃ¤t.

Chancengleichheit und selbstbestimmte Teilhabe Schwerbehinderter und Gleichgestellter sowie eine respektvolle Zusammenarbeit sind innerhalb des DB Konzerns fest verankerte GrundsÃ¤tze. Deshalb werden schwerbehinderte und gleichgestellte Bewerber:innen bei gleicher Eignung bevorzugt berÃ¼cksichtigt.

Title: Data Analyst:in (d/m/w) Sales Operations
Description:
Sales Operations bei TS Media schafft die Grundlage dafÃ¼r, dass unser Vertrieb sich voll auf Marktbearbeitung und AbschlÃ¼sse konzentrieren kann. Wir ermÃ¶glichen Sales maximale Wirkung durch klare Strukturen, verlÃ¤ssliche Systeme und datenbasierte Verkaufssteuerung.

Unser Team verantwortet die gesamte Auftragsabwicklung und Faktura, unterstÃ¼tzt mit KPIs und Dashboards und entwickelt sowie betreut den Tech-Stack von TS Media â€“ vom ERP/CRM Ã¼ber Selfservice-Plattformen bis hin zu Automatisierungen und Integrationen.

Dabei entwickeln wir uns stetig weiter: von einem volumengetriebenen Auftragsmanagement hin zu einem kompetenzorientierten Tech- und Data-Enabler. Unser Anspruch ist es, manuelle AufwÃ¤nde durch intelligente Automatisierungen zu minimieren und skalierbare LÃ¶sungen zu schaffen.

Das sind Deine Aufgaben:


Reports & Dashboards: Du planst, erstellst und pflegst Dashboards und Reports fÃ¼r unsere Stakeholder:innen â€“ Sales, Produkt, Marketing, Controlling und GeschÃ¤ftsfÃ¼hrung.
Ad-hoc Analysen: Du kennst unsere Daten und kannst schnelle, fundierte Antworten auf individuelle Fragestellungen unserer Stakeholder:innen geben.
Projektmanagement: Du leitest die Konzeption und Umsetzung von datengetriebenen Projekten â€“ von der Anforderungsaufnahme Ã¼ber die Umsetzung bis hin zur Kommunikation der Ergebnisse.
Advanced Analytics: Du entwickelst Prognosemodelle (z.B. Sales Forecasts, Churn Prediction, Lead Scoring) und setzt fortschrittliche Analysen wie Zeitreihenanalysen, Clusteranalysen oder Regressionsanalysen ein, um neue Insights fÃ¼r den Vertrieb zu generieren.


Das bringst Du mit:


Relevanter Hintergrund: Du hast ein abgeschlossenes relevantes Studium oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung sowie entsprechende Berufserfahrung.
Reportingerfahrung: Du hast mindestens zwei Jahre relevante Erfahrung im Aufbau von Reports und Dashboards, idealerweise mit Looker Studio oder vergleichbaren Tools.
SQL-Kenntnisse: Du bist sicher im Umgang mit SQL, idealerweise in Kombination mit BigQuery.
Python-Kenntnisse: Du hast praktische Erfahrung mit Python und relevanten Paketen wie Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-Learn oder Matplotlib sowie solide statistische Grundkenntnisse.
Erfahrung mit Tracking-Daten: Idealerweise hast Du Erfahrung im Umgang mit Web- und Apptracking-Daten (z.B. Adobe Analytics).
Kenntnisse in fortgeschrittenen Analysemethoden: Du bist vertraut mit Methoden wie Regressionsanalysen, Clusteranalysen, Zeitreihenanalysen, Predictive Modelling und Kohortenanalysen im B2B-Sales-Umfeld.
KommunikationsstÃ¤rke: Du kannst komplexe Anforderungen sicher mit Stakeholder:innen besprechen und datenbasierte Insights klar und verstÃ¤ndlich aufbereiten.
Sprachkenntnisse: Du verfÃ¼gst Ã¼ber sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift (mindestens Niveau B2).


Das bieten wir Dir:


Kreativer Freiraum in einem Team, in dem Ideen geschÃ¤tzt werden und Du Deine Visionen in einem innovativen Medienunternehmen im Herzen Berlins umsetzen kannst
Flache Hierarchien mit kurzen Entscheidungswegen und direkter Kommunikation
Bezuschusstes BVG-Firmenticket und Zuschuss zur betrieblichen Altersvorsorge
Kostenloses Digital-Abonnement von Tagesspiegel & Tagesspiegel Plus, Handelsblatt und die Zeit
MÃ¶glichkeiten zur beruflichen Weiterentwicklung durch die Online-Plattform Masterplan, um Deine Karriere voranzutreiben
Eine 38,5-Stunden-Woche mit 30 Tagen Urlaub (bei einer Vollzeitstelle), damit Du ausreichend Zeit hast, um Dich zu erholen
Flexible Arbeitszeiten und mobiles Arbeiten bis zu 50%


Jede Nachricht erzÃ¤hlt eine eigene Geschichte â€“ und so ist es auch mit den Menschen, die bei uns arbeiten. Beim Tagesspiegel schÃ¤tzen wir die Vielfalt unserer Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeiter und sind fest davon Ã¼berzeugt, dass unterschiedliche Perspektiven unsere Arbeit bereichern.

Wir setzen uns fÃ¼r Chancengleichheit ein und fÃ¶rdern einen respektvollen Umgang miteinander. UnabhÃ¤ngig von Herkunft, Geschlecht, Religion, Alter oder sexueller IdentitÃ¤t â€“ bei uns bist Du willkommen. Lass uns gemeinsam ein inspirierendes Arbeitsumfeld schaffen, in dem jeder seine Einzigartigkeit einbringen kann!

Du denkst, wir sollten uns kennenlernen?

Wenn Du bereit bist, Deine FÃ¤higkeiten in einem inspirierenden Team einzusetzen und einen echten Unterschied zu machen, dann bewirb Dich jetzt Ã¼ber unser Bewerbungsportal https://verlagsjobs.tagesspiegel.de/ und sende uns Deine Bewerbungsunterlagen. Title: Data Analyst Intern - Mandatory University Internship (f/m/d)
Description:
Are you looking for a mandatory internship as part of your university program? Join our Machine Learning team at Airteam and gain hands-on experience in a fast-paced startup environment!




We're looking for a Data Analyst Intern who is enrolled in a university program and needs to complete a compulsory internship. Youâ€™ll work with real data, support key business decisions, and gain exposure to cloud technologies, BI tools, and cross-functional collaboration.




Start: ASAP | Location: Remote/hybrid possible




For at least 6 months.


Tasks


Your Responsibilities:





Design Looker Studio dashboards tailored to business needs


Collaborate with Data Engineers: create tickets, track progress, validate outputs


Perform quality checks on existing data pipelines


Implement a data warehouse layer using predefined schema and basic ETL processes


Import and transform data in Looker Studio and support teams with dashboard setup


Support data cleanup efforts to ensure accuracy and consistency


Assist departments like Customer Success, Finance, Product, and Marketing with analytics



Requirements



Youâ€™re enrolled in a university program and looking for a mandatory internship


Basic experience with GCP or other cloud platforms


Familiarity with SQL for querying and manipulating data


Basic understanding of Python


Experience with data visualization and analytics


Strong analytical thinking and good communication skills





Nice to Have:





Experience with data quality checks and pipeline validation


Knowledge of Looker Studio, BigQuery, ETL, or data warehousing


Understanding of customer and financial analytics



Benefits


Join Airteam!




Work with a fun, international team in a cool co-working space in the heart of Berlin. We offer flexible hours, hybrid work, and even workations. Youâ€™ll have the freedom to share your ideas and make an impact. Plus, we love team events and always support your well-being.




Important: This internship must be a mandatory part of your academic program (Pflichtpraktikum).




Apply now and kickstart your data career with us!

Title: Data Engineer/Analyst (gn)
Company: Intermate â€“ Full Service Social Media Agency
Description:
Job Description

ABOUT US

Since 2015, we've been disrupting influencer and social media marketing like few other agencies. We are currently establishing ourselves as one of the largest social powerhouses in the DACH region. With over 210 social-first employees, two in-house studios, our own production company, proprietary social technology, and media channels with over 1 million followers, we are at the forefront of the industry.

With locations in Berlin, Hamburg, and Cologne, we specialize in creation, project management, consulting, social media, performance marketing, and (post-)production.

Aufgaben

Your Responsibilities

As a Data Analyst / Data Engineer, you will play a crucial role in analyzing, managing, and working with our data sets and infrastructure. Your tasks will include:


Data Management & Optimization â€“ Take ownership of our data warehouse, ensuring high data quality, availability, and scalability.
Dashboard Development â€“ Support our teams and clients by developing and maintaining data dashboards that enable actionable insights.
Troubleshooting & Consulting â€“ Identify and resolve data issues while advising teams on best practices for data flows and architecture.
Collaboration with Client Teams â€“ Analyze the performance and effectiveness of social media brands, assets, and campaigns.
Lead Change through Data â€“ Present analytical results to internal and external stakeholders to enable data-driven decision-making.


Profil

Requirements

WHAT YOU BRING

We are looking for a highly motivated Data Analyst / Data Engineer with strong technical expertise and a passion for data-driven decision-making.

Must-Have Skills


Proven experience with data processing, analysis, and warehouse management (ideally with BigQuery).
Experience with data modeling and analysis in a modern data warehouse environment and/or statistical software packages (e.g., R, SPSS, Stata, SAS).
Hands-on experience with data visualization (e.g., Looker Studio, Looker).
Experience with statistical analysis (e.g., regression analysis, A/B-testing)


Nice-to-Have Skills


Experience in eCommerce data structures and business intelligence workflows.
Programming skills (SQL, Python preferred)for data automation and workflow optimization.
Experience with large language models and machine learning techniques.


PERSONAL ATTRIBUTES


Attention to Detail: You are highly analytical and love debugging complex data issues.
Strong Communicator: You can translate data insights into clear, actionable recommendations.
Language Skills: Fluent in German and proficient in English (written and spoken).


Soft Skills


Transparent Communication: You proactively share insights and collaborate across teams.
Ownership Mentality: You take full responsibility for your projects and results.
Interdisciplinary Collaboration: You can translate complex data concepts for non-technical teams.
Empathy: You build strong relationships with stakeholders and team members.


Wir bieten

Our Benefits â€“ Made For Mates.

Be the vibe.

Be the change.

Be a mate.

We believe: If you want to grow, you need space, energy, and people who support you. Our benefits provide exactly that.


Stay flexible â€“ the way you need it:


Work Should Fit Your Life, Not The Other Way Around. With Our Hybrid Model, You Decide Where You Perform Best â€“ In The Office Or Remotely. And For True Freedom

You can work from any EU country for up to 6 weeks a year.


Moments that matter â€“ time that's yours: 27 vacation days + your birthday off, because you're worth it. December 24th & 31st are on us â€“ for those special times with the people who matter most to you.


We care. You celebrate.


Move forward â€“ personally & professionally: You want to grow? We'll make room for it: With a â‚¬1,500 personal development budget per year, you can invest in what helps you move forward.


Be the change â€“ we'll support you.


Maintain balance â€“ body, mind & energy:
Urban Sports Club subsidy to help you clear your head.
Nilo.health membership for when you need mental strength. Because mates take care â€“ of themselves too.
Your benefit. Your choice. You decide what suits you best:
Givve Card â€“ â‚¬50 monthly for anything that makes your life better
Mobiko â€“ â‚¬65 for sustainable mobility
Pension plan subsidy â€“ â‚¬50 for your future
Team spirit â€“ together we achieve more: Regular team events, inspiring offsites, and a sense of togetherness you can feel. Because â€œBe a mateâ€ is more than just a phrase.
A work environment with vibe: High-quality equipment, stylish offices in Berlin, Hamburg, and Cologne. Snacks, drinks & monthly team lunches â€“ because the best conversations often start in the kitchen.


Important note

Please be advised that a valid work permit for Germany is required for non-EU citizens. Unfortunately, applications without a valid work permit and sufficient German language skills may not be considered.

Title: (Senior) Data Analyst (all genders)
Description:
Your role

We are seeking a curious and versatile Data Analyst who has strong SQL skills and has worked with Tableau to join our team of seven data professionals. The ideal candidate will possess exceptional analytical and problem solving skills, as well as solid communication skills enabling them to share analytical insights effectively with business stakeholders from marketing, operations and the executive layer. The person in this role will serve as a trusted advisor to the stakeholders and contribute to the overall health and quality of the data platform.


Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business requirements and translate them into data analysis tasks
Design and participate in the modelling of KPIs
Advise on and come up with performance indicators and proxies for visualisation of the success of different teams
Work with stakeholders to support them navigate the Data environment, understand and work with the reports relevant to them
Perform exploratory data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and insights that drive business outcomes
Create, verify and maintain visualisations to effectively communicate insights
Suggest actions, based on the data insights and work with teams to develop their strategies


Your profile


Bachelorâ€™s and Masterâ€™s degrees in Social Science or Statistics, with a solid track record as a Data Analyst and a strong emphasis on data manipulation.
Proficiency in SQL, hands-on experience with Google Analytics, GTM, Google Ads, and event data, as well as knowledge of data warehousing (BigQuery) and architecture, is desirable!
Hands-on experience with Tableau; experience with dbt, GetKlar, and TimeSquare is a significant plus!
Understanding of classic e-commerce KPIs and metrics, with the ability to contextualize each data point in relation to others
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret data and extract actionable insights
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with familiarity in multi-cultural environments


What we offer


An appealing discount on all of our products â€“ from essential oils to vitamins & nutrients
We offer 28 days of paid time off per year plus up to 5 days off between Christmas and New Year
The Urban Sports Club membership, Swapfiets bike rental and a subsidy for the BVG ticket
A healthy balance is important to us: we offer a flexible work model and 'workation'
Receive various discounts of up to more than 50 percent on attractive brands such as Flaconi, Bosch, Apple or Expedia
You will be given real ownership and plenty of room for new initiatives, as well as the opportunity to contribute your expertise and implement your great ideas
Inviting office spaces with access to plenty of organic teas and superfoods from around the world
We like to celebrate each other! Regular tea & office parties, Christmas and summer feasts and various influencer events such as Women's Day


Apply with your CV.

Contact

Philipp Klitscher

Apply for this job

About Us

Sunday Natural emerged from a long-standing passion and research in the fields of health, healing, and personal growth. The lack of natural, high-quality products on the market was the original motivation for founding Sunday Natural in 2013. We aim to produce the products we ourselves would love to buy â€“ as natural as possible, absolutely pure, free from any additives, and of the highest quality. In a strategic partnership with CVC, Sunday Natural is now one of Germany's most renowned quality manufacturers, with its own research and development department in Berlin. For the continuous improvement of our products, we collaborate with selected research institutes, scientists, therapists, farmers, and professional associations.

We take our ecological responsibility very seriously: Our entire range is therefore vegetarian, mostly vegan. We also go our own way when it comes to packaging: the majority of our products are packaged in glass and are therefore almost completely recyclable.

We have a diverse team of more than 240 employees from over 40 nationalities, still growing but at a sustainable rate. Our aim is to work in a collaborative, supportive and inclusive work environment with a diverse group of motivated, talented, and visionary colleagues.

We highly value equality of opportunity and inclusivity, and we would like to particularly encourage women and candidates from under-represented backgrounds to apply, even if you donâ€™t match with 100% of the requirements.

Your role

We are seeking a curious and versatile Data Analyst who has strong SQL skills and has worked with Tableau to join our team of seven data professionals. The ideal candidate will possess exceptional analytical and problem solving skills, as well as solid communication skills enabling them to share analytical insights effectively with business stakeholders from marketing, operations and the executive layer. The person in this role will serve as a trusted advisor to the stakeholders and contribute to the overall health and quality of the data platform.

  • Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business requirements and translate them into data analysis tasks
  • Design and participate in the modelling of KPIs
  • Advise on and come up with performance indicators and proxies for visualisation of the success of different teams
  • Work with stakeholders to support them navigate the Data environment, understand and work with the reports relevant to them
  • Perform exploratory data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and insights that drive business outcomes
  • Create, verify and maintain visualisations to effectively communicate insights
  • Suggest actions, based on the data insights and work with teams to develop their strategies

Your profile

  • Bachelorâ€™s and Masterâ€™s degrees in Social Science or Statistics, with a solid track record as a Data Analyst and a strong emphasis on data manipulation.
  • Proficiency in SQL, hands-on experience with Google Analytics, GTM, Google Ads, and event data, as well as knowledge of data warehousing (BigQuery) and architecture, is desirable!
  • Hands-on experience with Tableau; experience with dbt, GetKlar, and TimeSquare is a significant plus!
  • Understanding of classic e-commerce KPIs and metrics, with the ability to contextualize each data point in relation to others
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret data and extract actionable insights
  • Excellent communication and presentation skills, with familiarity in multi-cultural environments

What we offer

  • An appealing discount on all of our products â€“ from essential oils to vitamins & nutrients
  • We offer 28 days of paid time off per year plus up to 5 days off between Christmas and New Year
  • The Urban Sports Club membership, Swapfiets bike rental and a subsidy for the BVG ticket
  • A healthy balance is important to us: we offer a flexible work model and 'workation'
  • Receive various discounts of up to more than 50 percent on attractive brands such as Flaconi, Bosch, Apple or Expedia
  • You will be given real ownership and plenty of room for new initiatives, as well as the opportunity to contribute your expertise and implement your great ideas
  • Inviting office spaces with access to plenty of organic teas and superfoods from around the world
  • We like to celebrate each other! Regular tea & office parties, Christmas and summer feasts and various influencer events such as Women's Day

Apply with your CV.

Contact

Philipp Klitscher

Apply for this job

About Us

Sunday Natural emerged from a long-standing passion and research in the fields of health, healing, and personal growth. The lack of natural, high-quality products on the market was the original motivation for founding Sunday Natural in 2013. We aim to produce the products we ourselves would love to buy â€“ as natural as possible, absolutely pure, free from any additives, and of the highest quality. In a strategic partnership with CVC, Sunday Natural is now one of Germany's most renowned quality manufacturers, with its own research and development department in Berlin. For the continuous improvement of our products, we collaborate with selected research institutes, scientists, therapists, farmers, and professional associations.

We take our ecological responsibility very seriously: Our entire range is therefore vegetarian, mostly vegan. We also go our own way when it comes to packaging: the majority of our products are packaged in glass and are therefore almost completely recyclable.

We have a diverse team of more than 240 employees from over 40 nationalities, still growing but at a sustainable rate. Our aim is to work in a collaborative, supportive and inclusive work environment with a diverse group of motivated, talented, and visionary colleagues.

We highly value equality of opportunity and inclusivity, and we would like to particularly encourage women and candidates from under-represented backgrounds to apply, even if you donâ€™t match with 100% of the requirements.
