We prioritize evaluating applicants based solely on skills and potential, ensuring diversity with 50% international team members, 44% women, and 20% parents. Join us in building a workplace that celebrates diversity and individuality.

Discover the steps we took to create a discrimination-free hiring process .

At Qonto, the Data department counts 50+ talents, including 4 talents in the Customer Analytics team for which we are hiring.

We seek a Senior/Staff Data Analyst (Pricing) who will report to Nicolas , Lead Customer Analytics, and collaborate cross-functionally with Paolo , driving the Pricing Strategy and executing Go-To-Market plans.

Your work will directly impact our financial performance and customer satisfaction across Europe.

ðŸ‘©â€ðŸ’»ðŸ§‘â€ðŸ’» As a Senior Pricing Data Analyst at Qonto, you will:

  • Establish Qontoâ€™s inaugural pricing analytics framework â€”defining processes, guidelines, and experimentation protocolsâ€”to support this newly created function . (e.g., build experiment protocols)
  • Analyze current pricing strategy and its impact (e.g. introduction of annual billing, introduction of modular offer)
  • Conduct A/B tests to optimize our pricing offers across our markets.
  • Deliver insights and impactful recommendations to Paoloâ€™s Pricing team to make educated pricing decisions.
  • Provide dashboards to monitor the performance of our experiments/new pricing decisions.

ðŸš€ What you can expect

  • A fast-growing European FinTech
  • A highly data-driven company with business stakeholders strongly committed to this mindset
  • Enjoy the synergy between Data and Business teams, fully aligned with Qontoâ€™s vision, ensuring your work has both impact and visibility
  • Work within a team that not only possesses great technical knowledge and comes from various backgrounds, bringing a rich diversity of skills to the table
  • Strong culture of knowledge-sharing practices and continuous improvement
  • Our data teams are part of our Tech department, granting us easy access to our infrastructures while also supporting teamwork

ðŸ¤ Your Future Manager

Your manager will be Nicolas , Lead Customer Analytics and you will be working very closely with Paolo , Head of Pricing & Packaging.

His background?

After his experience in the consulting world (BCG), Nicolas joined Qonto 2 years ago in our Data Science team, he then took the lead of the Customer Analytics team since its creation in January.

What does he bring to the team?

Nicolas has a unique blend of technical expertise and business acumen, that helps the team drive impactful results. With 2 years at Qonto, he has an in-depth understanding of strategic initiatives and can help you navigate a multitude of topics (he already worked himself on some Pricing topics). He loves supporting & mentoring the team and fostering a collaborative environment!

ðŸ…About You

  • Expertise: You have 2+ years of expertise in data analysis and A/B testing in Pricing or Monetization, aimed at enhancing strategic business decisions in a similar Tech environment to Qonto. You master statistical and econometric methodologies.
  • Mastery: You can autonomously sort out and analyse data using SQL as well as Gsheet/Excel (Python/R is a plus), build interactive dashboards and select the right type of visualization to convey the message behind the data and, most importantly, to be actionable.
  • Customer Obsession: You are driven to solve high-impact business challenges and are committed to delivering solutions that create significant business value
  • Stakeholder management : You enjoy collaborating with business teams and possess effective communication skills. Beyond projects, offer your expertise in a consulting capacity to support our teams and C-levels on demand. Your quick, impactful interventions will help steer immediate decisions and strategies.
  • Language: You are fluent in English.

At Qonto we understand that true diversity isn't just about ticking boxes on a hiring checklist. Apply regardless of the boxes you tick! Who knows? You may have the missing piece of the puzzle we've been searching for all along.

ðŸŽ Perks

A tailor-made and dynamic career track. An inclusive work environment. And so much more to help you succeed.

  • Offices in Paris, Berlin, Milan, Barcelona, and Belgrade;
  • Tailor-made remote work policy depending on the job you apply for and where you live;
  • Competitive salary package;
  • A meal voucher;
  • Public transportation reimbursement (part or global);
  • A great health insurance (depending on the country);
  • Employee well-being initiatives: access to Moka Care to take care of your mental health and great offers for sports and wellness activities;
  • A progressive disability and parenthood policy (1 in 6 of Qonto employees is a parent!) and childcare benefits with selected partners;
  • Monthly team events.

ðŸ’¬ Our hiring process:

  • Interviews with your Talent Acquisition Manager and future managers
  • A remote exercise to demonstrate your skills and give you a taste of what working at Qonto could be like

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Unlocking the full potential of forests, both ecologically and emotionally.

Job Overview

Weâ€™re looking for a skilled Data Engineer to design, build, and maintain robust data pipelines and infrastructure focused on geospatial and temporal datasets. Youâ€™ll play a key role in processing complex environmental data, enabling real-time analytics, and supporting our mission to create a greener planet. If youâ€™re passionate about data systems, geospatial technology, and sustainability, weâ€™d love to hear from you!

Key Responsibilities


Data Pipeline Development: Design and implement scalable ETL/ELT pipelines to ingest, process, and transform geospatial and temporal data from diverse sources (e.g., satellite imagery, IoT sensors, historical records).
Geospatial Data Management: Optimize storage and querying of geospatial datasets using tools like PostGIS, GeoPandas, or similar technologies.
Temporal Data Processing: Build systems to handle time-series data, ensuring efficient analysis of trends and patterns over time.
Infrastructure Optimization: Develop and maintain data architectures (e.g., data lakes, warehouses) on cloud platforms to support high-volume geospatial and temporal workloads.
Collaboration: Partner with data scientists and product teams to deliver clean, reliable datasets for visualization, machine learning, and decision-making.
Performance Tuning: Monitor and enhance the performance of data systems, ensuring low-latency access to geospatial and temporal insights.
Data Quality & Security: Implement processes to ensure data accuracy, consistency, and compliance with privacy standards.


Required Skills & Qualifications


Experience: 3+ years in data engineering or a related role, with hands-on experience in geospatial and/or temporal data processing.
Programming: Proficiency in Python, SQL, and familiarity with languages like Java or Scala.
Geospatial Tools: Experience with geospatial libraries (e.g., GDAL, GeoPandas, QGIS) and databases (e.g., PostGIS).
Data Technologies: Knowledge of big data frameworks (e.g., Apache Spark, Kafka) and time-series databases (e.g., InfluxDB, TimescaleDB).
Cloud Expertise: Practical experience with cloud platforms (AWS or Azure) and their geospatial/temporal data services (e.g., BigQuery GIS, S3).
Problem-Solving: Strong analytical skills to tackle complex data challenges.
Education: Bachelorâ€™s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, GIS, or a related field (or equivalent experience).


Nice-to-Haves


Experience with environmental or sustainability-focused datasets.
Familiarity with real-time data streaming and processing.
Contributions to open-source geospatial or data engineering projects.


About Us

At Tree.ly, we are fully committed to climate protection and enhance the importance of forests as critical ecosystems through innovative business models. We connect companies and forest owners to sustainably and climate-resiliently manage forests through direct investments. Our vision is to create a future where forests are valued for their ecological services and managed sustainably in alignment with business interests.

Title: Online Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a detail-oriented individual with a passion for research and a good understanding of national and local geography? This freelance opportunity allows you to work at your own pace and from the comfort of your own home.

A Day in the Life of an Online Data Analyst:

In this role, you will be working on a project aimed at enhancing the content and quality of digital maps that are used by millions of people worldwide
Completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment such as verifying and comparing data, and determining the relevance and accuracy of information.

Join us today and be part of a dynamic and innovative team that is making a difference in the world!

TELUS Digital AI Community

Our global AI Community is a vibrant network of 1 million+ contributors from diverse backgrounds who help our customers collect, enhance, train, translate, and localize content to build better AI models. Become part of our growing community and make an impact supporting the machine learning models of some of the worldâ€™s largest brands.




Qualification Path:




No previous professional experience is required to apply to this role, however, working on this project will require you to pass the basic requirements and go through a standard assessment process. This is a part-time long-term project and your work will be subject to our standard quality assurance checks during the term of this agreement.

Basic Requirements

Full Professional Proficiency in English & German language
Being a resident in Germany for the last 2 Years consecutive years and having familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media, and cultural affairs in Germany
Ability to follow guidelines and conduct online research using search engines, online maps, and website information
Flexibility to work across a diverse set of task types, including maps, news, audio tasks, and relevance
Daily access to a broadband internet connection, computer, and relevant software

Assessment

In order to be hired into the program, youâ€™ll take an open book qualification exam that will determine your suitability for the position and complete ID verification. Our team will provide you with guidelines and learning materials before your qualification exam. You will be required to complete the exam in a specific timeframe but at your convenience.

Equal Opportunity

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for a contractual relationship without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status. At TELUS Digital AI, we are proud to offer equal opportunities and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive community. All aspects of selection are based on applicantsâ€™ qualifications, merits, competence, and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

Title: Senior Data Analyst (Revenue Intelligence)
Description:
Company Description

AUTODOC is the largest and fastest growing auto parts ecommerce platform in Europe.

Present across 27 countries with around 5,000 employees, AUTODOC generated revenue of over â‚¬1.3 billion in 2023, supplying more than 7.4 million active customers with its 5.8 million vehicle parts and accessories for car, truck, and motorcycle brands.

Curious minds, adventurous experts and tech-savvy professionals - one team, one billion euros revenue. Catch the ride!

Job Description

Identify and escalate negative and positive trends in main customer and category KPIs to boost the companyâ€™s growth and profitability.

Responsibilities


Conduct in-depth economic analyses on current trading performance, market research, demand forecasting, pricing strategies, and competitor analysis.
Develop and maintain economic models to predict key performance indicators (KPIs) such as sales, revenue, and customer behavior and monitor those against actual performance outcomes.
Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for growth.
Conduct and analyze A/B testing and other experiments to evaluate the impact of different marketing and pricing strategies.
Prepare clear and concise reports to communicate findings and recommendations to the management.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement data-driven solutions and drive business growth.



Job Requirements


Master's degree in Economics, Business and/or Finance, Econometrics, or a related quantitative field.
2-5 years of experience in economic analysis or FP&A, preferably within the e-commerce, retail or technology industry.
Proficiency in SQL.
Proficiency in statistical software such as Python, R or Stata.
Basic knowledge of causal inference methods.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to think critically and independently.
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Excellent communication and presentation skills with the ability to explain complex concepts to non-technical audiences.
Strong teamwork and collaboration skills.
Fluent English.



What do we offer?


Competitive salaries based on your professional experience
Fast growing international company with stable employment
Annual vacation and 1 additional day off on your birthday
Mental Wellbeing Program â€“ providing you and your immediate family members with free and confidential mental and physical health support services for a wide range of personal and work-related issues.
Opportunities for advancement, further trainings (over 650 courses on soft and hard skills on our e-learning platform) and coaching
Free English and German language classes
Referral Program with attractive incentives
Flexible working hours and hybrid work



Join us today and letâ€™s create a success story together!

Title: Data Analyst:in (d/m/w) Sales Operations
Description:
Sales Operations bei TS Media schafft die Grundlage dafÃ¼r, dass unser Vertrieb sich voll auf Marktbearbeitung und AbschlÃ¼sse konzentrieren kann. Wir ermÃ¶glichen Sales maximale Wirkung durch klare Strukturen, verlÃ¤ssliche Systeme und datenbasierte Verkaufssteuerung.

Unser Team verantwortet die gesamte Auftragsabwicklung und Faktura, unterstÃ¼tzt mit KPIs und Dashboards und entwickelt sowie betreut den Tech-Stack von TS Media â€“ vom ERP/CRM Ã¼ber Selfservice-Plattformen bis hin zu Automatisierungen und Integrationen.

Dabei entwickeln wir uns stetig weiter: von einem volumengetriebenen Auftragsmanagement hin zu einem kompetenzorientierten Tech- und Data-Enabler. Unser Anspruch ist es, manuelle AufwÃ¤nde durch intelligente Automatisierungen zu minimieren und skalierbare LÃ¶sungen zu schaffen.

Das sind Deine Aufgaben:


Reports & Dashboards: Du planst, erstellst und pflegst Dashboards und Reports fÃ¼r unsere Stakeholder:innen â€“ Sales, Produkt, Marketing, Controlling und GeschÃ¤ftsfÃ¼hrung.
Ad-hoc Analysen: Du kennst unsere Daten und kannst schnelle, fundierte Antworten auf individuelle Fragestellungen unserer Stakeholder:innen geben.
Projektmanagement: Du leitest die Konzeption und Umsetzung von datengetriebenen Projekten â€“ von der Anforderungsaufnahme Ã¼ber die Umsetzung bis hin zur Kommunikation der Ergebnisse.
Advanced Analytics: Du entwickelst Prognosemodelle (z.B. Sales Forecasts, Churn Prediction, Lead Scoring) und setzt fortschrittliche Analysen wie Zeitreihenanalysen, Clusteranalysen oder Regressionsanalysen ein, um neue Insights fÃ¼r den Vertrieb zu generieren.


Das bringst Du mit:


Relevanter Hintergrund: Du hast ein abgeschlossenes relevantes Studium oder eine vergleichbare Ausbildung sowie entsprechende Berufserfahrung.
Reportingerfahrung: Du hast mindestens zwei Jahre relevante Erfahrung im Aufbau von Reports und Dashboards, idealerweise mit Looker Studio oder vergleichbaren Tools.
SQL-Kenntnisse: Du bist sicher im Umgang mit SQL, idealerweise in Kombination mit BigQuery.
Python-Kenntnisse: Du hast praktische Erfahrung mit Python und relevanten Paketen wie Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-Learn oder Matplotlib sowie solide statistische Grundkenntnisse.
Erfahrung mit Tracking-Daten: Idealerweise hast Du Erfahrung im Umgang mit Web- und Apptracking-Daten (z.B. Adobe Analytics).
Kenntnisse in fortgeschrittenen Analysemethoden: Du bist vertraut mit Methoden wie Regressionsanalysen, Clusteranalysen, Zeitreihenanalysen, Predictive Modelling und Kohortenanalysen im B2B-Sales-Umfeld.
KommunikationsstÃ¤rke: Du kannst komplexe Anforderungen sicher mit Stakeholder:innen besprechen und datenbasierte Insights klar und verstÃ¤ndlich aufbereiten.
Sprachkenntnisse: Du verfÃ¼gst Ã¼ber sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift (mindestens Niveau B2).


Das bieten wir Dir:


Kreativer Freiraum in einem Team, in dem Ideen geschÃ¤tzt werden und Du Deine Visionen in einem innovativen Medienunternehmen im Herzen Berlins umsetzen kannst
Flache Hierarchien mit kurzen Entscheidungswegen und direkter Kommunikation
Bezuschusstes BVG-Firmenticket und Zuschuss zur betrieblichen Altersvorsorge
Kostenloses Digital-Abonnement von Tagesspiegel & Tagesspiegel Plus, Handelsblatt und die Zeit
MÃ¶glichkeiten zur beruflichen Weiterentwicklung durch die Online-Plattform Masterplan, um Deine Karriere voranzutreiben
Eine 38,5-Stunden-Woche mit 30 Tagen Urlaub (bei einer Vollzeitstelle), damit Du ausreichend Zeit hast, um Dich zu erholen
Flexible Arbeitszeiten und mobiles Arbeiten bis zu 50%


Jede Nachricht erzÃ¤hlt eine eigene Geschichte â€“ und so ist es auch mit den Menschen, die bei uns arbeiten. Beim Tagesspiegel schÃ¤tzen wir die Vielfalt unserer Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeiter und sind fest davon Ã¼berzeugt, dass unterschiedliche Perspektiven unsere Arbeit bereichern.

Wir setzen uns fÃ¼r Chancengleichheit ein und fÃ¶rdern einen respektvollen Umgang miteinander. UnabhÃ¤ngig von Herkunft, Geschlecht, Religion, Alter oder sexueller IdentitÃ¤t â€“ bei uns bist Du willkommen. Lass uns gemeinsam ein inspirierendes Arbeitsumfeld schaffen, in dem jeder seine Einzigartigkeit einbringen kann!

Du denkst, wir sollten uns kennenlernen?

Wenn Du bereit bist, Deine FÃ¤higkeiten in einem inspirierenden Team einzusetzen und einen echten Unterschied zu machen, dann bewirb Dich jetzt Ã¼ber unser Bewerbungsportal https://verlagsjobs.tagesspiegel.de/ und sende uns Deine Bewerbungsunterlagen. Gemeinsam erzÃ¤hlen wir Geschichten, die bewegen!

Wir freuen uns darauf, Dich kennenzulernen!

Title: Data Engineer/Analyst (gn)
Company: Intermate â€“ Full Service Social Media Agency
Description:
Job Description

ABOUT US

Since 2015, we've been disrupting influencer and social media marketing like few other agencies. We are currently establishing ourselves as one of the largest social powerhouses in the DACH region. With over 210 social-first employees, two in-house studios, our own production company, proprietary social technology, and media channels with over 1 million followers, we are at the forefront of the industry.

With locations in Berlin, Hamburg, and Cologne, we specialize in creation, project management, consulting, social media, performance marketing, and (post-)production.

Aufgaben

Your Responsibilities

As a Data Analyst / Data Engineer, you will play a crucial role in analyzing, managing, and working with our data sets and infrastructure. Your tasks will include:


Data Management & Optimization â€“ Take ownership of our data warehouse, ensuring high data quality, availability, and scalability.
Dashboard Development â€“ Support our teams and clients by developing and maintaining data dashboards that enable actionable insights.
Troubleshooting & Consulting â€“ Identify and resolve data issues while advising teams on best practices for data flows and architecture.
Collaboration with Client Teams â€“ Analyze the performance and effectiveness of social media brands, assets, and campaigns.
Lead Change through Data â€“ Present analytical results to internal and external stakeholders to enable data-driven decision-making.


Profil

Requirements

WHAT YOU BRING

We are looking for a highly motivated Data Analyst / Data Engineer with strong technical expertise and a passion for data-driven decision-making.

Must-Have Skills


Proven experience with data processing, analysis, and warehouse management (ideally with BigQuery).
Experience with data modeling and analysis in a modern data warehouse environment and/or statistical software packages (e.g., R, SPSS, Stata, SAS).
Hands-on experience with data visualization (e.g., Looker Studio, Looker).
Experience with statistical analysis (e.g., regression analysis, A/B-testing)


Nice-to-Have Skills


Experience in eCommerce data structures and business intelligence workflows.
Programming skills (SQL, Python preferred)for data automation and workflow optimization.
Experience with large language models and machine learning techniques.


PERSONAL ATTRIBUTES


Attention to Detail: You are highly analytical and love debugging complex data issues.
Strong Communicator: You can translate data insights into clear, actionable recommendations.
Language Skills: Fluent in German and proficient in English (written and spoken).


Soft Skills


Transparent Communication: You proactively share insights and collaborate across teams.
Ownership Mentality: You take full responsibility for your projects and results.
Interdisciplinary Collaboration: You can translate complex data concepts for non-technical teams.
Empathy: You build strong relationships with stakeholders and team members.


Wir bieten

Our Benefits â€“ Made For Mates.

Be the vibe.

Be the change.

Be a mate.

We believe: If you want to grow, you need space, energy, and people who support you. Our benefits provide exactly that.


Stay flexible â€“ the way you need it:


Work Should Fit Your Life, Not The Other Way Around. With Our Hybrid Model, You Decide Where You Perform Best â€“ In The Office Or Remotely. And For True Freedom

You can work from any EU country for up to 6 weeks a year.


Moments that matter â€“ time that's yours: 27 vacation days + your birthday off, because you're worth it. December 24th & 31st are on us â€“ for those special times with the people who matter most to you.


We care. You celebrate.


Move forward â€“ personally & professionally: You want to grow? We'll make room for it: With a â‚¬1,500 personal development budget per year, you can invest in what helps you move forward.


Be the change â€“ we'll support you.


Maintain balance â€“ body, mind & energy:
Urban Sports Club subsidy to help you clear your head.
Nilo.health membership for when you need mental strength. Because mates take care â€“ of themselves too.
Your benefit. Your choice. You decide what suits you best:
Givve Card â€“ â‚¬50 monthly for anything that makes your life better
Mobiko â€“ â‚¬65 for sustainable mobility
Pension plan subsidy â€“ â‚¬50 for your future
Team spirit â€“ together we achieve more: Regular team events, inspiring offsites, and a sense of togetherness you can feel. Because â€œBe a mateâ€ is more than just a phrase.
A work environment with vibe: High-quality equipment, stylish offices in Berlin, Hamburg, and Cologne. Snacks, drinks & monthly team lunches â€“ because the best conversations often start in the kitchen.


Important note

Please be advised that a valid work permit for Germany is required for non-EU citizens. Unfortunately, applications without a valid work permit and sufficient German language skills may not be considered.

Title: Senior Data Analyst, Marketing Analytics
Description:
About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, people from all over the world have booked more than 200 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 800 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team mission

The Analytics team's mission is to enable the organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel, from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement, and take pride in the insights we generate.

This specific position is within our Marketing Analytics (Attribution & Paid Search) and will focus mostly on helping optimize our Paid Search operations and scaling our investments towards the most incremental and loyal customers. The analyst will need to intervene in our campaign setup and bidding strategies and our attribution and experimentation solutions.

You Will


Develop quantitative analysis and statistical models to evaluate and steer marketing decisions
Maintain and improve our marketing measurement tools (Attribution, experimentation framework, Customer lifetime valueâ€¦)
Explore large datasets, give meaning to data and numbers, identify opportunities and issues, and present findings to stakeholders
Develop new methodologies to scale our Display and Partnerships channel, among others
Serve as a liaison between the marketing teams and the data engineering team
Mentor others in the skills needed for this role


Who You Are


5+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
Strong knowledge of SQL and Python for analysis (eg, pandas, scikit-learn, pyspark)
Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers and a track record in sharing insights to business stakeholders
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks, Databricks)
Prior exposure to digital and performance marketing
Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English


Nice to have


Knowledge or previous experience of attribution and paid search.
Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus


How We Set You Up For Success


Meaningful work that helps create memorable travel experiences
A diverse, inclusive environment where your voice is valued
Collaboration with smart, engaged colleagues from over 80 nationalities
English-speaking office environment
Continuous learning opportunities through monthly Hackathons, weekly tech talks, and an annual external training budget
Mentorship programs to support your growth and career development
Flexible working arrangements to support work-life balance
Well-stocked kitchen and team-building events like our famous pizza & beer Fridays
GetYourGuide vouchers and free German lessons
Relocation assistance if needed


And more...

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst (all genders)
Description:
This is femtasy

femtasy is the audio-only streaming platform for erotica centering women and their experiences. We inspire women to explore and enjoy on their own terms; simple as that. We stand for zest for life â€“ empowering women is in our DNA. We are pioneering a product designed with inclusivity in mind, are led by a visionary woman CEO & Founder, and have a team that is over 90% women+ and gender-diverse individuals. We have already positively impacted the lives of hundreds of thousands of women by re-defining pleasure and are just getting started.

How we work is just as important to us as what we work on. Thatâ€™s why weâ€™re committed to building a progressive, forward-thinking company culture. Learn more in the 'benefits' section.

Your Mission

We are seeking a technically-skilled Marketing Data Analyst who will turn our performance marketing data into actionable insights. This role bridges marketing and data â€” from implementing tracking setups and managing attribution logic to building dashboards and spotting trends across Meta, Google, and TikTok.

Your Responsibilities


Handling data transparency from campaign to ad level (including sign-up and post-trial behavior tracking leading to ROAS)
Optimizing the tech and data set-up across ad tools, particularly Meta
Providing insights into areas of growth and opportunity
Building out reporting frameworks to help us make better data-driven decisions across all channels (Meta, Google, TikTok, YouTube)
Potentially assisting in the analysis for native app communication once that project is underway in the next 6-12 months.
Own and optimize our tracking setup (incl. GA4, Meta CAPI, GTM, server-side tracking).
Write SQL queries to analyze campaign performance and build self-serve dashboards.
Collaborate with Tech and BI teams to ensure clean and reliable marketing data infrastructure.
Use tools like Looker, BigQuery, or similar to generate insights and reports.


Role Specific Requirements

Weâ€™re looking for someone who:


3+ years of experience in a marketing-focused data analytics role, ideally in an eCommerce or subscription-based B2C environment
Open to: less years of analyst experience but prior experience working as a performance marketing manager and then turned into an analyst
Hands-on experience with Meta Ads Manager and other key platforms like Google, TikTok, and YouTube
Experience in bridging the gap between marketing and tech, particularly someone whoâ€™s been a performance marketer before transitioning into an analyst role, or someone with experience in a data team (e.g., Meta).
Strong passion for both marketing and analytics, with a problem-solving mindset and an eye for identifying growth opportunities.


Why Join Us?


Grow your marketing analytics skills while contributing to real-world business projects.
Work with data to help the business better understand and serve its customers.
Collaborate with a supportive team of cross-functional stakeholders.
Gain exposure to industry-standard tools and best practices in data analysis and marketing.
Be part of a company that values curiosity, learning, and continuous improvement.


What We Offer

ðŸŒŸImpact & purpose. The chance to join a huge mission and purpose around female empowerment & gender equality!

ðŸ¦¸ðŸ½â€â™€ï¸ Female-lead and women-centric. We have a female-centric product, a female CEO & Founder... and >90% of our whole team identifies as women+.

ðŸ¤Inspiring, highly performance oriented company culture. A progressive team culture based on transparency & open feedback, ownership, and collaboration. Check out 'radical candor' if you want to learn more about how we work.

ðŸ“ˆPersonal professional growth. The possibility to learn and grow with team learning sessions, learning & development budgets, and internal trainings - did you ever hear of a company where every team member (from junior to C-level) has access to personal 1:1 sessions with a professional business coach?

ðŸ”„Healthy approach to taking a break. 26 holidays + unlimited recharging time on top for when you really need a break.

ðŸ“ Flexibility. Flexible working hours and location - 2,5 months of remote working from wherever you want. 60% of our team is fully remote... and we bring everybody together for a week every 4 months to collaborate, connect, align, and have fun.

ðŸŽ‰ (Really cool) Events & Benefits like an Urban Sports Membership (or alternative offerings), snacks & lunches, mobility and retirement plans, and of course our famous femtasy parties & team events everybody keeps talking about for weeks (for real). We also cook and eat together twice per month and have a big office garden for the best BBQs in Berlin

ðŸ’ªPackage. A highly attractive compensation package which fairly mirrors what is expected from you and the impact you'll have on femtasy.

For remote applicants we consider only (CET Â±2h) within Europe. We do not offer relocation from within or outside the EU. Candidates ideally reside in Germany or Spain.

femtasy offers equal opportunities for all and encourages applicants of all nationalities, genders, sexual orientations, religious backgrounds, gender identities, and people with disabilities to apply.

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst â€“ Central Reporting (f/m/x)
Description:
Company Description

Our goal is a solar power system on every roof, a storage unit in every house, and an e-car in every garage. How are we achieving this? Enpal makes solar easy: we rent out solar power systems, electricity storage and wallboxes at an all-inclusive rate, supplemented by a low-cost green electricity tariff, and intelligently networked into an integrated overall solution.

We are just at the beginning of our journey to becoming Europe's largest energy company. That's why we're looking for talented people to accompany us on this journey, leave their footprint and celebrate successes together with us. At Enpal, you will find a dynamic working environment as well as the space to develop yourself personally and professionally and to use your strengths effectively.

As the first green unicorn in Germany and the fastest-growing energy company in Europe (FT1000 Ranking 2022 by Financial Times & Statista), we continue to advance our mission of green energy for everyone. Be part of this success story and change the world with us!

Job Description


Strategic Partnership: Collaborate with the VP of Financial BI, VP of FP&A, and C-Suite leadership to align business intelligence strategies with financial goals. Work cross-functionally with Marketing, Sales, and Finance to deliver data-driven insights that support business growth and operational efficiency.
Project Ownership: Manage the intake and prioritization of data projects, ensuring clear goals, scope, and expected impact. Work with stakeholders to refine requirements, prioritize initiatives, and drive execution in alignment with business objectives.
End-to-End Data Solutions: Own the full lifecycle of data solutions, from scoping and MVP development to data modeling, implementation, and validation. Work closely with data engineers, analysts, and business leaders to ensure solutions are scalable and fit-for-purpose.
Data Visualization & Dashboarding: Develop effective, actionable dashboards and data products that translate complex data into clear, intuitive insights. Apply best practices in data visualization to communicate key information effectively across all levels, from operational teams to executive leadership.
Data-Driven Decision Making: Conduct ad-hoc analyses and exploratory data work to identify trends, patterns, and insights. Provide proactive recommendations that drive business performance and ensure ongoing monitoring of key metrics.
Enhancing Data Culture: Elevate analytical standards and best practices within the organization. Share knowledge, refine methodologies, and stay up to date with the latest BI, data visualization, and analytics trends.



Qualifications


5+ years of experience in business intelligence, data analytics, or a related field, with a strong understanding of customer acquisition, finance, and business performance drivers.
Technical expertise in SQL, ETL processes, and BI tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar. Our stack includes dbt, Snowflake, Streamlit, and Tableau.
Strong data visualization and dashboarding skills, with the ability to create clear, intuitive, and actionable insights from complex datasets.
Experience with Python or R for data analysis is a plus, particularly in advanced forecasting methods (e.g., econometrics, time series analysis).
Proven problem-solving skills, with experience in automating reporting workflows and leveraging data to improve decision-making.
Strong collaboration and communication skills, with the ability to engage business, analytics, and engineering teams to drive impactful solutions.
Ability to present data products and insights effectively to stakeholders at all management levels



Additional Information

At Enpal, we are proud of the diversity of our team. No decisions are made based on skin color, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or age, either during recruitment or employment. We strongly encourage women, neurodivergent people, people of color, and LGBTQ(+) people to apply. Enpal stands for a safe workplace and takes action against discrimination and harassment of any kind.
Show more

  • 5+ years of experience in business intelligence, data analytics, or a related field, with a strong understanding of customer acquisition, finance, and business performance drivers.
  • Technical expertise in SQL, ETL processes, and BI tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar. Our stack includes dbt, Snowflake, Streamlit, and Tableau.
  • Strong data visualization and dashboarding skills, with the ability to create clear, intuitive, and actionable insights from complex datasets.
  • Experience with Python or R for data analysis is a plus, particularly in advanced forecasting methods (e.g., econometrics, time series analysis).
  • Proven problem-solving skills, with experience in automating reporting workflows and leveraging data to improve decision-making.
  • Strong collaboration and communication skills, with the ability to engage business, analytics, and engineering teams to drive impactful solutions.
  • Ability to present data products and insights effectively to stakeholders at all management levels


Additional Information

At Enpal, we are proud of the diversity of our team. No decisions are made based on skin color, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or age, either during recruitment or employment. We strongly encourage women, neurodivergent people, people of color, and LGBTQ(+) people to apply. Enpal stands for a safe workplace and takes action against discrimination and harassment of any kind.

Title: Senior Data Analyst, Product Analytics
Description:
About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, travelers from over 170 countries have booked more than 200 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 700 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team Mission

The Analytics department's mission is to enable the organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel, from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement and take pride in the insights we generate.

As a Data Analyst in the Product Analytics team, you will help drive measurement, strategy, and tactical decision-making within GetYourGuide. You will solve problems that could range from understanding the relationship between review rating and conversion rate, figuring out how to measure adding videos to our product pages, what is the business value of an account login or developing a way to measure whether our customersâ€™ on trip experience is optimal.

Responsibilities


Develop quantitative analysis to drive product decisions.
Help the Search and Discovery group to learn about their features by designing and analyzing experiments.
Design and implement data models, metrics and dashboards to guide the teamsâ€™ product strategy and success.
Support the technical teams in tracking and producing more insightful data.
Contribute to the learning and experimentation culture of the company by promoting hypothesis-driven product development and evaluation.
Answer the big questions to push our knowledge of our customers further.
Contribute to the strategic thinking of the team by being a thought partner to the Product Manager.


Requirements


5+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
Excellent stakeholder management skills.
Strong knowledge of SQL and knowledge of Python
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks)
Curiosity, reasoning skills with proven evidence of problem solving.
Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers
Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals
Ability to navigate ambiguity.
Strong customer focus with a focus on business impact.
Great communication skills


Nice To Have


Previous experience working with agile product teams is a plus.
Previous experience managing analysts is a plus.
Experienced with the statistics and assumptions of experimentation.
Familiarity with ETL technologies like Airflow is a plus.
Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus.
Experience with LLM APIs (OpenAI, Gemini, Anthropic) is a plus.


We Offer


Meaningful work that helps create memorable travel experiences.
The opportunity to contribute to the
A diverse, inclusive environment where your voice is valued
Collaboration with smart, engaged colleagues from over 80 nationalities
English-speaking office environment
Continuous learning opportunities through monthly Hackathons, weekly tech talks, and an annual external training budget
Mentorship programs to support your growth and career development
Flexible working arrangements to support work-life balance
Well-stocked kitchen and team-building events
GetYourGuide vouchers


And moreâ€¦

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.

Title: Insight Analyst UK
Description:
Company Description

Weâ€™re ASOS, the online retailer for fashion lovers all around the world.

We exist to give our customers the confidence to be whoever they want to be, and that goes for our people too. At ASOS, youâ€™re free to be your true self without judgement, and channel your creativity into a platform used by millions.

But how are we showing up? Weâ€™re proud members of Inclusive Companies, are Disability Confident Committed and have signed the Business in the Community Race at Work Charter and we placed 8th in the Inclusive Top 50 Companies Employer list.

Everyone needs some help showing up as their best self. Let our Talent team know if you need any adjustments throughout the process in whatever way works best for you.

Job Description

We're looking for a strategic, commercially-minded Senior E-commerce Insight Analyst to drive ASOSâ€™ business in the UK through uncovering high value insights about our customers, their behaviours and preferences, leveraging data to understand key drivers of business performance and profitability, and continually measuring the impact of initiatives to steer investment decisions.

You'll be flexing your analytical skills to uncover actionable insights spanning a range of functions, working and collaborating directly with senior stakeholders. The ideal candidate will be innately curious, have a strong business acumen, a robust technical toolkit and a passion for fashion.

This is a high impact role where your insights will directly influence and contribute to ASOS' success. You're not just in the driver's seat; you're the engine propelling us towards achieving our growth ambition. If you're the kind of analytical powerhouse who enjoys cracking tough problems and crafting ingenious solutions, this is where you belong.

The Details


Combine market, customer, marketing and assortment insights to drive a holistic picture of performance, proactively communicating key trends and opportunities to senior leadership
Complete exploratory data analysis and statistical modelling (e.g., regression analysis, clustering techniques) to propose innovative solutions on topics such as customer and product segmentations to help determine high impact actions and strategies
Dive deep into customer data to gain a profound understanding of our audience, and use these insights to drive improvements in our marketing strategy, experience & offering
Identify trends in performance, investigate drivers, and present findings to diverse stakeholders, articulating the â€œso whatâ€ by translating insights into strategic, actionable recommendations
Develop methodologies to measure the impact of initiatives and tests across our site, marketing, price/promo, product assortment, delivery proposition, and other areas affecting our customer journey and operations
Develop key metrics and dashboards to monitor business health, measure success and support strategic initiatives
Identify business growth opportunities based on customer insights and market trends
Independently plan and prioritise work based on market strategy and priorities



Qualifications

About You


Previous experience working in Data Analytics/Insights
A data enthusiast who enjoys immersing yourself in data to solve business problems and present compelling stories that drive change
Experience in mining and analysing large data sets, with proficiency in using data and statistical analysis tools to query datasets and drive end-to-end complete analysis that helps accelerate the business
Experience using data to create compelling stories that communicate key messages across the organisation and to influence various levels of management decision making
Commercial mindset, with a strong understanding of how data insights can drive business impact and profitability
An obsession with the customer and ability to analyse trends and data through the customer lens
A collaborate approach and ability to operate as an analytical thought partner who can translate business questions into data analysis visions to execute
Strong communication skills, comfortable presenting data to groups of stakeholders in a way that is effective and concise
The ability to break down complex problems into smaller ones
An interest in the 20-something customer and fashion industry
E-commerce work experience (desirable)
Strong background / education in a quantitative or business discipline (desirable)



Additional Information

BeneFITSâ€™


Employee discount (hello ASOS discount!)
ASOS Develops (personal development opportunities across the business)
Employee sample sales
Access to a huge range of LinkedIn learning materials
25 days paid annual leave + an extra celebration day for a special moment
Discretionary bonus scheme
Private medical care scheme
Flexible benefits allowance - which you can choose to take as extra cash, or use towards other benefits

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The Role

At Deliveroo we have an outstanding data science organisation, with a mission to enable the highest quality human and machine decision-making. We work throughout the company - in product, business and platform teams - using analysis, experimentation, causal inference and machine learning techniques. We are uniquely placed to use data to help make better decisions and improve data literacy across Deliveroo.

We are looking for a Data Analyst that is passionate about metrics and telling the stories behind the data. We have several roles open across different teams (grocery, loyalty, restaurants). Data Analysts at Deliveroo report into our data science management team.

You will be a professional in insights storytelling, communication and visualisation and know how to create action from metrics. Crafting effective intelligent benchmarks, understanding performance, caring about data quality, enabling automation and creating phenomenal visualisations and stories are things that drive you.

What You'll Be Doing


Work closely with commercial stakeholders to create value and business impact through better data availability, visualisation and analysis
Discover, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns in complex datasets to perform ad-hoc analyses and deliver insights to the executive team and senior management
Understand key drivers of the business and provide data driven guidance on key levers
Identify and specify data needs and quality requirements and work closely with Analytics Engineers to ensure data is available, accurate and corresponds to the business needs
Consolidate and distribute best analytical practices from different teams and countries


Requirements


Experience identifying the root cause of problems, assessing risks/impacts and determining and implementing effective solutions.
A good understanding of querying in SQL and understanding of database structure - you'll be expected to be able to extract the data you need for your analysis.
Compelling story-telling skills, and an eye for powerful visualisations - you'll need to translate your findings for all levels of stakeholder (business and technical)
Good knowledge of Excel/GSheets - depending on the task, there is a good chance that this is where some of your exploratory analysis will take place. Being comfortable with pivot tables and functions will be essential.
Developer experience with a data visualisation tool (Looker, Tableau, Periscope)


Why Deliveroo

Our mission is to transform the way you shop and eat, bringing the neighbourhood to your door by connecting consumers, restaurants, shops and riders. . We are transforming the way the world eats and shops by making access to food and products more convenient and enjoyable. We give people the opportunity to buy what they want, as they want it, when and where they want it.

We are a technology-driven company at the forefront of the most rapidly expanding industry in the world. We are still a small team, making a very large impact, looking to answer some of the most interesting questions out there. We move fast, value autonomy and ownership, and we are always looking for new ideas.

Workplace & Benefits

At Deliveroo we know that people are the heart of the business and we prioritise their welfare. Benefits differ by country, but we offer many benefits in areas including healthcare, well-being, parental leave, pensions, and generous annual leave allowances, including time off to support a charitable cause of your choice. Benefits are country-specific, please ask your recruiter for more information. This role in a Hybrid position.

Diversity

At Deliveroo, we believe a great workplace is one that represents the world we live in and how beautifully diverse it can be. That means we have no judgement when it comes to any one of the things that make you who you are - your gender, race, sexuality, religion or a secret aversion to coriander. All you need is a passion for (most) food and a desire to be part of one of the fastest-growing businesses in a rapidly growing industry.

We are committed to diversity, equity and inclusion in all aspects of our hiring process. We recognise that some candidates may require adjustments to apply for a position or fairly participate in the interview process. If you require any adjustments, please don't hesitate to let us know. We will make every effort to provide the necessary adjustments to ensure you have an equitable opportunity to succeed.

Please click here to view our candidate privacy policy.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
What is the opportunity?

It's an exciting time at BOI UK, we are currently migrating and updating our data solution as part of our strategic objective to drive the business to a data-led culture through analytics.

You will work alongside our Data team as we continue to develop and maintain a robust data platform; creating new, impactful reporting with clear insights, backed up by quality data.

This is a fantastic opportunity to join a forward-thinking area of the business striving to make a positive difference to our colleagues and customers!

In This Role, You Will


Capture data and ensure its quality and integrity from ingestion through to reporting.
Reconciliation of data with different sources.
Identify gaps and support in fixing them.
Produce well-structured data documentation for both technical and front end users
Embrace agile working practices and pro-actively identifies improvements to data processes



What will make you stand out?

A strong candidate will have experience and be Proficient with Power BI. You will have hands on SQL experience for data extraction and be well versed in MS excel.

You will have excellent communication and presentation skills alongside a 'can do' attitude.

Essential Qualifications

There are no specific qualifications or minimum educational requirements needed for this role.

More About The Team

The Data, Digital & Strategic Reporting function within Bank of Ireland UK provides strategic planning and delivery of business optimisation, innovation and analytics. These enable the Bank to serve our customers brilliantly, transform our business and deliver sustainable profitability.

This is a hybrid role and can be done anywhere in the UK with the primary office location being Bristol. Travel will be required for in-person collaboration - frequency to be determined by the line manager.

Please note you must live in the jurisdiction for the business to which you are contracted.

#ij-hybrid

Why work with us?

The Bank of Ireland company culture prioritises work-life balance with an opportunity for flexible working, along with 23 days annual leave and excellent pension contributions. Family can mean different things to different people; we offer 6 months paid maternity leave, an innovative fertility and surrogacy policy and working parent supports.

Your wellbeing is important to us; we have an employee assistance program, WebDoctor and financial wellbeing coaches available. We also encourage and support staff to pursue educational and professional qualifications to grow and enhance your career!

Key Competencies


Customer Focused - Self
Agile - Self
Champion Transformation - Self
Manage Risk - Self
Accountable - Self



We`re on a continuous journey to build an inclusive and diverse workplace. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, lived experience, abilities and perspectives. We provide reasonable accommodations at every stage of our recruitment process for disabilities, neurodivergence or medical conditions. If you require an accommodation please complete this form and one of our recruitment team members will be in touch via email. Any information provided will be treated as confidential within the recruitment team and used only for the purpose of determining and providing appropriate accommodations for the application and recruitment process.

Where Agency assistance is required Bank of Ireland Recruitment Team will engage directly with suppliers. Unsolicited CVs / profiles supplied to Bank of Ireland by Recruitment Agencies will not be accepted for this role.

Title: Sustainability Data Analyst
Description:
At Danone, youâ€™re not just early talent; youâ€™re just in time to take ownership of your career and be empowered to make a difference.




Our Sustainability team is bringing our business purpose to life through our Danone Impact Journey. Across the two-year programme, youâ€™ll gain a breadth of exposure across several projects all whilst earning a starting salary of Â£35,000!




Our Sustainability team plays a crucial role in integrating the Danone Impact Journey into our business operations, bringing our purpose to life. We lead the charge in fulfilling our environmental commitments and driving community impact programs.




As a Data Analyst in the Sustainability team, you'll gain invaluable experience in data analysis and reporting, empowering us to make informed, evidence-based decisions for maximum impact. Throughout your journey, you'll receive comprehensive support while taking on key responsibilities, such as analysing the carbon footprint of new products and sustainability initiatives.




Across the two years you could be:




Gathering data and insights to help us understand our sustainability and carbon impact.
Managing mandatory reports, working to improve accuracy, and identifying opportunities for improvement.
Collaborating with stakeholders across the UK and Ireland, including logistics, procurement, sales and marketing, enhancing your communication skills.




You will have a direct impact on key sustainability projects including our carbon and environmental impact and reducing plastic & food waste.




What do we look for?




We'd like you to demonstrate smart thinking and emotional understanding by demonstrating how you solve problems and consider the perspectives of others. Show us your digital savvy and creativity by being comfortable with technology and sharing new ideas.




We value innovation and forward-thinking, so show us how you can envision the future and bring original ideas to life. Lastly, weâ€™re looking for your motivation and passion, so show us your dedication, hard work, and enthusiasm for what you do.




You donâ€™t need a degree or work experience to apply for our Early Careers programme. Our roles are designed to empower you on your professional journey, ensuring you have the skills and knowledge needed to thrive in your chosen career.




What do we offer?




As well as a starting salary of Â£35,000, if youâ€™re motivated to deliver high performance, weâ€™ll recognise your hard work with bi-annual salary reviews.




Youâ€™ll also enjoy a range of benefits, including:




A blend of classroom and on-the-job training, progressing to a manager level within two years.
Achieve work/life balance by aligning business needs with personal commitments, with key moments spent at your local office hub.
Dedicated volunteering time to give back to your local community.
Additionally, you'll receive 25 days of annual leave with the option to buy up to 5 more days, Â£120 of Danone products per year, discounted gym memberships and much more!




At the start of your Danone journey, you'll be part of a growing early talent community. Weâ€™ll provide high-quality learning and development support, fostering personal growth and deepening your understanding of the Danone ecosystem. You'll receive continuous feedback to help you stretch your boundaries, cultivate self-awareness, and gauge your progress.




DEI is deeply embedded in Danone's DNA, representing our core values and beliefs. We embrace diversity as a driving force for positive change, nurturing an inclusive workplace where every individual is valued.




You can join any of our six Employee Network Groups (ENGs); Pride (LGBTQIA+), Unity (BAME), DanoneAble (Accessibility), DanoneCare (Carers), WINGs (Womens Wellbeing), Danone Parents.




Our ENGs provide guidance, share knowledge, and raise cultural awareness, connecting employees from diverse backgrounds while offering educational resources, personal growth opportunities, and platforms for idea sharing.




What comes next?




The role closes on 7th May, our Early Careers team will be in touch shortly to discuss the next steps.




Key Dates to consider




Our assessment centre is expected to take place on 25th June.
You must be available to start on 14th July.




In order for your application to be considered, you must be available for the dates above.




Want to stay in touch? Head over to our careers website or follow us on social media to discover Life at Danone.




Instagram: @DanoneUKICareers, TikTok @LifeAtDanoneUKI




For any technical support, please email support@smartrecruiters.com




For general support, please email danone@wearewiser.com




The 'Resume' and 'Message to The Hiring Team' sections are not required and will not be considered in your application, so please leave these blank.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst (Real Estate)




Team: Operations

Role: Permanent, Full-time

Location: London (North)

Salary: Competitive + Performance Bonus + Benefits

WFH: Hybrid working model




About the Role:




Fantastic opportunity for a Data Analyst to join the Operations function of a leading UK-based Asset Manager. In the role, you will work closely with the Operations Manager on day-to-day activities, including enhancing system capabilities and assisting with several new group projects.




Key Responsibilities:




Apply programming skills to develop and maintain automation scripts using PowerShell or similar languages. Provide documentation and training on these scripts to ensure efficient and secure operations.
Document all processes and maintain detailed records of system configurations and changes.
Coordinate systems development, including planning, designing, executing, documenting and monitoring every aspect of a project.
Assist the department manager in ensuring key projects are delivered within a planned time frame.
Providing accurate reports to various internal departments and external professional advisers as required.
Reconciling, identifying and correcting data discrepancies on our in-house database.
Identify areas of inefficiency and collaborate with team members to design and implement new processes. Ensure these improvements align with company standards and monitor their effectiveness.
Analyse current workflows to identify opportunities for automation, using appropriate software tools to reduce manual tasks.
Test and optimise automated processes to maintain accuracy and reliability.
Stay updated on technological advancements, assess their potential impact, and support integrating new solutions. Coordinate with IT and other departments to ensure seamless implementation and enhanced system capabilities.
Manage and develop website content and appearance.
Responsible for the support and maintenance of the database, including data integrity, security and optimisation.




Person Specification:




Degree or similar qualification.
Strong working knowledge of Python, SQL or another programming language intermediate or above level.
At least 2 years of work experience in a similar role.
Demonstrable experience with database management and process automation.
Able to show accuracy and speed when entering data into a database, and copying from written and oral sources.
Familiarity with the latest technology trends and products.
Able to communicate effectively, help provide accurate information.







Our ambition is simple â€“ to do our best for our people, clients and communities.

We are determined to make a positive difference at work and beyond - this starts with hiring the best talent without consideration of race, religion, colour, national origin, age, gender, sexual orientation, marital status or disability.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Truenorth is partnering with a leading healthcare company in London who are seeking a Data Quality Analyst to join them on a permanent basis. This is an exciting opportunity to contribute to a growing Informatics team, with a hybrid working setup (2 days per week onsite).




Salary: Â£35,000 - Â£40,000




In this role, youâ€™ll play a key part in shaping the organisationâ€™s Informatics Strategy, with a strong focus on data standards, specifications, and alignment. Working alongside data analysts and a business analyst, youâ€™ll help develop test procedures and ensure high data accuracy across multiple departments.




Key Responsibilities:

Support the delivery of the Informatics Strategy by focusing on data standards, specifications, and consistency.
Collaborate with data and business analysts to develop test plans and validate data outputs.
Engage with various departments to document data processes, specifications, and methodologies.
Design and execute test scenarios to maintain data integrity.
Track and follow up on action items to ensure completion.




About You:

Demonstrated success in delivering data-driven projects across varied stakeholders and systems.
A proactive, delivery-focused self-starter who enjoys working in close-knit teams.
Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate effectively with colleagues at all levels.




Required Skills & Experience:

Background in data quality projects within the healthcare industry.
Proficient in SQL and able to write T-SQL queries.
Strong working knowledge of Microsoft 365 (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook).
Excellent report writing skills.
Experience with Power BI is desirable.
Familiarity with process mapping tools like Visio, Draw.io, or Lucidchart is a plus.




Please note: We are unable to offer sponsorship for this role. Candidates must have the full right to work in the UK.

Title: Quality Data Analyst
Description:
Why PlayStation?

PlayStation isnâ€™t just the Best Place to Play â€” itâ€™s also the Best Place to Work. Today, weâ€™re recognized as a global leader in entertainment producing The PlayStation family of products and services including PlayStationÂ®5, PlayStationÂ®4, PlayStationÂ®VR, PlayStationÂ®Plus, acclaimed PlayStation software titles from PlayStation Studios, and more.

PlayStation also strives to create an inclusive environment that empowers employees and embraces diversity. We welcome and encourage everyone who has a passion and curiosity for innovation, technology, and play to explore our open positions and join our growing global team.

The PlayStation brand falls under Sony Interactive Entertainment, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Sony Group Corporation.

Role Overview:

Join the world-class team at PlayStation as a Data Quality Analyst in our Consumer Experience (CX) division. This role is uniquely positioned to support and lead global critical metrics, ensuring PlayStation's dedication to outstanding post-purchase customer care, hardware technical services, and platform support.

What you'll be doing:

As a Data Quality Analyst, you will:


Support with the management of CX Quality Management System reporting on important metrics worldwide.
Coordinate and lead the CX critical metric data governance meetings.
Ensure compliance with our organizational performance policies in all third-party contracts.
Collaborate with various partners to ensure performance is met and improve operations to meet contractual obligations and organizational goals.
Monitor performance of critical metrics and discuss with individuals their performance responsibilities.
Maintain accurate and reliable data assets.
Support product market issues and root cause analysis.
Establish standards/metrics and monitor quality metrics.
Assist the lead with data analysis, reporting, and data visualization.
Prepare accurate and timely reports for executive presentations.
Conduct data analysis to identify trends and opportunities for cost savings and efficiency gains.
Provide insights to support improvements in CX operations and central initiatives.
Maintain positive relationships with key partners within Consumer Experience and other internal teams and external third parties.


What we're looking for:


3+ years proven track record as an analyst presenting data.
Bachelorâ€™s or associate degree in statistics, information systems, or a related field with experience.
Strong understanding of data governance to assist in enforcing data quality standards.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to identify trends and assist in implementing improvement strategies.
Experience crafting critical metric dashboards and data reporting.
Proficiency in analytic tools and systems.
Proficiency in data management, including data assessment, validation, transformation, and integration.
Outstanding attention to detail and organizational skills.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to collaborate effectively with multi-functional teams worldwide to resolve issues.
Capability to work effectively and professionally with senior partners.
Ability to prioritise effectively and meet tight deadlines.
Self-motivated and highly organised.


Benefits:


Discretionary bonus opportunity
Hybrid Working (FlexModes)
Private Medical Insurance
Dental Scheme
25 days holiday per year
On Site Gym
Subsidised CafÃ©
Free soft drinks
On site bar
Access to cycle garage and showers


Please refer to our Candidate Privacy Notice for more information about how we process your personal information, and your data protection rights.

Equal Opportunity Statement:

Sony is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All persons will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender (including gender identity, gender expression and gender reassignment), race (including colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin), religion or belief, marital or civil partnership status, disability, age, sexual orientation, pregnancy, maternity or parental status, trade union membership or membership in any other legally protected category.

We strive to create an inclusive environment, empower employees and embrace diversity. We encourage everyone to respond.

PlayStation is a Fair Chance employer and qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records will be considered for employment.

  • Support with the management of CX Quality Management System reporting on important metrics worldwide.
  • Coordinate and lead the CX critical metric data governance meetings.
  • Ensure compliance with our organizational performance policies in all third-party contracts.
  • Collaborate with various partners to ensure performance is met and improve operations to meet contractual obligations and organizational goals.
  • Monitor performance of critical metrics and discuss with individuals their performance responsibilities.
  • Maintain accurate and reliable data assets.
  • Support product market issues and root cause analysis.
  • Establish standards/metrics and monitor quality metrics.
  • Assist the lead with data analysis, reporting, and data visualization.
  • Prepare accurate and timely reports for executive presentations.
  • Conduct data analysis to identify trends and opportunities for cost savings and efficiency gains.
  • Provide insights to support improvements in CX operations and central initiatives.
  • Maintain positive relationships with key partners within Consumer Experience and other internal teams and external third parties.

What we're looking for:

  • 3+ years proven track record as an analyst presenting data.
  • Bachelorâ€™s or associate degree in statistics, information systems, or a related field with experience.
  • Strong understanding of data governance to assist in enforcing data quality standards.
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Ability to identify trends and assist in implementing improvement strategies.
  • Experience crafting critical metric dashboards and data reporting.
  • Proficiency in analytic tools and systems.
  • Proficiency in data management, including data assessment, validation, transformation, and integration.
  • Outstanding attention to detail and organizational skills.
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills.
  • Ability to collaborate effectively with multi-functional teams worldwide to resolve issues.
  • Capability to work effectively and professionally with senior partners.
  • Ability to prioritise effectively and meet tight deadlines.
  • Self-motivated and highly organised.

Benefits:

  • Discretionary bonus opportunity
  • Hybrid Working (FlexModes)
  • Private Medical Insurance
  • Dental Scheme
  • 25 days holiday per year
  • On Site Gym
  • Subsidised CafÃ©
  • Free soft drinks
  • On site bar
  • Access to cycle garage and showers

Please refer to our Candidate Privacy Notice for more information about how we process your personal information, and your data protection rights.

Equal Opportunity Statement:

Sony is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All persons will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender (including gender identity, gender expression and gender reassignment), race (including colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin), religion or belief, marital or civil partnership status, disability, age, sexual orientation, pregnancy, maternity or parental status, trade union membership or membership in any other legally protected category.

We strive to create an inclusive environment, empower employees and embrace diversity. We encourage everyone to respond.

PlayStation is a Fair Chance employer and qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records will be considered for employment.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst




Are you passionate about turning data into clear, actionable insights?




Do you enjoy working with a variety of tools to solve business challenges?




Ready to join a leading retailer where your work will make a tangible impact?




MacGregor Black is partnering with a Leading Retailer on the search for a Data Analyst. This is a hybrid role based in the London area.




As Data Analyst, you will be responsible for delivering data-driven insights across a wide range of datasets. Using tools such as Databricks, Tableau, Looker Studio, Amplitude, and DBT, you will extract, transform, and analyse data to support key business functions.

You will collaborate closely with stakeholders to understand their data needs, generate reports, and provide actionable insights that influence business decisions. Your remit will include analysing sales, customer, marketing, and operational data, as well as supporting digital analytics when required.




Key Responsibilities:




Data Extraction & Analysis

Write SQL queries in Databricks.
Support stakeholders with key business questions.
Handle ad-hoc and recurring data requests.
Validate data to ensure accuracy.
Use GitHub via VSCode to manage code repositories.




Delivering Insights & Reporting

Develop and maintain dashboards and reports (Tableau, Looker Studio).
Define KPIs and track business performance.
Present insights to stakeholders clearly and effectively.
3. Supporting Digital Analytics & Marketing Data
Work with web analytics tools (Amplitude, Contentsquare, Medallia).
Integrate digital data with business datasets.
Support teams with self-serve analytics tools.




Performance Measurement & Business Support

Develop performance frameworks.
Identify trends and provide recommendations.
Assist with forecasting, target setting, and promotional analysis.




Data Governance & Optimisation

Conduct QA checks for data accuracy.
Improve data architecture and integrate new data sources.
Apply advanced analytics using SQL, Databricks, and other tools.




What are we looking for?




2+ yearsâ€™ experience in a similar role.
Strong analytical mindset with a passion for uncovering insights.
Skilled in SQL and data visualisation (Looker Studio, Tableau, Power BI).
Familiarity with Amplitude/Google Analytics/Adobe Analytics.
Strong Excel/Google Sheets skills.
Experience in commercial analysis (target building, forecast setting, promotional analysis).
Strong communication skills.
Awareness of digital marketing.
A Level/degree in Mathematics or STEM.
Knowledge of statistics.
Python experience for data analysis.
Hands-on experience with dbt.
Awareness of data governance best practices.




This is a hybrid role requiring at least three days per week onsite.

Salary: Â£40,000 â€“ Â£45,000




For more information, please contact Gabby Zachrisson today.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Cure Talent is thrilled to partner with a rapidly growing medical technology company behind an award-winning medical device and transformative telehealth platform. We're now looking for a Data Analyst to join their team and play a key role in delivering data-driven insights to support smarter decisions and better patient outcomes.




This is an exciting opportunity to work in a high-impact role where your analysis will directly contribute to improving global access to ear and hearing healthcare.




Key Responsibilities:




Build and maintain dashboards and reports to support teams across the organisation.
Cleanse, model, and transform large-scale datasets for meaningful analysis.
Translate complex business requirements into clear, actionable data insights.
Automate processes to improve efficiency and reduce manual tasks.
Collaborate with tech teams to address data quality and improve architecture.




Weâ€™re looking for a Data Analyst with:




Strong SQL skills and hands-on experience with BigQuery and Looker Studio.
Advanced Excel skills including SUMIFS, COUNTIFS, INDEX-MATCH, arrays, and PivotTables.
A good understanding of GCP architecture and cloud computing services.
Proven experience handling large, complex datasets and delivering clear insights.
A proactive, detail-oriented mindset and a collaborative, can-do approach.




If you're a Data Analyst ready to join a fast-paced, mission-driven MedTech company making a real impact â€” weâ€™d love to hear from you!
