Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst â€“ Â£50k â€“ London / Hybrid (2â€“3 days in the office)




Weâ€™re hiring a Data Analyst to join a small but high-impact team within a pioneering media measurement company based in central London. This is an exciting opportunity to work at the cutting edge of audience and mobility data, helping advertisers understand who truly sees their campaigns.




The role sits at the intersection of data, insight, and storytellingâ€”perfect for someone whoâ€™s analytically sharp, curious, and eager to make a real impact.




Key Responsibilities:

â€¢ Data Analysis: Interrogate rich audience datasets to uncover trends, support new data releases, and validate new methodologies.

â€¢ Insight Generation: Turn complex data into clear, engaging stories for both technical and non-technical audiences.

â€¢ Reporting & Visualisation: Build dashboards, automate workflows, and contribute to stakeholder-facing reports.

â€¢ Stakeholder Support: Respond to subscriber queries, onboard new users, and contribute to industry discussions.

â€¢ Collaboration: Work closely with the Director of Research and Data Engineer on internal tooling and product evolution.




What Weâ€™re Looking For:

â€¢ 1â€“2 years of experience in a Data Analyst, Research Analyst or similar role

â€¢ Strong skills in SQL and Python (or R)

â€¢ Experience building dashboards (e.g., Tableau, Power BI)

â€¢ Interest or experience in spatial/mobility data (e.g., QGIS)

â€¢ Strong communicator with a knack for turning data into narrative

â€¢ Curious, detail-oriented, and confident working in a small team with autonomy




What Our Client Offers:

â€¢ Exposure to world-first audience measurement data

â€¢ A collaborative, supportive culture in a flexible hybrid setup

â€¢ Generous benefits including private healthcare, life cover, income protection and enhanced pension

â€¢ Structured training and development, with dedicated study days

â€¢ 25 days holiday + bank holidays + office closure between Christmas and New Year

If youâ€™re looking for a role that blends technical analysis with storytelling and stakeholder engagementâ€”weâ€™d love to hear from you!




The successful candidate must be fully eligible to work in the UK and be able to demonstrate first class communication skills in English - both written and presenting - as these will be a core facet of the role.




Apply now and we look forward to chatting with you about the role!

Source is passionate about providing a working environment that is welcoming, supportive and equitable for all. Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Us




Covering more trades than anyone else, Aspect is one of Londonâ€™s largest property maintenance teams. Weâ€™re always ready to help, no matter what maintenance issue someone has, operating 24/7. After over 15 years of helping thousands of residential and commercial customers every month, we have ambitious plans to expand our business over the next 3 years. Weâ€™re looking for ambitious people to join us at this exciting time.




The Role




The Data Analyst will play a key role in supporting our business through data-driven insights and solutions. Youâ€™ll be responsible for collecting, analyzing, and interpreting complex data from multiple sources to help drive decision-making across various departments.

You will:




Use tools like SQL, Python, Excel, Power BI, Tableau, and Salesforce to gather and analyze data.
Develop and maintain interactive dashboards and reports to track key performance indicators (KPIs), operational efficiency, and customer trends.
Collaborate with teams across the business to identify areas for improvement, optimize processes, and support business growth.
Conduct detailed data analysis, including data mining, trend analysis, and predictive analytics to inform business decisions.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity across all systems, implementing data quality checks and working with different departments to maintain consistent and accurate data inputs.
Provide actionable insights through visualizations and presentations, making complex data understandable for non-technical stakeholders.




This is an exciting opportunity for someone with a strong analytical background and experience in leveraging data tools to support strategic decision-making in a fast-paced environment.




About You




To excel in this role, you should have strong technical skills, a passion for data, and the ability to turn numbers into actionable business insights. Key qualifications include:

Proficiency in SQL for data extraction and manipulation.
Experience with Python for data analysis and automation of tasks.
Strong skills in data visualization tools like Power BI and Tableau to create dynamic, interactive reports.
Familiarity with Salesforce CRM or similar platforms to analyze customer and sales data.
Advanced Excel skills for data modeling, forecasting, and reporting.
Excellent problem-solving abilities, attention to detail, and a strong understanding of data governance principles.
Strong communication skills with the ability to explain complex data insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.




Knowledge of the property maintenance or service industry is a plus but not required.

Title: Data Analyst- London
Description:
Company Description

Turner & Townsend is a global professional services company with over 22,000 people in more than 60 countries.

Working with our clients across real estate, infrastructure, energy and natural resources, we transform together delivering outcomes that improve peopleâ€™s lives. Working in partnership makes it possible to deliver the worldâ€™s most impactful projects and programmes as we turn challenge into opportunity and complexity into success.

Our capabilities include programme, project, cost, asset and commercial management, controls and performance, procurement and supply chain, net zero and digital solutions.

We are majority-owned by CBRE Group, Inc., the worldâ€™s largest commercial real estate services and investment firm, with our partners holding a significant minority interest. Turner & Townsend and CBRE work together to provide clients with the premier programme, project and cost management offering in markets around the world.

Please visit our website: www.turnerandtownsend.com

Job Description

Due to growing demand for our services we are seeking to recruit experienced Data Analysts at Consultant, Senior Consultant & Principal Consultant levels to join our team. The role involves supporting a wide range of project commissions and major programmes and we are seeking individuals with a demonstrable track record of delivery in a consultancy environment.

The Opportunity

The responsibilities of the Data Analyst will include, but are not limited to:


Providing technical expertise and support to non-experts
Developing multi-faceted reports with recommendations to senior management
Development, analysis and maintenance of corporate datasets
Provide guidance and advice on data quality issues to a wide variety of data providers
Develop / use, the mechanisms employed by clients to recharge manpower against projects
Responsible for visibility, accuracy and transparency of the project critical path
Preparing presentation and other materials for client pitches.
Inputting key information into the Turner & Townsend internal database tools.


Qualifications

Required Skills


Must have active Security Clearance or, be eligible to receive Security Clearance if needed.
Minimum 2 yearsâ€™ experience working as a Data Analyst
Strong analytic and numeracy skills with the ability to understand and present data in different representations
Demonstrable track record in Data Analysis; identifying requirements and documenting these using the appropriate types of tools and documentation
Knowledge of data warehousing and ETL processes
End to end experience from project launch to ongoing operation of data, analytics and reporting projects
Ability to identify and run different business and model scenarios
Strong communicator, (both written and verbal), to liaise with the client, contractors and designers
Excellent capability in the use of Excel with ability to write macros to create automated dashboards, graphs and tables
A-Level equivalent in mathematics and/or computing


Desirable Skills & Experience


Experience in an Infrastructure or Defence environment
PRINCE2 / Agile Certification or experience gained
Degree educated or equivalent in an analytic subject
Understanding of Business Improvement Techniques
Ability, or desire to learn, to programme in languages such as VBA and SQL


Additional Information

Our inspired people share our vision and mission. We provide a great place to work, where each person has the opportunity and voice to affect change.

We want our people to succeed both in work and life. To support this we promote a healthy, productive and flexible working environment that respects work-life balance.

Turner & Townsend is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and actively encourage applications from all sectors of the community.

Please find out more about us at www.turnerandtownsend.com/

SOX control responsibilities may be part of this role, which are to be adhered to where applicable.

Join our social media conversations for more information about Turner & Townsend and our exciting future projects:

Twitter

Instagram

LinkedIn

It is strictly against Turner & Townsend policy for candidates to pay any fee in relation to our recruitment process. No recruitment agency working with Turner & Townsend will ask candidates to pay a fee at any time.

Any unsolicited resumes/CVs submitted through our website or to Turner & Townsend personal e-mail accounts, are considered property of Turner & Townsend and are not subject to payment of agency fees. In order to be an authorised Recruitment Agency/Search Firm for Turner & Townsend, there must be a formal written agreement in place and the agency must be invited, by the Recruitment Team, to submit candidates for review.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
LiveRamp is the data collaboration platform of choice for the worldâ€™s most innovative companies. A groundbreaking leader in consumer privacy, data ethics, and foundational identity, LiveRamp is setting the new standard for building a connected customer view with unmatched clarity and context while protecting precious brand and consumer trust. LiveRamp offers complete flexibility to collaborate wherever data lives to support the widest range of data collaboration use casesâ€”within organizations, between brands, and across its premier global network of top-quality partners.

Hundreds of global innovators, from iconic consumer brands and tech giants to banks, retailers, and healthcare leaders turn to LiveRamp to build enduring brand and business value by deepening customer engagement and loyalty, activating new partnerships, and maximizing the value of their first-party data while staying on the forefront of rapidly evolving compliance and privacy requirements.

You will join the international Data Science team based in London & Paris and will work with some of the worldâ€™s biggest data sets based in different geographies (Europe included UK, Latam, MENA). You will integrate with an existing team of 12 people (Data Scientist, Analyst, Engineer) and contribute actively to the LiveRamp international growth strategy. The job is based in our London office.

Role Overview

Being a part of the UK Data Science Team, you will work to deliver our data science solutions to a wide range of external clients; from well-known retailers to some of the largest digital platforms in the world.

Responsibilities


Delivering our offline sales measurement product for some of the worldâ€™s largest social platforms and retailers.
Work with our social platforms with recommendations to improve future campaigns.
Make suggestions to improve current workflows and products.
Analyze retailers data to deliver shopper insights to our customers (worldâ€™s largest CPGs & Agencies).


About You


Previous commercial or research experience as a data analyst
Hands-on experience in Python and SQL
Thorough understanding of Statistics
Client facing or stakeholder management experience delivering and presenting analytical results
The ability to communicate complex analytical information clearly to non-analytical audiences
Bachelorâ€™s Degree in a numerate discipline (e.g. Maths, Science, Computing)
Interest in digital marketing
0-2 years professional experience


Bonus Points


Experience with Cloud Computer technologies
Experience of advertising effectiveness measurement
Knowledge of digital marketing
French, Spanish or Portuguese is a plus.


Benefits


25 days holiday
Private Medical Insurance
Life Insurance and Income Protection
Matched Pension to 10%
Gym Membership Reimbursement
Carrot Benefit (Fertility & Family Forming)
Financial Planning Assistance
Bike to Work Scheme
Strong social committee â€“ events, happy hours, free lunch once a week
Central London location (WC2B)


More About Us

LiveRampâ€™s mission is to connect data in ways that matter, and doing so starts with our people. We know that inspired teams enlist people from a blend of backgrounds and experiences. And we know that individuals do their best when they not only bring their full selves to work but feel like they truly belong. Connecting LiveRampers to new ideas and one another is one of our guiding principlesâ€”one that informs how we hire, train, and grow our global team across nine countries and four continents. Title: Analyst
Description:
Gas Strategies is looking for an ambitious and capable person with an advanced quantitative and analytical ability to join the Consulting Team.




Accurate and precise, with an advanced level of Excel proficiency, the successful candidate will have some experience within the energy industry and will have developed a good understanding of current market dynamics. The role provides the first step on a career path towards a Consultant role in our well-established and successful global professional services consulting firm.




Purpose of Role

Responsible for the delivery of accurate, relevant, and efficient client-focused data analysis, market research, and modelling that exhibits a clarity of understanding of clientsâ€™ concerns and supports clientsâ€™ commercial decision making. This includes the ability to clearly articulate results and findings, in written and oral presentations, to both colleagues and clients.




Key Performance Indicators & Role Description




Data Modelling

To lead on the building and customisation of economic/commercial models for financial simulation and scenario planning as it pertains to key projects
To support the development and configuration of various in-house tools and models to deliver high value functionality
Develop and improve forecasting/modelling approaches and techniques




Data Management

Use a variety of tasks and methods to organise/analyse data from multiple sources with high degrees of rigour
Use systems and programming knowledge, personal experience, clientsâ€™ needs and project goals to provide business decision-making support
Assist with the development and utilisation of Gas Strategies Online products




Data Analysis

Break down issues and tasks into manageable parts in a systematic way and identify relationships between parts
Make the results of analysis understandable, enabling others to buy-in or accept conclusions
Identify, explore, and discuss client needs in order to identify all relevant parameters for inclusion in data models
Discuss and agree the approach to and allocation of project tasks with peers and project managers
Identify data risk elements and assumptions to determine implications and consequences of analysis
Provide technical data modelling assistance to other team members
Understand and interpret underlying research requirements and assumptions in order to identify suitable sources of relevant data
Assist with project delivery through the provision of inputs into presentations and projects
Co-ordinate timely execution and delivery of project outputs as agreed by project timelines




Consulting

Liaise, communicate and network with clients/project leaders to deliver client assignments
Develop good quality project content and reports and oversee quality/evaluation of technical material
Presentation of results and findings to clients




Essential requirements and experience:

Excellent numerate ability with high-level Excel and economic modelling ability
Have a significant background in economic forecasting methods and techniques
Experience of analysing complex data and deriving real business decision support (with tangible benefits to the business)
Have an interest and affinity for the energy and gas industry that is consistent with Gas Strategies Groupâ€™s positioning as a key provider of professional services at the heart of the industry
A team player who relishes the challenge of new experiences and exhibits a willingness to seek out opportunities within the business
Ability to quickly learn new concepts and apply these to the wider business context




Desirable requirements:

Have at least 1-2 yearsâ€™ experience of the energy industry, preferably within the global gas sector
Some exposure to consulting and client interaction would be advantageous




Personal Attributes:

Demonstrate accuracy and meticulous attention to detail
Strong planning, organisational, and time management skills
Creative problem-solving ability

Title: Data & AI Analyst
Description:
Attention all Data and Innovation Analysts!

If you are outcome-focused, have a keen curiosity, exceptional people skills, and the confidence to challenge the norm, we want to hear from you.

Join our dynamic IT team at Sompo UK as a Data and Innovation Analyst and be a pivotal part of our exciting growth journey! With Sompo's strategic priorities focused on leveraging data and transforming our operating model, this role offers a unique opportunity to contribute to innovative projects that drive our success. As a Data and Innovation Analyst, you will work closely with cross-functional teams to assist with data extraction, slip centre, enhanced submission centre, and data science experiments, as well as experiment with autonomous agents and assist with Power BI reports. Be part of a growing team where your contributions have a significant impact on Sompo's future. Apply now to take the next step in your career with us!

What Youâ€™ll Be Doing

Data Extraction and Analysis


Help with data extraction and analysis to support business decision-making.
Conduct data science experiments and experiment with autonomous agents.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity in reporting processes.


Enhanced Submission Centre and Slip Centre


Support the slip centre and enhanced submission centre operations.
Collaborate with IT teams to ensure technical feasibility and innovation.


Stakeholder Communication and Engagement


Build and maintain strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders.
Facilitate regular meetings to communicate project updates and gather feedback.
Act as a liaison between business units and IT to ensure effective collaboration.


Power BI Reporting


Assist in the creation of comprehensive reports and dashboards for stakeholders using Power BI.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity in reporting processes.


Project Management Support


Assist in defining project scope, objectives, and deliverables.
Coordinate with project teams to ensure alignment and timely delivery.
Monitor project progress and report on status to management.


What Youâ€™ll Bring


2+ yearsâ€™ experience in developing PowerBI reports and dashboards
2+ years writing complex SQL queries
2+ yearsâ€™ experience with Python
1+ year experience in the insurance industry
Experience with R, LLMâ€™s and autonomous agents preferred
Proven experience in data analysis, innovation, and the insurance industry: Leverage extensive experience and understanding of the insurance sector to offer insights and drive informed decision-making.
Curiosity and Innovation: Possess a natural curiosity and eagerness to explore new ideas, fostering a culture of innovation and continuous improvement.
Confidence to Challenge the Status Quo: Boldly question existing practices and propose creative solutions to enhance business processes and outcomes.
Flexibility in Methodologies: Adapt seamlessly between agile and waterfall methodologies, ensuring the appropriate approach is utilised for each project.
Exceptional People Skills: Build strong relationships with stakeholders at all levels, facilitating effective communication and collaboration.
Analytical Mindset: Apply strong analytical skills to interpret data and trends, supporting strategic initiatives and business objectives.
Problem-Solving Expertise: Demonstrate proficiency in identifying challenges and developing practical solutions to drive business success.
Commitment to Excellence: Maintain a high standard of work quality and strive for excellence in all aspects of the role.
Leveraging AI for Efficiency and Opportunities: Utilise AI technologies to enhance personal efficiency and identify innovative opportunities to improve processes and outcomes at Sompo.
Understanding of Product Management and Agile: Bring a good understanding of product management and agile principles, contributing to the development and enhancement of insurance products and services.


Join us at Sompo and be part of a global leader in the insurance industry, committed to innovation, growth, and excellence.

Our Benefits

We continuously evaluate and update our benefit programs to ensure that our plans meet the needs of our employees and their dependents. Below are a few highlights of our inclusive benefit programs:


Expansive Health & Wellness Benefits
Generous Retirement & Savings Plans
Global Parental Leave & Adoption Assistance


In todayâ€™s world, what do we stand for?

We strive to create exceptional value for our clients and shareholders while maintaining Sompo as an attractive place to work. We foster an environment of ongoing, open dialogue between managers and their direct reports, and believe in an organizational environment where everyone belongs. We proudly are a multi-racial, multi-cultural, global enterprise. We reject all forms of racism, bigotry, prejudice and injustice and continue to invest in building out an inclusive and diverse work environment.

About Us

Expert Partners.

Clarity in complexity.

Unwavering commitment.

Weâ€™re Sompo, a global provider of property, casualty, and specialty insurance and reinsurance. Building on Sompo Holdingsâ€™ 130 years of innovation, weâ€™re committed to applying all of our experience to simplify yours.

Our dedication to you shows up in the care we put in every detail, working to create a frictionless risk management journey for everyone we serve.

We lead with your priorities, meticulously crafting solutions, sharing insights, and understanding your needs.

Around the world, our 9,000+ employees use their expertise to learn, improve and find clear answers for your complex challenges.

Because when you choose Sompo, you choose the ease of expertise.

To learn more about visit our website at www.sompo-intl.com

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The Data Analyst will be responsible for collecting, analysing, and visualising key operational data across the University to drive informed decision-making. This role will focus on identifying trends and patterns in data related to estates and facilities, HR/People analytics, finance, and operational efficiency. Working with stakeholders across multiple departments, the post holder will generate reports and dashboards to enhance service levels, resource allocation, and performance monitoring.




This position is ideal for a data-driven professional with 2â€“3 years of experience in data analytics, reporting, and business intelligence tools, who can apply analytical insights to support University-wide operations effectively.

Key Responsibilities




Data Processing, Analysis & Reporting

Collect, clean, and analyse datasets from multiple sources, including workforce management, scheduling, finance, and HR systems.
Develop and maintain interactive dashboards and reports using Power BI
Identify trends and insights to support strategic decision-making.

Business Intelligence & Performance Analytics




Extract and analyse data from various systems such as Timegate, Servicetrac, and Liberty Telephone.
Provide performance insights and recommendations based on data analysis.

Stakeholder Engagement & Communication




Collaborate with different departments across the University to understand data needs and deliver actionable insights.
Communicate data-driven findings to senior leadership and operations teams.
Assist in preparing presentations and reports for internal stakeholders.

Financial & HR Data Analysis




Assist with financial reporting, ensuring a sound understanding of key financial metrics.
Analyse HR/People data to support workforce planning and compliance monitoring.
Support data-driven decision-making in resource allocation and performance management.

Process Improvement & Innovation




Continuously explore new tools and methodologies to enhance data analysis and reporting efficiency.
Assist in automating and streamlining data processes to improve accuracy and reduce manual workload.

The above list of responsibilities may not be exhaustive, and the post holder will be required to undertake other duties as reasonably expected within the scope and grading of the role.

Knowledge of Microsoft Power Automate or Power Apps would be beneficial but is not essential.

You May be asked to complete a test during the interview







This is a full time post (35 Hours per week), and you will be offered an indefinite contract

About you:

To be successful in this role, we are looking for candidates to have the following skills and experience:

Essential criteria

1. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to interpret data and generate insights

2. Experience working with operational, HR, or financial data

3. Ability to work efficiently under pressure and meet deadlines with Strong teamwork and collaboration skills.

4. Ability to work independently and proactively

5. Prior experience in an Admin role

6. Advanced user of Power BI (Portfolio to be attached in the cv and cover letter)

7. Presentation skills: ability to produce and deliver data-driven presentations

8. Sound understanding of financial metrics and analysis




Desirable criteria

1. Experience with Power Automate or Power App

2. Understanding of Soft Facilities Management




Downloading a copy of our Job Description

Full details of the role and the skills, knowledge and experience required can be found in the Job Description document, provided at the bottom of the next page after you click â€œApply Nowâ€. This document will provide information of what criteria will be assessed at each stage of the recruitment process.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Us

Philanthropy & Alumni Engagement (P&A) provides a fundraising and alumni engagement function in support of Kingâ€™s College London. We are proud to work with colleagues across the university and its health partners to help them serve society through world-leading education, research and healthcare. Our work also includes a partnership with the Maudsley Charity in support of childrenâ€™s mental health initiatives between the universityâ€™s Institute of Psychiatry, Psychology and Neuroscience and the South London & Maudsley NHS Trust.

We are a committed team that brings together fundraisers working across different channels, alongside colleagues who promote Kingâ€™s College Londonâ€™s engagement with its worldwide alumni community. Our work is underpinned and enhanced by a range of dedicated professionals in supporting areas covering proposition development, supporter engagement, supporter operations and business operations.

We have an impressive, well-established track record of success in securing support that allows the university and partners to deliver on their missions. This includes our global, award-winning World Questions: Kingâ€™s Answers campaign, which set the standard in the sector and enabled us to raise substantial funds to help tackle some of the worldâ€™s biggest challenges. Ambitious and innovative, the team has won awards such as a CASE Platinum Award for Fundraising and a CASE Gold Award for Donor Relations and Stewardship. We are strongly values-driven with a focus on sustaining an excellent and supportive culture, which we see as key to creating a successful team that can support the university and its partners in making a real and positive difference to the world we live in.

More on Kingâ€™s College London

Kingâ€™s College London is an internationally renowned university delivering exceptional education and world-leading research. The university is dedicated to driving positive and sustainable change in society and realising our vision of making the world a better place. Through its commitment to exceptional education, impactful research and genuine service to society, Kingâ€™s College London is creating positive change in its communities, both in London and on the world stage. The Strategic Vision 2029 looks forward to Kingâ€™s College Londonâ€™s 200th anniversary in 2029 and sets out ambitious plans in five key areas:

Educating the next generation of change-makers;
Challenging ideas and driving change through research;
Giving back to society through meaningful service;
Working with our local communities in London;
Fostering global citizens with an international perspective.




About the role

The Data Analyst works within the Data Team, using and transforming data from multiple sources to produce high quality, digestible reports, dashboards, and bespoke pieces of analysis for our fundraising and alumni colleagues. You will also lead on any benchmarking projects, both the submission of data and the interpretation and presentation of their findings. Being a clear communicator of often complex information, you will deliver insight into the performance of our various fundraising and engagement programmes, giving colleagues the information they need to continually innovate and improve.

In addition, you will have a raft of technical skills and approaches that will enable you to efficiently transform source data from multiple data sources ready for import into our Dynamics CRM system.

You will be keen to learn and develop, embracing new technologies and ways of working, and will work with the Data Team and others across the department to improve the quality of the underlying data we all rely on. You will also work closely with others in the team, IT colleagues and other users across the organisation to shape future CRM features.

You will be required to liaise and work collaboratively with other teams on new fundraising projects and initiatives, thereby ensuring a joined-up approach, that future reporting requirements can be met, with learning shared and insight retained. You will often need to manage multiple requests and prioritise your workload, albeit we have adopted an Agile approach to development.

This is a full time post (35 hours per week), and you will be offered an indefinite contract. P&A has a hybrid working approach, with a minimum of 40% of time in the office. Typically, this equates to two days per week, but weâ€™re very happy for colleagues to be in more frequently if they so wish.




About You

To be successful in this role, we are looking for candidates to have the following skills and experience:

Essential criteria

Knowledge of data insight, analysis and reporting techniques
Significant experience of working with a fundraising or marketing CRM in a technical, database management or report writing capacity
Strong SQL skills
Experience of building reports and dashboards using Power BI or other data visualization tools
Ability to create data transformations using tools such as Power Query, Power Automate and/or VBA macros
Experience of manipulating large or complex datasets
Ability to communicate often complex and technical information in a clear and digestible way to a wide range of stakeholders, both internal and external
Experience of managing conflicting deadlines and multiple priorities




Desirable criteria

Knowledge of data modelling/ analysis techniques
Experience of using Microsoft Dynamics and its associated applications such as Customer Insights
Experience of building dashboards within Microsoft Dynamics
Knowledge of other programming languages, such as DAX and M
Restless enthusiasm for learning new technologies and improving processes

Why? Because we think Web3 is a unique and democratising technology. It gives people back control of their money, digital identity, data, and property like nothing else before it.

What We Do
Weâ€™re the leading infrastructure company in Web3. This means we offer our partners everything from payment solutions (we call them 'Ramps') to minting software for digital collectibles, like NFTs. And over 30 million people around the world now trust our products â€” just take a look on Trustpilot.

Weâ€™re also big on collaborations. And we've worked on stunts, drops, and partnerships with some of the world's most prestigious and forward-thinking brands.

But thatâ€™s not all. We have also built our own consumer app because we wanted to see if we could build a better Web3 account. Itâ€™s taken off in a big way, and we're working hard to continually improve it and to strive for perfection.

So whatever your background, weâ€™re sure thereâ€™s something for you here. Come help us build the future of Web3 and digital ownership.

ðŸŒ” About the Opportunity

The Financial Intelligence Unit (FIU) is responsible for safeguarding the MoonPay platform against financial crime and money laundering activities. Leveraging advanced analytics and blockchain tracing tools, it collects and analyses huge volumes of data to identify potentially suspicious activities. The team collaborates with regulatory bodies, submitting suspicious activity reports (SARs) and sharing intelligence to combat financial crime.

The FIU Data Analyst will directly support the Compliance Technology Manager to govern the MoonPay Compliance tech stack and data science needs. This role ensures adherence to regulatory requirements and internal policies by directly supporting the FIUâ€™s data science, analytics, and reporting needs. This is also a global role that will support all operating businesses in the MoonPay family across the U.S., UK, Europe and beyond.

Locations: (London Hybrid)

Develop and maintain dashboards and reporting to monitor key compliance metrics

Identify trends and anomalies using advanced data analysis techniques and tools

Maintain documentation on the compliance data stack, supporting audits and model validations
Support the compliance team with ad-hoc data analyses, and act as a trusted point of contact for all compliance data needs
Communicate your findings with stakeholders across the team and wider company





ðŸ§‘â€ðŸš€ About You



Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Finance, or a relevant technical field. Masters degree or above is a plus

Exceptional problem-solving skills and attention to detail
Team player with good communication skills, with the ability to explain technical concepts clearly to different audiences
Ability to handle shifting priorities and thrive in a dynamic environment. Comfortable to work independently and upskill on new tools and technology
Interested in cryptocurrency, blockchain and financial crime detection





Bonus points for:


Prior experience working in a fast-paced fintech/cryptocurrency company
Experience with cloud data services such as GCP, Snowflake or AWS
Prior familiarity with AML (Anti-Money Laundering) rules and transaction monitoring
Knowledge of key blockchain concepts and on-chain data structure





ðŸ’» What you will be working with/on

This is an exciting opportunity to be part of a dynamic and innovative team that values collaboration, adaptability, and making a meaningful impact in the cryptocurrency space.

Most importantly, though, you will embody the core principles that everyone here at the MoonPay lives by. Our â€œBLOCK Valuesâ€ are at the heart of everything we do - and they areâ€¦

Commitment To Diversity
At MoonPay we believe that every voice matters. We strive to create a mindful and respectful environment where everyone can bring their authentic self to work, and experience a culture that is free of harassment, racism, and discrimination. Thatâ€™s why we are committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace and are a proud equal opportunity employer. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. This policy applies to all employment practices within our organization, including, but not limited to, hiring, recruiting, promotion, termination, layoff, and leave of absence.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analytics Specialist â€“ Banking/Financial Services

Location: Hybrid - London or Northampton

Rate: Â£350.00 - Â£400.00 per day inside IR35

Duration: 12 months




About the Role

We are seeking an experienced Analytics Specialist to join our client's growing team and support the execution of their customer engagement strategy through impactful data analytics. This is a hands-on role where you'll collaborate closely with customer engagement teams to uncover actionable insights, enhance campaign effectiveness, and help shape strategic decisions.




Key Responsibilities

Support customer engagement strategy execution through targeted data analytics.
Partner with customer engagement teams to inform and refine campaigns.
Perform customer segmentation and targeting based on performance insights.
Measure and optimise campaign performance using advanced analytics tools.
Develop performance reports and dashboards to track engagement outcomes.
Contribute to the creation of business cases using data-driven insights.
Manage multiple workstreams with attention to detail and deadlines.
Collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders to drive coordination and results.




What Weâ€™re Looking For

Minimum 5 years of experience in performance analytics, ideally in a cards or financial services environment.
Proven experience working alongside customer engagement and marketing teams.
Strong background in campaign measurement, optimisation, and reporting.
Expertise in customer segmentation and targeting based on data insights.
Solid knowledge of data modelling solutions and analytical tools.
Highly organised, detail-oriented, and able to juggle multiple projects.
A collaborative team player who can support senior stakeholders effectively.




Please attach your CV for immediate consideration.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst | Wealth & Asset Management




Salary: Up to Â£50,000 plus generous package




Location: London, Hybrid (3 days per week onsite)




Position: Permanent







I'm partnered with an ambitious and fast-growing wealth management group, backed by private equity and actively expanding through strategic acquisitions. This is a business that combines the agility of a scale-up with the backing and stability of a well-capitalised, established firm. Their modular approach to wealth services has positioned them as a major disruptor in the UK financial services space.




As part of this transformation journey, they are looking to bring on a Data Analyst - a key strategic and operational role reporting into the CTO. This role sits at the heart of technology operations and is instrumental in shaping how data is used to drive decisions, monitor performance, and deliver operational excellence across the technology function.




This isnâ€™t a traditional back-office data role. Youâ€™ll act as the connective tissue between the CTO, Finance, Delivery, and other leadership teams, helping to ensure that data is consistently driving smarter decisions and strategic alignment.




What Youâ€™ll Be Doing:

Designing and maintaining executive dashboards that provide visibility into financials, supplier performance, risk, delivery metrics, and workforce analytics
Leading budget tracking, cost control, and forecasting within the technology function
Managing vendor data, including contract renewals, reviews, and supplier KPIs
Monitoring and reporting on operational and technology risks, security vulnerabilities, and audit items
Aggregating Agile delivery metrics and reporting progress against forecasted business benefits
Supporting governance and prioritisation processes with high-quality data and analysis
Acting as a liaison across key stakeholders, ensuring alignment and structured decision-making
Identifying and driving improvements across operational workflows




Skills and Qualifications:

Experience in a technology operations, business management, or data-driven strategy role
Financial experience across budgeting, variance analysis, and cost tracking; ideally with an accounting qualification (CIMA, ACCA, ACA) or equivalent experience
Excellent proficiency with data analytics tools - particularly Power BI and Excel
Deep understanding of IT operations, supplier management, and risk frameworks
Familiarity with Agile delivery principles and project performance tracking
Confident communicator, comfortable working with senior stakeholders and across departments
Ability to turn complex data into clear, actionable insight




Perks (to name a few):

Attractive employee pension scheme
25 days annual leave + public holidays + office Christmas close (3 days)
Buy and sell holidays up to 5 days
Private medical insurance, group life insurance, and income protection insurance
Discretionary performance-related bonus




This is a rare opportunity to join a business in high-growth mode, where youâ€™ll be empowered to shape how data drives performance and technology strategy from the inside out. If this sounds like your kind of challenge, don't hesitate to apply!




*Unfortunately, due to a high number of applications, not all applicants will receive feedback

  • Familiarity with Agile delivery principles and project performance tracking
  • Confident communicator, comfortable working with senior stakeholders and across departments
  • Ability to turn complex data into clear, actionable insight


Perks (to name a few):

  • Attractive employee pension scheme
  • 25 days annual leave + public holidays + office Christmas close (3 days)
  • Buy and sell holidays up to 5 days
  • Private medical insurance, group life insurance, and income protection insurance
  • Discretionary performance-related bonus


This is a rare opportunity to join a business in high-growth mode, where youâ€™ll be empowered to shape how data drives performance and technology strategy from the inside out. If this sounds like your kind of challenge, don't hesitate to apply!


*Unfortunately, due to a high number of applications, not all applicants will receive feedback

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst (1 Year Maternity Cover)

Â£35,000 - Â£40,000 + 10% bonus + benefits

London (2 days per week in the office)




Our client




Our client is a global strategic technology and payments partner. They deliver seamless personalised shopping experiences to over 29m international shoppers, who in turn generate â‚¬22.9bn revenue.




With 2,000 employees spread across 50 countries, they integrate with 300,000 point of sale systems in a number of luxury retailers and brands including Harrods, Selfridges, John Lewis, Libertyâ€™s, Apple, Cartier, De Beers, HermÃ¨s, Rolex, Dior and Jimmy Choo.




Their products include tax-free shopping, smart data and intelligence, marketing and sales, POS technology and payment solutions.




The role




The Data Analyst will help the business to understand customer needs and behaviours through the analysis of complex data sets and subsequent translation into meaningful, shareable insights and stories.




This role will be hands on with building visualisations in Tableau and ad hoc analysis (using SQL) to inform the optimisation of products and features.




As a Data Analyst, you will:




Monitor and report on key KPIs.
Deep-dive (using SQL) into customer data to provide product teams with detailed customer analysis.
Be hands-on with building visualisations in Tableau.
Identify data requirements, working with international data teams to ensure data is cleansed and prepared.
Support with the identification of new and innovative ways to leverage data to deliver new customer engagement opportunities, optimise channels and deliver economic efficiency.
Deliver enhanced customer profiling and segmentation.
Measure the effectiveness of customer-facing products, features and campaigns.
Provide ad-hoc analysis to inform the optimisation of customer-facing products, features and campaigns.
Advise on how advanced statistical and analytical techniques can further improve the understanding of customers.




To apply, you should have




Experience working as a Data Analyst with good exposure to statistical methodologies.
Intermediate SQL skills.
Advanced experience with Tableau (or a similar tool).
Advanced Excel skills.
Proven experience delivering impactful and actionable insights with a B2C environment.




The perks include




25 days holiday + bank holidays.
An extra day off for moving to a new house; 2 days off for your wedding; 3 days off for charity / community days.
Private healthcare and medical cashback plan.
Perkbox.
Competitive pension plan.
Virgin gym membership.




Match Digital specialises in connecting talented individuals with businesses in the digital, tech, media and marcomms industries.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst

London-based (3 days on-site) | Salary: Â£60-70k + excellent benefits package




About the Role

A leading financial services client in London is seeking a talented MI/Data Analyst to join their Information Security team. In this strategic position, you'll drive technology compliance initiatives by producing insightful management information through sophisticated dashboards and reporting. Collaborating with senior stakeholders, you'll help shape and inform critical decision-making for executive leadership.




Key Responsibilities

Design and maintain advanced data visualization dashboards using PowerBI
Analyze complex datasets to identify trends, compliance gaps, and actionable insights
Spearhead automation initiatives to enhance reporting efficiency
Present compelling data narratives to diverse stakeholder groups
Mentor junior team members and contribute to best practices




Requirements

2-4 years' proven experience in Finance/Technology environments
Demonstrated experience analyzing and reporting on IT function data
Advanced PowerBI expertise with portfolio of successful implementations
Practical knowledge of IT metrics and DevSecOps frameworks
Strong analytical mindset with exceptional data visualization capabilities
Proficiency in scripting/automation technologies
Experience working within Agile methodologies
Technology degree essential
MSc in Data Analytics and security qualifications (ISACA, CISM, etc.) advantageous







If you have the skills and experience we're looking for, please apply with your updated CV.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Based: Remote / homeworking with occasional attendance at Habinteg Offices, either London or Bradford.

Hours: Full time 35hrs/week

Salary: Â£38,646

About Us

People come to work for Habinteg because they believe in what matters to us. Inclusion drives all that we do, be that the services we offer to tenants, the environments we create or the homes we deliver. One in four people in this country are disabled but most homes are designed to exclude them. We believe in designing homes and creating neighbourhoods that everyone can share and enjoy. We have over 3000 homes across the country from Tyneside to Cornwall. We are champions of the Lifetime Homes Standard and provide expert training and consultancy through our Centre for Accessible Environments (CAE) in-house team.

About The Post

Habinteg are recruiting to an exciting role within our organisation, and we are seeking an experienced Data Analyst to join our newly formed data team. The Data Analyst is responsible for:


Identifying and prioritising opportunities for automation and streamlining of data processes.
Collaborating with stakeholders to understand data and reporting requirements and deliver automated, efficient solutions using SQL, Power BI, and other tools.
Supporting business-as-usual (BAU) reporting by designing, maintaining, and improving recurring dashboards and reports to meet internal and external reporting needs.
Documenting and standardising data processes, ensuring consistency, traceability, and ease of knowledge transfer across teams.
Working with system owners and data stewards to enhance data quality, resolve discrepancies, and establish clear data ownership.
Supporting the transition from manual processes to automated, scalable data workflows by introducing best practices and guiding teams through change.
Providing training and support to staff on data reporting tools and best practices to promote data literacy and a self-service reporting culture.
Contributing to the development and delivery of strategic data initiatives and continuous improvement projects that align with Habintegs digital transformation goals.


About You

You have a passion for data analysis and reporting to help drive and improve services. You have a keen eye for detail, can extract and analyse complex datasets and are able to represent these in a way that is accessible to a range of stakeholders including tenants, senior managers, and colleagues. You are committed to supporting the organisation in leveraging data effectively by gathering, analysing, and visualising key datasets to inform decision-making at all levels, provide service insights, process improvements and business planning.

For a full Job Description please contactour recruitment department via email.

Closing date for applications: 6th June 2025.

Interviews scheduled for week commencing 9th June 2025.

This role may close earlier than the advertised closing date,so dont delay submitting your application!

If you have any questions, pleasefeel free to contact the HR department.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
For a quarter of a century, the Jellycat family have brought joy, wonder and playful fun to people of all ages, in every part of the world. Utterly original and in a class of their own, they are currently among the most loved and collected toys of their kind. How has this gentle tribe endeared themselves to so many? Perhaps it is their whimsical expressions. Or the deliciously soft fabrics. Or the beautiful way in which they sit in your hand. Whatever it is, there is something magical and unmistakeable about each one of them.

As part of our ongoing business improvement focus, this role will be a proactive, strategic and hands-on leader of a business intelligence function driving positive behaviours in data based decision making throughout the business.

A business facing role, that will work primarily with finance, product and planning teams this role will own and maintain the existing PowerBI infrastructure, data products and services, with the scope to improve and evolve our data and digital processes.

You'll be;


Enabling data based decision makers in the business.
Analysing data and reporting operational support.
Answering and triage tickets as they come in.
Performing Root Cause Analysis across multiple platforms, data sources and reports.
Working in Agile Methodology with the broader D&A team.
Holding regular training and learning sessions with the business to enable Self-Serve Analytics.
Leading and building out CoE for Self-Serve capability.
Educating and inspiring the business in the art of the possible with BI, reporting and dashboards.


You'll have;


At least 3 years as a Data Analyst or data related experience.
Experience with SQL, PySpark, and Python experience needed.
Experience in Power BI and or similar visual reporting tool required.
Proficiency in Excel.
Demonstratable experience in building out analysis and reports.
Great organisational skills & excellent communication skills.
Ability to work to fixed deadlines and SLAs.
A logical mind, and likes to use data and evidence to support findings.
Excellent trouble shooting skills.
Ablity to work independently and under pressure from time to time.

Title: Business Analyst - Data
Description:
Job Introduction

This role will sit in our Technology function partnering closely with our Product organisation and the Business. A key part of this role is to help develop our Agile mindset that facilitates regular, repeatable and reliable change across technology platforms, in line with the Technology strategy and roadmap. As a business analyst you will work in close collaboration with the business, product and engineering to analyse, review, define and shape new technology solutions, and be responsible for the requirements definition and analysis for new technology products and platforms. Specifically, this role will have a strong data focus and support Selfridges Enterprise Data & Finance data squads and initiatives.

As The Business Analyst You Will


Plan and estimate the business analysis activities and deliverables required within a given initiative.
Support Product with the definition and documentation of the business problem or opportunity and contribute to establishing the business case and gaining commitment to the change.
Work with the Business, Product and Engineering teams to identify and define the requirements using multiple techniques including (but not limited to) workshops, observation, interviews and creation of workflow models.
Work as part of a technology Squad and being actively involved in backlog refinement, sprint planning, sprint reviews, retrospectives and the daily stand-up (including demos/showcases) and ensure all projects have the required assets at the appropriate stages of the delivery lifecycle.
Elicit, validate, refine and manage the requirements within a given initiative, including defining the non-functional requirements, using appropriate tools and techniques.
Ensure that all requirements are well structured, clear and defined, with each requirement having valid and complete acceptance criteria.
Develop and document data mapping specifications to specify how source data is mapped to target systems data, along with the required business & transformation rules.
Perform data gap analysis of key problem areas to assist in root cause analysis.
Demonstrate an understanding of SQL, relational databases, reporting tools (e.g. Power BI) and have experience of data modelling and cataloguing tools.
Manage the risks and issues associated with requirements definition and the broader business analysis activities.
Collaborate with the Business and Product teams to agree, define and document the business processes associated with all new solutions inc. â€œas-isâ€ business process analysis, aligned to industry (BPMN) and Selfridges standards.
Manage and track requirements as they move from discovery through to implementation. Identify when new requirements change the scope of the overall solution and ensure that the appropriate change control processes are followed, including accurate impact assessment.
Collaborate with the Quality Engineering team to validate the test scenarios defined by them, ensure the appropriate level of test coverage is in place and that exception scenarios are well thought through against the requirements and support the quality activities through the delivery lifecycle.
Actively support the UAT (e.g. test case creation) and provide knowledge and expertise to support defect resolution.
Actively support (and undertake where necessary) business change activities e.g. training.
Fully understand the implementation of existing solutions within the domain and how they fit with the overall systems architecture.
Understand modern technology concepts, grasp new ones quickly and appreciate their implications on delivery.
Proven experience of delivering high quality, customer focused analysis in a complex and changing environment, in both Agile and Waterfall delivery environments.
You will report to a Senior Business Analyst and work closely with the broader IT community and third parties.
A passion for retail, heritage brands and a desire to learn deeply about our customer needs


How Youâ€™ll Do Itâ€¦you Will Have


Leadership. You hold yourself and others accountable to meet commitments and role model excellent behaviours and lead through both success and failure with a high focus on outcomes.
Judgement. Ability to make informed decisions based upon analysis, experience, and judgement, with data driven decisions at the fore.
Stakeholder Management. Comfortable challenging the status quo respectfully, providing advice to improve delivery. Ability to manage and engage multiple stakeholders providing the right updates and insight at the right points. Builds strong relationships and trust quickly at all levels of the organisation with both business and technical stakeholders.
Communication. An excellent communicator, both verbal and written. Ability to present information that it is engaging, well-structured and appropriate for the given audience.
Collaboration. Builds partnerships with internal and external stakeholders & suppliers and works collaboratively with others, bringing them together to meet shared objectives.
Problem Solving. Able to foresee and resolve potential bottlenecks, delays and barriers to delivery. Seeks solutions to problems in a practical and pragmatic way, demonstrating a logical and analytical approach.
Business Insight. Applies knowledge of the business and the marketplace to advance the organisation's goals. Demonstrates a customer focused mindset and a clear understanding of how own activities relate to critical business drivers and customer outcomes.
Action Oriented. Takes on new opportunities and tough challenges with a sense of urgency, high energy, and enthusiasm. Takes timely action on important or difficult issues. Identifies and pursues new opportunities that benefit the organization.
Passion for Business Analysis. Passionate and knowledgeable about Business Analysis and industry best practice. Someone who is keen to be actively involved and contribute to the Business Analysis community
Data Knowledge. Experience of working on data platform projects and knowledge of data solutions and systems. Be knowledgeable of different methodologies and best practices for data extraction, transformation, and load (e.g. ELT) between different applications and technologies.


Selfridges

Selfridges

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Contract : 6 months

Pay rate: Â£408 Inside IR35

Location: Hybrid Paddington 3 days per week







Job Responsibilities/Objectives




1. Developing software or scripts required to deliver data products, including visualisation tools, databases and data processing systems

2. Developing new or improving existing methodologies, processes and products, and driving improvements in quality

3. Continuous improvement of the ability to deliver changes to products in a regular, reliable, and predictable manner through improving feedback loops throughout the product delivery process

4. Developing a thorough understanding of Mobile Network Data and its processing to be able to take full advantage of the data assets

5. Respond to technical issues in a professional and timely manner




Required Skills/Experience




1. Experience in writing and deploying production ready code

2. Strong understanding of databases and experience in writing analytical queries and data processes in SQL and or Python

3. Strong track record of defining and implementing data process changes independently

4. Experienced in effective use of Git or similar for change control

5. Experienced in developing complex methodology, analysing data and visualising complex ideas to customers

6. Aptitude for problem solving

7. Able to comprehend, define, and implement changes independently

8. Self-motivated with good organisational and time management skills

9. Business awareness and aptitude for building and developing data products

10. Good standard of written and spoken English

Desirable Skills/Experience




1. Experienced in using CI / CD pipelines

2. Experienced in working in continuous delivery environment

3. Experience with processing large volumes of data

4. Experienced in working with data used in transport modelling

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
DRW is a diversified trading firm with over 3 decades of experience bringing sophisticated technology and exceptional people together to operate in markets around the world. We value autonomy and the ability to quickly pivot to capture opportunities, so we operate using our own capital and trading at our own risk.

Headquartered in Chicago with offices throughout the U.S., Canada, Europe, and Asia, we trade a variety of asset classes including Fixed Income, ETFs, Equities, FX, Commodities and Energy across all major global markets. We have also leveraged our expertise and technology to expand into three non-traditional strategies: real estate, venture capital and cryptoassets.

We operate with respect, curiosity and open minds. The people who thrive here share our belief that itâ€™s not just what we do that mattersâ€“it's how we do it. DRW is a place of high expectations, integrity, innovation and a willingness to challenge consensus.

As a Data Analyst you will play an integral role in all operational aspects of onboarding, managing and maintaining various datasets used by traders and quantitative researchers. You will work closely with a variety of stakeholders, including technology, front office, operations, research, and risk management. You should be comfortable investigating complex data support issues in a fast-paced environment

What You Will Do In This Role


Help verify, clean, and ensure data is accurate and consistent across systems used for research and analysis by the various trading teams globally
Analyse datasets in order to draw conclusions and provide insight to address stakeholder or project-related questions
Collect metrics and analyse datasets across different dimensions of data quality including; completeness, validity, accuracy, timeliness, and consistency
Perform preliminary root cause analysis of data quality issues
Monitor and work through production data issues whilst engaging key stakeholders across multiple teams and facilitating global support
Assist the wider team by identifying opportunities for improving existing data pipelines


What You Will Need In This Role


Knowledge of a variety of financial instruments, in particular exposure to derivatives instruments
Experience working with SQL
Experience with cloud storage solutions
Prior experience documenting complex processes. Ideally some exposure to Confluence
Python programming skills: PySpark, Pandas, Jupyter Notebooks
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment; strong communication skills are desirable


Additional skills or experience which enhance consideration for this role


Prior experience developing data quality checks using Python
Familiarity with compressed/optimized file formats for data storage such as Parquet and HDF5
Prior experience working with Bloomberg Terminal
Familiarity with Linux and basic Bash scripting skills
Prior experience working with version control software
Experience with workflow management tools (Airflow / Argo)


For more information about DRW's processing activities and our use of job applicants' data, please view our Privacy Notice at https://drw.com/privacy-notice.

California residents, please review the California Privacy Notice for information about certain legal rights at https://drw.com/california-privacy-notice.

Title: Junior Analytics Analyst
Description:
JOB DESCRIPTION

Title Junior Analytics Analyst

Department Data, Insights & Strategy

Reports to Head of Insights & Strategy







SUBSTANCE GLOBAL

Substance Global is a digital marketing agency specialising in a range of services across different media and industries. We are proud of our work and our people in equal measure and our passion for what we do and the culture we have developed is what drives us in everything we do. Founded in 2003, we have grown to over 60 people in London, Los Angeles, Singapore and Buenos Aires. Our work is insights-driven and innovation-led and our strategies are made up of a blend of creativity and collaboration, tailor-made for each of our clientâ€™s brands.

GENERAL SUMMARY

As an Analytics Engineer, you will play a critical role in designing and developing data pipelines, ensuring data integrity, and enabling data-driven decision-making. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data engineering and analytics, with expertise in Google Cloud Platform (GCP) services. This role requires a blend of technical proficiency, analytical thinking, effective project & time management, and communication skills. You will have the opportunity to engage in diverse, innovative projects spanning multiple platforms, including real-time data processing and emerging AI technologies, offering opportunities to work with cutting-edge tools and methodologies in the rapidly evolving field of data analytics.




Substance Global is a digital marketing agency; as such a proficiency in sentiment and social analysis via social listening tools like Brandwatch/Talkwater/ etc, working knowledge and of 3rd party tools such as Sprinklr, Sprout Social and GWI. As well as experience working with platform scraping tools like Fivetran/Adverity/Apify etc (working knowledge of JSON files and API calls).




How Youâ€™ll Make An Impact

Design and implement high-performance, reusable, and scalable data models for our data warehouse using scheduling tools and GCP/BigQuery.
Design and implement visualisation tools (explores, views, etc) which will enable users across the organization to self-serve analytics
Work closely with key stakeholders to understand business requirements and provide data ready for analysis and reporting.
Blended data approaches include owned, earned, and paid data sources. Plus, the inclusion of social listening and 3rd party data sources.
Continuously discover, transform, test, deploy and document data sources and data models
Apply, help define, and champion data warehouse governance: data quality, testing, documentation, coding best practices.
Take initiative to improve and optimise analytics engineering workflows and platforms

Key Responsibilities

Design, develop, and maintain scalable data pipelines on GCP (Or other cloud services ie. Snowflake) using services such as BigQuery and Cloud Functions.
Designing and building data models for analytics, reporting, and data science applications in Looker/Metabase(Visualisation solutions) using (explores, views, etc) which will enable users across the organization to self-serve analytics.
Strong Python (Pandas/SQL Alchemy) & SQL(BigQuery/Snowflake) skills for maintaining ETL/ELT pipelines.
Developing tools and processes to ensure the quality and observability of data
Monitoring and improving the performance and efficiency of the data stack
Producing excellent documentation on all of the above
Working in a small, agile team to build excellent data product
Continuously discovering, transforming, testing, deploying, and documenting data sources and data models
Building great relationships with stakeholders and understanding their needs and challenges. Being curious, adaptable, and willing to pitch in to help with data problems of all shapes and sizes

Qualifications

Proven delivery experience as a data, business intelligence or analytics engineer
Hands-on proven data modeling and data warehousing skills demonstrated in data environments
Excellent Python & SQL and data transformation skills (e.g. ideally proficient in dbt or similar)
Familiarity with at least one of these Cloud technologies: Snowflake, AWS, Google Cloud, Microsoft Azure
Good attention to detail to highlight and address data quality issues
Excellent time management and proactive problem-solving skills




Whatâ€™s in it for you:

ðŸ’·Competitive Salary.

ðŸ–ï¸23 days holiday.

ðŸšƒIn-office/Hybrid or Fully remote.

ðŸ‹ï¸Vitality Healthy care package

ðŸ›ï¸Perkbox discount and points program.

â˜•ï¸Access to Co-working spaces.

ðŸ“šLinkedIn Courses and time for training.




How to apply:

Send your CV and portfolio link to: jobs@substanceglobal.com




This role is perfect for a creative designer with the ability to push creative ideas to new heights.




EDI statement and our people pledge

Donâ€™t meet every single requirement? Research shows that women and people of colour are less likely that other to apply if they donâ€™t match 100% of the job requirements. Donâ€™t let the confidence gap stand in your way, weâ€™d love to hear from you! We understand that experience comes in many difference forms and are dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team.

Substance Global is committed to providing and fair, inclusive, and diverse work-environment. We believe that different perspectives lead to better ideas, and better ideas allow us to better understand the needs and interests of our diverse, global community with who we work. We welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities, and perspectives and are an equal opportunities employer.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst

Location: London (hybrid working 2-3 days per week in office)

Salary: Â£35k - Â£40k (depending on experience)




About Us

Milberg London is an independent claimant focused law firm. In our first 5 years, we have established ourselves as a market leader in UK class actions acting for over 150,000 clients across various cases.

We are seeking a detail-oriented and analytical Data Analyst with a proven track record of working with large datasets. In this role, you will play a critical role in maintaining data quality, conducting advanced analysis, and supporting legal teams in preparing their data for submission. Reporting to the Head of Data, this position is part of our dynamic Data Team based in our London office.




Key Responsibilities

Conduct comprehensive data analysis to ensure the accuracy and integrity of all data systems.
Manage large datasets, focusing on data cleanliness, identifying anomalies, and ensuring robust data collection.
Extract and import data using Salesforce and other platforms as required.
Build and deliver ad-hoc reporting to support business activities.
Collaborate with case managers to manage and serve client data to defendants.
Use Asana or similar task management tool to effectively manage and prioritise workload.




Key Skills and Qualifications

Essential:

Advanced knowledge of Excel with the ability to manage large volumes of data â€“ including demonstrated capabilities with pivot tables, VLOOKUPs and other formulas.
Exceptional organisational skills and attention to detail, ensuring high levels of accuracy.
Excellent time management to ensure tasks are delivered on time.
Strong problem-solving skills and a proactive mindset.
At least 1 yearsâ€™ experience working within a similar role.
Can be based at our London Office (min 2 days per week on site)
Have the right to work in the UK

Desirable:

Experience with Salesforce.
Experience using Asana or other task management tool.
Experience working within the Legal sector.
Proficiency in Power Query, SQL, and/or Python to support data transformation tasks.
A numerate degree (e.g., Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, or Computer Science) at undergraduate or postgraduate level.




Benefits:

25 days annual leave plus bank holidays.
Pension scheme.
Life assurance, critical illness and private health insurance scheme.
Annual discretionary bonus scheme.
Mobile phone allowance.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Iglu Why You'll Love Working Here

At Iglu.com, we're more than just a travel company â€” weâ€™re the UKâ€™s leading online cruise retailer, and weâ€™re redefining what it means to book a cruise in the digital age.

Working At Iglu Means


ðŸ’¬ Flat structure, real impact â€“ Your ideas matter. Everyone contributes, and youâ€™ll see the results of your work fast.
ðŸŒ´ Cruise perks & travel love â€“ Weâ€™re in the business of adventure, and youâ€™ll feel it.
ðŸ§  Smart, supportive people â€“ Join a talented, close-knit team that genuinely enjoys solving hard problems together.
ðŸš€ Room to grow â€“ Weâ€™re on a transformation journey, and thereâ€™s huge opportunity to shape the future with us.
Training and development - Paid for training, conferences and certification e.g. AWS Certs.


We combine a passion for travel with a love for technology, delivering smart, seamless customer experiences and building platforms that handle the complexity of modern cruising â€” all while keeping things collaborative and fun.

About The Role

You will be working within our Analytics team, cross functionally serving different areas of our growing travel business.

Data At Iglu

This is an exciting opportunity to join a growing and crucial function of the business, your day to day responsibilities will be to generate insight, ensure effective communication and adoption into the business processes.

Analysing data, identifying trends, forecasting and modelling to make recommendations to the business. This is a varied role, looking at all aspects of the business, and will require a good work ethic and an ability to work quickly and diligently. This is an opportunity to have a positive impact on the business by driving change and continuous improvement, and evaluating the impact of these changes.

Responsibilities


Interrogate and analyse data to establish market and product trends, find new opportunities, improve efficiency and build forecasts models, across the cruise sectors
Present findings & recommendations to the management team to support the running of the business, drive growth and efficiencies;
Work alongside the BI Team, to validate data and facilitate new data points and sources;
Work closely with other departments to ensure their reporting needs are being met, help identify new areas for analysis as required;
Create daily, weekly and ad-hoc reporting on performance, trends and opportunities;
Produce written documentation to support your work, report on your findings an to present to stakeholders when necessary;
Provide continued reporting and evaluation on the impact of changes made;


Key Skills


Proven project experience with SQL, experience with Python packages a plus
Proficiency with data visualisation software (Tableau preferred)
Business acumen, a passion in learning how businesses operate, which strategies are implemented and which industry trends buffet and boost the business.
Microsoft office/G Suite proficiency, especially with Excel


About You


Have an appetite for personal development
Display great self awareness around time management and prioritisation
Are diligent and conscientious
Show adaptability and resilience
Have personal drive
Are focused
Are trusted by others and offer support
Communicate well with others within their own department and across the business
Show accountability and embrace responsibility
Have previous g-suite experience

Â£50,000
London (Chiswick)



I'm partnered with a key client of mine who are looking for a Data Analyst to join their team. As a Data Analyst you will become a key driver of innovation and efficiency.
