Title: Data Design Analyst
Description:
At Rockstar Games, we create world-class entertainment experiences.

Become part of a team working on some of the most rewarding, large-scale creative projects to be found in any entertainment medium - all within an inclusive, highly-motivated environment where you can learn and collaborate with some of the most talented people in the industry.

Rockstar Games is on the lookout for a passionate Data Design Analyst with strong software development skills who possesses a passion for both games and big data.

This is a full-time, permanent and in-office position based in Rockstarâ€™s unique game development studio in the heart of London.

What We Do


The Rockstar Analytics team provides insights and actionable results to a wide variety of stakeholders across the organization in support of their decision making.
We partner with multiple departments across the company, leveraging analytics to measure and improve the success and health of our games.
We collaborate as a global team to develop cutting-edge data pipelines, data products, data models, reports, analyses, and machine learning applications.
The Business Analytics vertical within the Analytics team is tasked with empowering Rockstar with data by helping design and implement game telemetry that drives better gameplay, player engagement, and business decisions.
We aim to win hearts and minds by making data accessible, insightful, and actionable â€“ building strong relationships with developers, designers, and stakeholders to ensure data is embraced as a core part of game development.


Responsibilities


Partner with game designers, developers, and other stakeholders to help design and implement robust telemetry that supports long-term insights.
Bridge the gap between data and non-data teams, ensuring our data meets the needs for achieving great game balance, player experience, and business intelligence.
Advocate for the power of data, helping teams understand its value and how it can shape better decision-making.
Build strong relationships across teams and time zones, influencing and educating stakeholders to drive data-informed decisions.
Create impactful visualizations and reports using SQL, Excel, and Tableau (preferred) to make complex insights accessible.
Support our internal data team by refining telemetry taxonomy and contributing to ongoing data developments.


Qualifications


Bachelorâ€™s degree in a relevant field (e.g. Data Analytics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Business, or related).
3 â€“ 5 years of experience in game analytics, data analytics, or business intelligence.
Hands-on experience with SQL, Excel, and data visualization tools (Tableau preferred).
Familiarity with data telemetry, taxonomy, and cloud analytics (Databricks, etc).


Skills


Telemetry or other data design experience
Analytical mindset â€“ ability to turn data into actionable insights.
Strong communication and storytelling â€“ able to make complex data accessible and engaging.
Collaboration & relationship-building â€“ skilled at working across teams and time zones.
Problem-solving & initiative â€“ proactive in improving data systems and processes.
Stakeholder influence â€“ able to advocate for data-driven decision-making.


PLUSES

Please note that these are desirable skills and are not required to apply for the position.


Experience with Python & Pyspark.
Experience with GitHub.
Experience in the game industry or with game telemetry design.
Passion for gaming in general.

At Rockstar Games, we create world-class entertainment experiences.

Become part of a team working on some of the most rewarding, large-scale creative projects to be found in any entertainment medium - all within an inclusive, highly-motivated environment where you can learn and collaborate with some of the most talented people in the industry.

Rockstar Games is on the lookout for a passionate Data Design Analyst with strong software development skills who possesses a passion for both games and big data.

This is a full-time, permanent and in-office position based in Rockstarâ€™s unique game development studio in the heart of London.

What We Do

  • The Rockstar Analytics team provides insights and actionable results to a wide variety of stakeholders across the organization in support of their decision making.
  • We partner with multiple departments across the company, leveraging analytics to measure and improve the success and health of our games.
  • We collaborate as a global team to develop cutting-edge data pipelines, data products, data models, reports, analyses, and machine learning applications.
  • The Business Analytics vertical within the Analytics team is tasked with empowering Rockstar with data by helping design and implement game telemetry that drives better gameplay, player engagement, and business decisions.
  • We aim to win hearts and minds by making data accessible, insightful, and actionable â€“ building strong relationships with developers, designers, and stakeholders to ensure data is embraced as a core part of game development.

Responsibilities

  • Partner with game designers, developers, and other stakeholders to help design and implement robust telemetry that supports long-term insights.
  • Bridge the gap between data and non-data teams, ensuring our data meets the needs for achieving great game balance, player experience, and business intelligence.
  • Advocate for the power of data, helping teams understand its value and how it can shape better decision-making.
  • Build strong relationships across teams and time zones, influencing and educating stakeholders to drive data-informed decisions.
  • Create impactful visualizations and reports using SQL, Excel, and Tableau (preferred) to make complex insights accessible.
  • Support our internal data team by refining telemetry taxonomy and contributing to ongoing data developments.

Qualifications

  • Bachelorâ€™s degree in a relevant field (e.g. Data Analytics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Business, or related).
  • 3 â€“ 5 years of experience in game analytics, data analytics, or business intelligence.
  • Hands-on experience with SQL, Excel, and data visualization tools (Tableau preferred).
  • Familiarity with data telemetry, taxonomy, and cloud analytics (Databricks, etc).

Skills

  • Telemetry or other data design experience
  • Analytical mindset â€“ ability to turn data into actionable insights.
  • Strong communication and storytelling â€“ able to make complex data accessible and engaging.
  • Collaboration & relationship-building â€“ skilled at working across teams and time zones.
  • Problem-solving & initiative â€“ proactive in improving data systems and processes.
  • Stakeholder influence â€“ able to advocate for data-driven decision-making.

PLUSES

Please note that these are desirable skills and are not required to apply for the position.

  • Experience with Python & Pyspark.
  • Experience with GitHub.
  • Experience in the game industry or with game telemetry design.
  • Passion for gaming in general.

How To Apply

Please apply with a CV and cover letter demonstrating how you meet the skills above. If we would like to move forward with your application, a Rockstar recruiter will reach out to you to explain next steps and guide you through the process.

If youâ€™ve got the right skills for the job, we want to hear from you. We encourage applications from all suitable candidates regardless of age, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion, belief, race, or any other protected category.

About the Company

A leading name in the UK property sector is on the hunt for a mid-level Data Analyst to join their growing data team. With a strong foundation in Business Intelligence and a forward-thinking approach to tech, this company has spent the last five years investing heavily in their data infrastructure and are now gearing up to take things even further â€” including AI implementation over the next 6â€“12 months. ðŸš€




They're working on internal data projects with real commercial impact and are looking for someone who can not only crunch the numbers, but also tell the story behind them.




The Role

Youâ€™ll take the lead on key analytics initiatives, working end-to-end across data pipelines, visualisation, and stakeholder communication. Itâ€™s a hands-on role with plenty of variety â€” perfect for someone who enjoys making sense of messy data and translating that into insight that drives decisions.




You'll also play a key part in their early AI-driven projects, focused on improving sales processes and customer interactions through transcript analysis and intelligent feedback tools.




What Youâ€™ll Be Doing

ðŸ“ˆ Lead dashboard development using Power BI, delivering enterprise-grade reports that drive business insight
ðŸ” End-to-end data analysis, from extraction and transformation to insight using SQL and Python
ðŸ—£ï¸ Present findings to stakeholders across all levels, breaking down complex analysis into clear, commercial terms
ðŸ‘¥ Run workshops/training to help non-technical users engage with dashboards and tools
ðŸ¤– Contribute to AI initiative, including mining sales call data, building feedback prompts, and extracting insights from customer conversations




The Ideal Candidate

Has spent a few years working in data-focused roles, with solid hands-on experience in real-world commercial environments.
Brings a strong academic foundation, ideally in a technical or numerical subject such as Maths, Physics, Engineering, or Computer Science.
Comfortable owning projects end-to-end, from working with raw data to presenting insights that drive business decisions.
A confident communicator who can explain complex analysis in a simple, engaging way.
Technically fluent with Power BI, SQL, and Python, and eager to work with modern tools like Fabric and Copilot.
Curious, analytical, and thrives in a fast-paced, collaborative setting.




ðŸ’¡ This role is ideal for someone looking to step into a more visible, hands-on position where they can shape how data is used across a business â€” and get early exposure to AI innovation in a real-world commercial setting.

Title: Graduate Data Analyst
Description:
Our Emerging Talent Programme at Enstar is designed to build a great foundation in data analytics and machine learning within the insurance industry. It combines technical training, real-world business exposure, and structured development to support a successful transition from education to career. Over two years, participants will take part in tailored learning opportunities, rotational placements, and mentoring to develop critical thinking, data proficiency, and cross-functional awareness.




About the Role




This position sits within the Data Office. The team supports data-driven decision making across the organisation and contributes to developing ethical, responsible artificial intelligence capabilities




Responsibilities




Conducting statistical analysis and applying machine learning techniques to insurance and financial data
Supporting data preparation and transformation for analytical purposes
Developing, testing, and refining predictive models
Presenting insights to stakeholders and translating analytical outputs into business context
Collaborating with engineers and analysts across departments
Contributing to projects related to responsible AI, governance, and compliance







Qualifications




Candidates should have or be expecting to achieve a degree in a subject area such as Data Science, Machine Learning, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or another quantitative field.




Required Skills




Familiarity with supervised and unsupervised learning (e.g. regression, classification, clustering)
Basic experience in Python, R, or SQL, and familiarity with libraries such as Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, or PyTorch
Experience with data visualisation tools such as Power BI or Tableau
Awareness of data privacy, responsible AI, and ethical technology practices
Ability to convey technical ideas clearly and work collaboratively







Preferred Skills




Our graduates follow a structured development framework that includes:

Formal training aligned to a professional qualification
Technical and behavioural skills workshops
Real business assignments and rotations
Regular feedback and access to mentoring from experienced professionals




Pay range and compensation package




We offer a comprehensive package to support wellbeing, financial planning, and professional development. Benefits include:




10% employer pension contribution
Â£700 annual wellness reimbursement
Private medical and dental insurance
Health screening and wellbeing support
Cycle to Work scheme and electric vehicle lease
â€Employee Assistance Programme
Volunteering days and inclusive events




ðŸŒ Equal Opportunity Statement




Enstar is committed to creating an inclusive, respectful, and accessible workplace. We support candidates from all backgrounds and provide support and adjustments throughout the recruitment process. Applicants who require accommodations are encouraged to let us know at any stage. Enstar is an equal opportunity employer. We believe diversity of thought and experience strengthens decision-making and performance.




Recruitment Process




ðŸ“ Online application
ðŸŽ¥ Online assessment and recorded interview
ðŸ’» Virtual assessment centre

Title: Data Analyst (Freelance)
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst (Freelance)

Salary: Competitive (Based on experience)

Level: Freelance

Hours: Flexible

Location: Remote




Connect Management is one of the UKâ€™s fastest-growing creator agencies, and we're looking for a Mid-Weight Designer to join our growing Agency Team.Â 







About Connect

Where the culture is contagious, the energy is infectious & the campaigns go viral!

Connect Management is a leading social-first creator agency, working with over 150+ talents to deliver game-changing social strategies and attention-grabbing content. We partner with the worldâ€™s biggest brands and most relevant social-first talent, creating impactful and innovative influencer marketing campaigns.

Weâ€™re now looking for a freelance Data Analyst to join our growing Agency Team. If youâ€™re passionate about transforming data into actionable insights and supporting campaigns with your sharp analytical skills, we want to hear from you!




The Role

As a freelance Data Analyst at Connect Management, you will play a key role in supporting our influencer marketing strategies by providing vital data insights. You will be responsible for building and managing rate cards, benchmarking industry standards, and compiling performance data to optimise our campaigns. Working with the Agency Director and wider team, youâ€™ll use your analytical skills to create meaningful reports and drive actionable insights that enhance the performance of our campaigns.

If you're someone who thrives on data, loves making sense of complex information, and can provide clear recommendations, weâ€™d love to hear from you!




What we are looking for

Strong experience in data analysis, especially within influencer marketing or digital marketing.
Experience with building and managing complex rate cards for clients and campaigns.
Ability to benchmark industry data, market performance, creator size, and platform-specific metrics.
A problem-solver who can turn data into actionable insights that drive strategic decisions.
Meticulous and organised, with the ability to manage multiple data sets and ensure accuracy.
A proactive mindset, able to work independently and take ownership of key projects.



Must haves:

3+ years of experience in a data analysis role, ideally within marketing or digital industries.
Strong proficiency in Excel, Google Analytics, and data visualisation tools such as Power BI or Tableau.
Experience with building, analysing, and benchmarking rate cards for influencer marketing.
Ability to produce detailed, data-driven reports with actionable recommendations.
A passion for optimising campaigns through data and finding trends in complex data sets.
Excellent attention to detail and organisational skills to manage multiple tasks.



What you can expect

The chance to collaborate with a talented team thatâ€™s passionate about delivering results.
Competitive pay based on experience, with the opportunity to work on exciting campaigns.
An opportunity to make a significant impact with your data-driven insights.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
LHV Bank, a fully licensed UK bank, specialises in Savings, Banking Services for global fintechs, and SME Lending solutions for UK businesses, offering commercial real estate investment and trading loans from Â£0.5m. As a leading provider of real-time multi-currency payments, accounts, acquiring, indirect scheme access, open banking, and FX solutions, LHV Bank supports 200+ fintech companies, including Airwallex, Currencycloud, Truelayer, and Wise, serving 10 million+ end customers and reaching a potential market of 500 million across the UK and Europe.




After obtaining its UK banking licence in May 2023, LHV Bank entered the retail savings market via deposit aggregators in August 2023, followed by the launch of its direct-to-customer retail banking proposition in December 2024.For more information, visit lhv.com.




We are looking for an experienced Data Analyst with ability to pick up some of the data engineering tasks to join our growing team in our London office.




Please note this is a predominantly office-based role in London which will require you to come in and collaborate with the team at least 2-3 days a week.




Key Responsibilities:

Working with business stakeholders (i.e. Commercial, Finance, Risk, Compliance, Operations etc.) to understand reporting requirements and build Reports using reporting tools such as (Tableau, Quicksight etc.)
Mapping data with the various sources to understand the data items required and work on sourcing strategy, design, and implementation.
Identify manual reports and automate them using reporting tools.
Train business users in reporting tools to enable self-serve reporting capability.
Implement best practices.
Create new ideas and implement AI solution to improve efficiency and reduce operational cost.




Required Knowledge, Skills and Experience:




Essential:

Solid experience in data analysis and reporting.
Strong knowledge of SQL scripting.
Good understanding of data modelling techniques with the ability to choose the most appropriate data model to meet business needs.
Excellent communication skills.
Proactive, self-starter with ability to work on own initiative to complete objectives. Working in ambiguous environments.
Ability to work collaboratively within an agile environment.




Desirable:

Experience working with AWS ecosystem.
Data Ops (CI and CD experience).
Experience in Fintech, Lending or Retail banking.




Some of our benefits

â€¢ Competitive salary & progression

â€¢ Open and inclusive culture

â€¢ Hybrid working

â€¢ Fantastic offices and great working environment

â€¢ Vitality Health Plan (includes private health insurance, travel insurance, gym discounts)

â€¢ Medicash health plan (Level 3)

â€¢ 5% employer pension contribution

â€¢ Life assurance

â€¢ Income protection insurance

â€¢ 28 days holiday plus 3 additional days, bank holidays & further days for various key life events

â€¢ Team socials

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Type

Fixed Term

Build a brilliant future with Hiscox

This is a 12 month fixed term contract role.

This position offers an exciting opportunity to work within a mature and high performing change and technology team on market leading initiatives; designing and building capabilities for the London Market business unit and leveraging emerging technology to directly shape our future operating model.

Our goal is to digitise, enhance and augment our key processes enabling more data informed and therefore profitable decisions more efficiently and quickly. We use the latest technologies and skills to approach problems in a new and innovative way in order to deliver lasting value to the business.

The role will be part of an agile cross functional squad, working alongside data scientists, machine learning engineers, data engineers, software engineers, business change and SMEs. We are curious and inquisitive, challenging ourselves and our stakeholders to do things better, faster or cheaper. Working within our team is exciting and fast-paced.

We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Data Analyst to own and manage the data assets for the squad, in particular, supporting the data scientists by preparing and validating data to train, test and evaluate our in-house data science models. The successful candidate will play a crucial role in ensuring data quality and integrity, enabling the team to develop innovative data-driven solutions delivered through an agile framework.

Principal Responsibilities Within This Role Will Include


Data Preparation: Collect, clean, and pre-process data from various sources to ensure it is ready for analysis. Handle missing data, outliers, and ensure data quality.
Data Validation: Verify the accuracy, consistency and completeness of data sets and model outputs. Perform data validation checks and ensure data integrity throughout the data lifecycle.
Data Evaluation: Analyse and interpret data sets to identify trends, patterns, and insights. Provide actionable recommendations based on data analysis.
Collaboration: Work closely with data scientists, engineers, and other stakeholders to understand data requirements and deliver high-quality data solutions in an agile and responsive manner.
Reporting: Develop and maintain reports and dashboards to continuously monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of our models and data solutions, perform and record root cause analysis on data issues and identify areas for adjustment as necessary.
Communication: Present data and findings in a clear and understandable manner for both technical and non-technical audiences.



Knowledge, skills and experience we expect you to have to fit into this role will include:


Ability to elicit and record data requirements, definitions and data quality rules for data assets.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in both technical and business contexts.
Ability to understand, consolidate disparate information sources into summary metrics
Ability to present data in a clear and compelling way using tools like Tableau or Power BI and communicate insights effectively.
Strong ability in Excel; curiosity with programming languages such as SQL, Python.
Ability to pro-actively investigate issues to determine their root cause.
Self motivated, task driven and with a strong attention to detail and quality in every aspect of work.



If You Have Been Exposed To Any Of The Following It Would Be Highly Desirable To Bring The Following To Hiscox


Prior experience of Lloydâ€™s of London or the Insurance industry.
Prior experience in data analysis or data management.
Previous experience managing metadata records including data dictionary and data cataloguing.
Previous experience working in agile projects and related tools such as Jira, Confluence or other collaboration tools.



Diversity, Inclusion and Hybrid working

At Hiscox we care about our people. We hire the best people for the job and weâ€™re committed to diversity and creating a truly inclusive culture, which we believe drives success. We have also learned that working life doesnâ€™t always have to be in the office and support hybrid ways of working to encourage a healthy work life balance.

We anticipate the successful candidate for this role will be in the office approximately 2 days a week.

We see it as the best of both worlds: structure and sociability on one hand, and independence and flexibility on the other.

Work with amazing people and be part of a unique culture

  • Communication: Present data and findings in a clear and understandable manner for both technical and non-technical audiences.


Knowledge, skills and experience we expect you to have to fit into this role will include:

  • Ability to elicit and record data requirements, definitions and data quality rules for data assets.
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills in both technical and business contexts.
  • Ability to understand, consolidate disparate information sources into summary metrics
  • Ability to present data in a clear and compelling way using tools like Tableau or Power BI and communicate insights effectively.
  • Strong ability in Excel; curiosity with programming languages such as SQL, Python.
  • Ability to pro-actively investigate issues to determine their root cause.
  • Self motivated, task driven and with a strong attention to detail and quality in every aspect of work.


If You Have Been Exposed To Any Of The Following It Would Be Highly Desirable To Bring The Following To Hiscox

  • Prior experience of Lloydâ€™s of London or the Insurance industry.
  • Prior experience in data analysis or data management.
  • Previous experience managing metadata records including data dictionary and data cataloguing.
  • Previous experience working in agile projects and related tools such as Jira, Confluence or other collaboration tools.


Diversity, Inclusion and Hybrid working

At Hiscox we care about our people. We hire the best people for the job and weâ€™re committed to diversity and creating a truly inclusive culture, which we believe drives success. We have also learned that working life doesnâ€™t always have to be in the office and support hybrid ways of working to encourage a healthy work life balance.

We anticipate the successful candidate for this role will be in the office approximately 2 days a week.

We see it as the best of both worlds: structure and sociability on one hand, and independence and flexibility on the other.

Work with amazing people and be part of a unique culture

Title: Data Analyst
Company: The Change Partners - Global talent specialists for a connected world
Description:
We are seeking a Data Analyst to join a dynamic analytics team within an iconic D2C household consumer brand. Working with a wide range of datasets, youâ€™ll support teams across Marketing, Product, UX, Logistics, and Finance to drive informed decision-making and strategic outcomes.




Please note that this is a contract role until the end of the year and will be extended for the role individually for the following 12 months




This role is ideal for someone who is commercially minded, technically strong, and passionate about translating data into meaningful action.




Key Responsibilities:

Analyse data from customer journeys, sales platforms, logistics, and financial systems to uncover trends and drive operational improvements.
Interrogate structured and semi-structured datasets using SQL.
Build dashboards and visualisations in tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or Qlik.
Support behavioural analysis with UX tools.
Collaborate with Data Engineers to shape data pipelines and access data via APIs.
Integrate third-party market and industry data to support benchmarking and competitive analysis.
Automate recurring reports while supporting deep-dive and ad-hoc analytical requests.
Communicate insights clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences.




We are looking for:

4+ years of experience in BI, Data Analysis, or Insight.
Strong SQL skills and experience working across varied datasets (e.g. customer, sales, web, finance).
Proficiency in BI tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or Qlik.
Hands-on experience with Adobe Analytics and Excel.
Exposure to UX analytics platforms.
Ability to work cross-functionally and influence stakeholders through data storytelling.
Bonus: Python skills for data manipulation or automation.




Please apply for more information. Please only apply if you are immediately available, or can start within two weeks




Please note this role doesn't offer sponsorship

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Location: London

Contract Type: Permanent

Work Pattern: Full Time, Hybrid

*** Please note experience with PowerBI is essential, and Procurement experience is desirable. ***

As a Data Analyst at MS Amlin, you will play a crucial role in developing and maintaining data sets and reporting capabilities. Your expertise in Power BI and Tableau will be essential in creating interactive dashboards that provide valuable insights to various stakeholders, and supporting strategic decision-making processes. In this role, you will collaborate closely with the Procurement team, other ABS department and Legal Entities to ensure accurate and timely reporting. Your analytical skills will help identify trends, opportunities for cost savings, areas of risk, and will contribute to the development of effective commercial strategies. You will also ensure compliance with internal policies and external regulations, maintaining high standards of accuracy and integrity in all reporting activities. Your professional experience to date must be as a Data Analyst, practicing in any type of business or business team, although experience of working with procurement related data and reporting would be an advantage.

This position offers an exciting opportunity for those who love working with data, enjoy creating visualisations, and thrive in collaborative environments. If you have a keen eye for detail and enjoy continuous improvement, you will find this role both rewarding and fulfilling. We are looking for someone who can bring a fresh perspective to the reporting regime that we currently undertake, offering advice on what can be done differently and better, presenting data in a more visually compelling way, and using modern tools and technology to make what is currently a manual process more efficient.

MS Amlin is part of MS&AD, a global top-10 insurance group, comprising four distinct businesses: Global Reinsurance, Lloyds Franchise, Local Specialty Insurer, and Business Services. MS Amlin Business Services (MS ABS) supports the organisation through Sourcing and Supplier Management, Legal, HR, Facilities Management, IT, Risk Management, Compliance, and Finance. Our vision is to be a trusted partner and solution provider of choice.

What Youâ€™ll Spend Your Time Doing


Developing Reports: Creating and maintaining a detailed set of reports on contracts, spend analysis, and risk assessments to support decision-making processes.
Data Visualisation: Utilising Power BI to design and implement interactive dashboards that provide clear insights to various stakeholders.
Ensure data integrity: Maintain high standards of accuracy and integrity in all reporting activities, ensuring compliance with internal policies and external regulations.
Data Analysis: Analysing data to identify trends, opportunities for cost savings, and potential risks, providing actionable insights to the commercial team.
Compliance Monitoring: Ensure all reports and analyses comply with internal policies and external regulations, maintaining high standards of accuracy and integrity.
Continuous Improvement: Continuously seek ways to improve reporting processes and tools, staying up to date with the latest trends and technologies in data visualisation and procurement analytics.


Youâ€™re Going To Enjoy This Job If Youâ€¦


Love Working with Data: You have a passion for analysing data and uncovering insights that drive strategic decisions.
Enjoy Creating Visuals: You find satisfaction in transforming complex data into clear, interactive dashboards using Power BI.
Thrive in Collaborative Environments: You enjoy working closely with various teams and stakeholders to ensure accurate and impactful reporting.
Have a Keen Eye for Detail: You take pride in your meticulous approach to ensuring data accuracy and compliance with policies and regulations.
Seek Continuous Improvement: You are always looking for ways to enhance reporting processes and stay updated with the latest trends in data visualisation and procurement analytics.
Value Strategic Impact: You appreciate the role of procurement in driving cost savings and efficiency, and you are motivated by contributing to the overall success of the organisation.


What We Need From You


Proven experience as a Data Analyst
Proficiency in Power BI and Tableau for data visualisation and reporting.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
Attention to detail and a commitment to accuracy.
Experience of working with procurement teams and working with procurement related spend and contract data is an advantage


We are stronger together because of our common interests and rich differences. You may be the strength we didnâ€™t know we needed. Believe in yourself, and click apply today!

What Can You Expect From Us?


Competitive Base Salary
Performance Related Discretionary Bonus
Holiday: 28 days core annual leave, and you can buy up to 5 days
Pension: A minimum 2% employee contribution plus 7% MS Amlin contribution (9%) up to a maximum of 5% employee contribution plus 13% MS Amlin contribution (18%)
Private Medical: cover for yourself. Family members/dependants can be added
Flex Fund: Â£1,000 (pro-rated based on start date) to spend on flexible benefits
Life Assurance: 5x annualised base salary


Each one of us is unique because of our backgrounds, what we have learned so far and how we express that. Establishing an inclusive attitude helps us, organisationally, to â€˜think outside the boxâ€™ because it calls on that diverse range of ideas, perspectives and lived experiences.

We commit to continuing our work towards a more diverse and inclusive future by recognising that our business, our teams and every colleague has a part to play in driving the positive change we all want to see.

Our values demonstrate our commitment to providing an environment in which each and every colleague is respected for who they are and what they can contribute to the business, regardless of nationality, race, ethnicity, religion/faith, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, disability, socio-economic background, sex or age.

Title: Insights Analyst
Description:
WeArisma is an influencer marketing solution helping brands and agencies understand, measure and optimise influencer marketing RoI. We help clients increase the effectiveness of their influencer marketing strategy and grow brand equity.




As the importance of influencer marketing grows and as the industry matures, so does the need for independent effectiveness specialists. Join us in our mission of bringing independent measurement, accountability and effectiveness to the industry.




You will be joining us at a very exciting time of growth, we have received investment from Morgan Stanley and have been named one of the most promising AdTech companies by Business Insider.




We are looking for an Insight Analyst to accelerate their career in the influencer marketing industry.

We have a fantastic culture with a collaborative environment where everyone pitches in and has the chance to excel.




Job Description

We are looking for an Insight Analyst with a strong strategic and analytics mindset to provide valuable insights, trend analysis and craft compelling stories from data for our clients. The ideal candidate will have 1-2 years of experience in a digital marketing or media agency, or comparable knowledge. If you are passionate about marketing and how culture and trends shape it, possess excellent writing skills, have a way with data, and can identify trends in the ever-evolving social media and influencer landscape, we want to hear from you.




Responsibilities:

1. Strategic Insights Development:

Provide strategic insights and recommendations to optimise influencer selection, content creation, and campaign performance for our clients.Â Â 
Understand the distinct challenges within key industriesâ€”particularly luxury, fashion, beauty, and entertainmentâ€”to identify strategic opportunities for consultancy, pitching, or upselling.
Research influencer marketing trends through our proprietary tool.
Craft insightful content for clients, blog posts and across different industry verticals.




2. Data Analysis and Reporting:

Collect and analyse data related to influencer marketing data from our platform.
Utilise Excel and other data manipulation tools to extract meaningful information from large datasets.
Help to create insightful reports to communicate campaign performance and key insights to internal and external stakeholders.




3. Trend Analysis:

Research the latest trends, cultural shifts, and influencer marketing developments across a number of industries, particularly luxury, fashion and beauty.
Identify emerging trends and insights that can inform influencer and digital marketing strategies.
Proactively keeping up to speed with the industry, and generating ideas around key cultural moments throughout the year.
Communicate complex data findings in a clear and concise manner.
Keep up to date with competitor activities and market dynamics.




Requirements:

1-2 years minimum experience working in a digital marketing agency, preferably in a strategy-related capacity
Previous experience working with consumer brands is required; familiarity with luxury and/or fashion brands is a plus.
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
A keen eye for spotting trends and understanding their implications.
Ability to work both independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
Experience in data analysis and manipulation.
Detail-oriented and highly organised.
Comfortable working with different teams and functions across the company.
Knowledge of social media platforms and influencer marketing is preferred but not required.
Bachelor's degree in a relevant field.




Languages:

English
Fluency in other languages is a plus but not required.




Benefits:

25 days annual leave in addition to public holidays
Medical insurance
Incentivized bonus plan
Hybrid co-working space environment, 2 days a week at our London office
Monthly coaching and team lunch/dinner




Annual Package:

Competitive




Right to work:

Must have the legal right to work in the UK at the time of application.

Title: Junior Analyst
Description:
We are looking for an innovative, analytical thinker to join our Gas Operations team. Are you looking to build the foundations of a strong, fast-paced career in the energy industry with a growing independent energy supplier?




What Will I Do?

As a Junior Operations Analyst you will be responsible for the analysis and interpretation of data from a variety of sources, identifying anomalies as appropriate. Working alongside internal stakeholders, and a number of third-parties you will support the resolution of customersâ€™ queries, always ensuring customer data is up-to-date and accurately reflects our billing systems.




What Skills Do I Need?

This role would be ideally suited to someone who is highly numerate with a great eye for detail and is comfortable working with large datasets. Ideally you will already have a working knowledge of Microsoft Excel and be able to learn our internal database systems and processes.




What can we offer?

This role offers a competitive package of remuneration along with access to a wide range of company benefits which includes;

Private medical insurance, including 24/7 GP appointments and access to a wide range of professional support. We also offer a life assurance and income protection scheme from day one!
Our annual company profit share scheme, rewarding everyone at Corona by sharing in our success.
Employee self-sacrifice Electric Vehicle scheme, with a wide range of different models to choose from â€“ supporting our commitment to the energy transition.
Access to thousands of retail and entertainment discounts through our internal rewards and recognition scheme, all linked to our company values.




On top of these great benefits, we also continue to invest in our people through a wealth of development opportunities, supporting you to get the most from your career!




Working Pattern

In this role you will be able to work on a hybrid pattern, with Tues-Thurs in the office and Monday and Friday at home. Our standard office hours are 0830 â€“ 1700, Monday to Friday.




Working with us at Corona Energy

At Corona Energy we are driven by our company culture which is focused around our core values; Empowered, Forward Thinking and Impactful â€“ these are underpinned by our central value â€œCustomer Firstâ€. This year we were proud to have been independently certified as one of the Best Places to Work in the UK with over 80% of our team recognising our outstanding employee experience!




To support this experience, we also offer our team;

Amazing office spaces, with complimentary breakfast, fruit, snacks and drinks throughout the day.
An annual focus on wellbeing with events and activities to support your health, wealth and inner-self!
An opportunity to support our charity partners, or to give back to important causes by fundraising or volunteering our time.
The chance to celebrate success together, at one of our regular sports and social events or at our annual company awards.




If you are looking for a career that is all about positive energy, we would welcome your application!




Corona Energy is a Disability Confident employer and as such will offer any successful applicant whatever reasonable adjustments they may require in order to take part in our recruitment process.

Title: Data & Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Location: West Drayton, London

Contract: Permanent, Full-time (36 hours per week)

Salary: Â£37,007 - Â£38,821 (inclusive of London Weighting)

Benefits: 28 days holiday plus public holidays, Local Government Pension Scheme, Cycle to Work scheme, Employee Assistance Programme

About Us â€“ West London Waste Authority (WLWA)

WLWA is a statutory public body responsible for managing waste disposal for six London boroughs: Brent, Ealing, Harrow, Hillingdon, Hounslow and Richmond upon Thames. Working on behalf of over 1.7 million residents, we manage the treatment, transfer and disposal of waste and recycling that local councils collect.

We coordinate complex waste operations, liaise with multiple contractors and public sector partners, and deliver environmental services with a focus on efficiency and sustainability. As the sector becomes more data-driven, we are investing in the way we collect, manage and use information across borough boundaries.

Make Public Sector Data Work Better Across Borough Boundaries

To support this transformation, weâ€™re looking for a Data & Business Intelligence Analyst (internally known as â€œMI Analystâ€) who can work confidently at the intersection of data, systems and people.

This role is for someone who can build robust, insightful reports â€” while also working collaboratively across boroughs, finance teams and contractors to align data capture and reporting.

This is a delivery-focused position with the opportunity to shape how information flows between organisations and influences operational, financial and environmental decision-making.

What You'll Do


Design, build and maintain automated dashboards and reporting tools using Power BI, DAX, Power Query, and SQL
Gather, validate and integrate data from boroughs and contractors, ensuring consistency and quality
Support statutory data returns (e.g. Waste Data Flow) and produce management and financial reports
Investigate discrepancies, spot data issues early, and engage constructively with partners to resolve them
Collaborate closely with internal colleagues and external stakeholders to deliver improvements in reporting accuracy, usability and efficiency
Provide mentoring and task oversight to the MI Assistant to ensure consistent data practices across the team.


The Environment Youâ€™ll Be Working In

This role spans multiple organisations with differing systems and priorities. It requires a proactive, analytical approach â€” and the ability to build trust and shared understanding across stakeholders.


Youâ€™ll need to communicate clearly, work interactively with others, and respond effectively to requests and issues as they arise.
The role involves real-time collaboration and engagement as part of day-to-day delivery, especially when resolving data queries or aligning reporting practices.


Essential Skills And Experience


Proven experience using Power BI, including DAX, Power Query, and data modelling techniques
Strong skills in SQL or T-SQL for transforming, cleansing and integrating data
Experience working with large, complex datasets from multiple sources
Ability to identify, explain and resolve data issues through direct engagement with stakeholders
Evidence you can drive a data issue to resolution â€“ e.g. persuading a partner to correct their feed, coaching non-technical colleagues, or thrashing it out on a live call until the numbers balance.
Experience working in a setting where cross-organisational collaboration or partner engagement was key to delivery


Highly Desirable Experience working in or with local government or public sector data.


Understanding of environmental or waste management data
Familiarity with statutory data submission processes or financial reconciliation reporting
Hands-on data-engineering capability, ideally including: Designing and building a lakehouse architecture, Implementing Azure access-management controls, Setting up row-level security for Power BI reports


Why Join WLWA?

Weâ€™re a small, mission-driven organisation with wide reach and big ambitions. Youâ€™ll work in a role that combines technical hands-on data work with the chance to improve public services across six London boroughs.

We Offer


28 days annual leave plus public holidays
Membership of the Local Government Pension Scheme (LGPS)
Opportunities to lead on meaningful improvements in data processes and reporting
A varied, cross-organisational working environment with real-world impact


Apply Now

We welcome applications from all backgrounds and actively encourage people who bring diverse perspectives to apply. If you can combine strong technical skills with the ability to build relationships, explain complexity clearly, and drive improvement across varied stakeholders â€” we want to hear from you.

We are committed to creating an inclusive, diverse workplace and welcome applications from all backgrounds.

HTML:
Location: West Drayton, London

Contract: Permanent, Full-time (36 hours per week)

Salary: Â£37,007 - Â£38,821 (inclusive of London Weighting)

Benefits: 28 days holiday plus public holidays, Local Government Pension Scheme, Cycle to Work scheme, Employee Assistance Programme

About Us â€“ West London Waste Authority (WLWA)

WLWA is a statutory public body responsible for managing waste disposal for six London boroughs: Brent, Ealing, Harrow, Hillingdon, Hounslow and Richmond upon Thames. Working on behalf of over 1.7 million residents, we manage the treatment, transfer and disposal of waste and recycling that local councils collect.

We coordinate complex waste operations, liaise with multiple contractors and public sector partners, and deliver environmental services with a focus on efficiency and sustainability. As the sector becomes more data-driven, we are investing in the way we collect, manage and use information across borough boundaries.

Make Public Sector Data Work Better Across Borough Boundaries

To support this transformation, weâ€™re looking for a Data & Business Intelligence Analyst (internally known as â€œMI Analystâ€) who can work confidently at the intersection of data, systems and people.

This role is for someone who can build robust, insightful reports â€” while also working collaboratively across boroughs, finance teams and contractors to align data capture and reporting.

This is a delivery-focused position with the opportunity to shape how information flows between organisations and influences operational, financial and environmental decision-making.

What You'll Do

  • Design, build and maintain automated dashboards and reporting tools using Power BI, DAX, Power Query, and SQL
  • Gather, validate and integrate data from boroughs and contractors, ensuring consistency and quality
  • Support statutory data returns (e.g. Waste Data Flow) and produce management and financial reports
  • Investigate discrepancies, spot data issues early, and engage constructively with partners to resolve them
  • Collaborate closely with internal colleagues and external stakeholders to deliver improvements in reporting accuracy, usability and efficiency
  • Provide mentoring and task oversight to the MI Assistant to ensure consistent data practices across the team.

The Environment Youâ€™ll Be Working In

This role spans multiple organisations with differing systems and priorities. It requires a proactive, analytical approach â€” and the ability to build trust and shared understanding across stakeholders.

  • Youâ€™ll need to communicate clearly, work interactively with others, and respond effectively to requests and issues as they arise.
  • The role involves real-time collaboration and engagement as part of day-to-day delivery, especially when resolving data queries or aligning reporting practices.

Essential Skills And Experience

  • Proven experience using Power BI, including DAX, Power Query, and data modelling techniques
  • Strong skills in SQL or T-SQL for transforming, cleansing and integrating data
  • Experience working with large, complex datasets from multiple sources
  • Ability to identify, explain and resolve data issues through direct engagement with stakeholders
  • Evidence you can drive a data issue to resolution â€“ e.g. persuading a partner to correct their feed, coaching non-technical colleagues, or thrashing it out on a live call until the numbers balance.
  • Experience working in a setting where cross-organisational collaboration or partner engagement was key to delivery

Highly Desirable Experience working in or with local government or public sector data.

  • Understanding of environmental or waste management data
  • Familiarity with statutory data submission processes or financial reconciliation reporting
  • Hands-on data-engineering capability, ideally including: Designing and building a lakehouse architecture, Implementing Azure access-management controls, Setting up row-level security for Power BI reports

Why Join WLWA?

Weâ€™re a small, mission-driven organisation with wide reach and big ambitions. Youâ€™ll work in a role that combines technical hands-on data work with the chance to improve public services across six London boroughs.

We Offer

  • 28 days annual leave plus public holidays
  • Membership of the Local Government Pension Scheme (LGPS)
  • Opportunities to lead on meaningful improvements in data processes and reporting
  • A varied, cross-organisational working environment with real-world impact

Apply Now

We welcome applications from all backgrounds and actively encourage people who bring diverse perspectives to apply. If you can combine strong technical skills with the ability to build relationships, explain complexity clearly, and drive improvement across varied stakeholders â€” we want to hear from you.

We are committed to creating an inclusive, diverse workplace and welcome applications from all backgrounds.

Title: Data Analyst (Freelance)
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst (Freelance)

Salary: Competitive (Based on experience)

Level: Freelance

Hours: Flexible

Location: Remote




Connect Management is one of the UKâ€™s fastest-growing creator agencies, and we're looking for a Mid-Weight Designer to join our growing Agency Team.Â 







About Connect

Where the culture is contagious, the energy is infectious & the campaigns go viral!

Connect Management is a leading social-first creator agency, working with over 150+ talents to deliver game-changing social strategies and attention-grabbing content. We partner with the worldâ€™s biggest brands and most relevant social-first talent, creating impactful and innovative influencer marketing campaigns.

Weâ€™re now looking for a freelance Data Analyst to join our growing Agency Team. If youâ€™re passionate about transforming data into actionable insights and supporting campaigns with your sharp analytical skills, we want to hear from you!




The Role

As a freelance Data Analyst at Connect Management, you will play a key role in supporting our influencer marketing strategies by providing vital data insights. You will be responsible for building and managing rate cards, benchmarking industry standards, and compiling performance data to optimise our campaigns. Working with the Agency Director and wider team, youâ€™ll use your analytical skills to create meaningful reports and drive actionable insights that enhance the performance of our campaigns.

If you're someone who thrives on data, loves making sense of complex information, and can provide clear recommendations, weâ€™d love to hear from you!




What we are looking for

Strong experience in data analysis, especially within influencer marketing or digital marketing.
Experience with building and managing complex rate cards for clients and campaigns.
Ability to benchmark industry data, market performance, creator size, and platform-specific metrics.
A problem-solver who can turn data into actionable insights that drive strategic decisions.
Meticulous and organised, with the ability to manage multiple data sets and ensure accuracy.
A proactive mindset, able to work independently and take ownership of key projects.



Must haves:

3+ years of experience in a data analysis role, ideally within marketing or digital industries.
Strong proficiency in Excel, Google Analytics, and data visualisation tools such as Power BI or Tableau.
Experience with building, analysing, and benchmarking rate cards for influencer marketing.
Ability to produce detailed, data-driven reports with actionable recommendations.
A passion for optimising campaigns through data and finding trends in complex data sets.
Excellent attention to detail and organisational skills to manage multiple tasks.



What you can expect

The chance to collaborate with a talented team thatâ€™s passionate about delivering results.
Competitive pay based on experience, with the opportunity to work on exciting campaigns.
An opportunity to make a significant impact with your data-driven insights.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst

Location: London (hybrid working 2-3 days per week in office)

Salary: Â£35k - Â£40k (depending on experience)




About Us

Milberg London is an independent claimant focused law firm. In our first 5 years, we have established ourselves as a market leader in UK class actions acting for over 150,000 clients across various cases.

We are seeking a detail-oriented and analytical Data Analyst with a proven track record of working with large datasets. In this role, you will play a critical role in maintaining data quality, conducting advanced analysis, and supporting legal teams in preparing their data for submission. Reporting to the Head of Data, this position is part of our dynamic Data Team based in our London office.




Key Responsibilities

Conduct comprehensive data analysis to ensure the accuracy and integrity of all data systems.
Manage large datasets, focusing on data cleanliness, identifying anomalies, and ensuring robust data collection.
Extract and import data using Salesforce and other platforms as required.
Build and deliver ad-hoc reporting to support business activities.
Collaborate with case managers to manage and serve client data to defendants.
Use Asana or similar task management tool to effectively manage and prioritise workload.




Key Skills and Qualifications

Essential:

Advanced knowledge of Excel with the ability to manage large volumes of data â€“ including demonstrated capabilities with pivot tables, VLOOKUPs and other formulas.
Exceptional organisational skills and attention to detail, ensuring high levels of accuracy.
Excellent time management to ensure tasks are delivered on time.
Strong problem-solving skills and a proactive mindset.
At least 1 yearsâ€™ experience working within a similar role.
Can be based at our London Office (min 2 days per week on site)
Have the right to work in the UK

Desirable:

Experience with Salesforce.
Experience using Asana or other task management tool.
Experience working within the Legal sector.
Proficiency in Power Query, SQL, and/or Python to support data transformation tasks.
A numerate degree (e.g., Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, or Computer Science) at undergraduate or postgraduate level.




Benefits:

25 days annual leave plus bank holidays.
Pension scheme.
Life assurance, critical illness and private health insurance scheme.
Annual discretionary bonus scheme.
Mobile phone allowance.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst

London-based (3 days on-site) | Salary: Â£60-70k + excellent benefits package




About the Role

A leading financial services client in London is seeking a talented MI/Data Analyst to join their Information Security team. In this strategic position, you'll drive technology compliance initiatives by producing insightful management information through sophisticated dashboards and reporting. Collaborating with senior stakeholders, you'll help shape and inform critical decision-making for executive leadership.




Key Responsibilities

Design and maintain advanced data visualization dashboards using PowerBI
Analyze complex datasets to identify trends, compliance gaps, and actionable insights
Spearhead automation initiatives to enhance reporting efficiency
Present compelling data narratives to diverse stakeholder groups
Mentor junior team members and contribute to best practices




Requirements

2-4 years' proven experience in Finance/Technology environments
Demonstrated experience analyzing and reporting on IT function data
Advanced PowerBI expertise with portfolio of successful implementations
Practical knowledge of IT metrics and DevSecOps frameworks
Strong analytical mindset with exceptional data visualization capabilities
Proficiency in scripting/automation technologies
Experience working within Agile methodologies
Technology degree essential
MSc in Data Analytics and security qualifications (ISACA, CISM, etc.) advantageous







If you have the skills and experience we're looking for, please apply with your updated CV.

Title: FIU Data Analyst
Description:
About MoonPay ðŸŒ–ðŸ’¸
Hi, weâ€™re MoonPay. Weâ€™re here to onboard the world to Web3.

Why? Because we think Web3 is a unique and democratising technology. It gives people back control of their money, digital identity, data, and property like nothing else before it.

What We Do
Weâ€™re the leading infrastructure company in Web3. This means we offer our partners everything from payment solutions (we call them 'Ramps') to minting software for digital collectibles, like NFTs. And over 30 million people around the world now trust our products â€” just take a look on Trustpilot.

Weâ€™re also big on collaborations. And we've worked on stunts, drops, and partnerships with some of the world's most prestigious and forward-thinking brands.

But thatâ€™s not all. We have also built our own consumer app because we wanted to see if we could build a better Web3 account. Itâ€™s taken off in a big way, and we're working hard to continually improve it and to strive for perfection.

So whatever your background, weâ€™re sure thereâ€™s something for you here. Come help us build the future of Web3 and digital ownership.

ðŸŒ” About the Opportunity

The Financial Intelligence Unit (FIU) is responsible for safeguarding the MoonPay platform against financial crime and money laundering activities. Leveraging advanced analytics and blockchain tracing tools, it collects and analyses huge volumes of data to identify potentially suspicious activities. The team collaborates with regulatory bodies, submitting suspicious activity reports (SARs) and sharing intelligence to combat financial crime.

The FIU Data Analyst will directly support the Compliance Technology Manager to govern the MoonPay Compliance tech stack and data science needs. This role ensures adherence to regulatory requirements and internal policies by directly supporting the FIUâ€™s data science, analytics, and reporting needs. This is also a global role that will support all operating businesses in the MoonPay family across the U.S., UK, Europe and beyond.

Locations: (London Hybrid)

ðŸš€ What you will do



Develop and maintain dashboards and reporting to monitor key compliance metrics
Manage incoming data requests from global regulators, ensuring data is provided quickly and accurately
Identify trends and anomalies using advanced data analysis techniques and tools
Support financial crime investigations by providing insights from complex datasets
Maintain documentation on the compliance data stack, supporting audits and model validations
Support the compliance team with ad-hoc data analyses, and act as a trusted point of contact for all compliance data needs
Communicate your findings with stakeholders across the team and wider company





ðŸ§‘â€ðŸš€ About You



Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Finance, or a relevant technical field. Masters degree or above is a plus
2+ years proficiency in data analysis tools including SQL and Python
Strong knowledge of data visualization tools such as Looker or Tableau
Exceptional problem-solving skills and attention to detail
Team player with good communication skills, with the ability to explain technical concepts clearly to different audiences
Ability to handle shifting priorities and thrive in a dynamic environment. Comfortable to work independently and upskill on new tools and technology
Interested in cryptocurrency, blockchain and financial crime detection





Bonus points for:


Prior experience working in a fast-paced fintech/cryptocurrency company
Experience with cloud data services such as GCP, Snowflake or AWS
Prior familiarity with AML (Anti-Money Laundering) rules and transaction monitoring
Knowledge of key blockchain concepts and on-chain data structure





ðŸ’» What you will be working with/on

You will be at the forefront of safeguarding MoonPay against financial crime. In this role, you'll contribute to building a secure, compliant ecosystem by supporting efforts to identify risks and protect against illicit activities in the evolving world of blockchain and digital assets. This is an exciting opportunity to be part of a dynamic and innovative team that values collaboration, adaptability, and making a meaningful impact in the cryptocurrency space.

Most importantly, though, you will embody the core principles that everyone here at the MoonPay lives by. Our â€œBLOCK Valuesâ€ are at the heart of everything we do - and they areâ€¦

B - Be Hungry

L - Level Up

O - Own It

C - Crypto Curious

K - Kaizen

MoonPay Perks
Equity package ðŸ“ˆ

Unlimited holidays ðŸ

Paid parental leave ðŸ¼

Annual training budget ðŸ’»

Home office setup allowance ðŸª‘

Monthly budget to spend on our products ðŸ’°

Working in a disruptive and fast-growing industry where the possibilities are endless ðŸš€

Freedom, autonomy and responsibility ðŸ’ª

Research has shown that women are less likely than men to apply for this role if they do not have experience in 100% of these areas. Please know that this list is indicative, and that we would still love to hear from you even if you feel that you are only a 75% match. Skills can be learnt, diversity cannot.

Please let us know if you require any accommodations for the interview process, and weâ€™ll do our best to provide assistance.
Commitment To Diversity
At MoonPay we believe that every voice matters. We strive to create a mindful and respectful environment where everyone can bring their authentic self to work, and experience a culture that is free of harassment, racism, and discrimination. Thatâ€™s why we are committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace and are a proud equal opportunity employer. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. This policy applies to all employment practices within our organization, including, but not limited to, hiring, recruiting, promotion, termination, layoff, and leave of absence.

MoonPay is also committed to providing reasonable accommodations in our job application procedures for qualified individuals with disabilities. Please inform our Talent Team if you need any assistance completing any forms or to otherwise participate in the application process.

Please be aware that MoonPay does not request an AI-led interview without seeing a recruiter or team member from MoonPay on video call. We won't ask for your personal identification documents or any money from you during your interview process with us. Be fraud smart! If you receive an email - claiming to be from MoonPay - but from an email address ending in anything other than @moonpay.com, please be aware that this is not us.

Title: Data Analyst- London
Description:
Company Description

Turner & Townsend is a global professional services company with over 22,000 people in more than 60 countries.

Working with our clients across real estate, infrastructure, energy and natural resources, we transform together delivering outcomes that improve peopleâ€™s lives. Working in partnership makes it possible to deliver the worldâ€™s most impactful projects and programmes as we turn challenge into opportunity and complexity into success.

Our capabilities include programme, project, cost, asset and commercial management, controls and performance, procurement and supply chain, net zero and digital solutions.

We are majority-owned by CBRE Group, Inc., the worldâ€™s largest commercial real estate services and investment firm, with our partners holding a significant minority interest. Turner & Townsend and CBRE work together to provide clients with the premier programme, project and cost management offering in markets around the world.

Please visit our website: www.turnerandtownsend.com

Job Description

Due to growing demand for our services we are seeking to recruit experienced Data Analysts at Consultant, Senior Consultant & Principal Consultant levels to join our team. The role involves supporting a wide range of project commissions and major programmes and we are seeking individuals with a demonstrable track record of delivery in a consultancy environment.

The Opportunity

The responsibilities of the Data Analyst will include, but are not limited to:


Providing technical expertise and support to non-experts
Developing multi-faceted reports with recommendations to senior management
Development, analysis and maintenance of corporate datasets
Provide guidance and advice on data quality issues to a wide variety of data providers
Develop / use, the mechanisms employed by clients to recharge manpower against projects
Responsible for visibility, accuracy and transparency of the project critical path
Preparing presentation and other materials for client pitches.
Inputting key information into the Turner & Townsend internal database tools.


Qualifications

Required Skills


Must have active Security Clearance or, be eligible to receive Security Clearance if needed.
Minimum 2 yearsâ€™ experience working as a Data Analyst
Strong analytic and numeracy skills with the ability to understand and present data in different representations
Demonstrable track record in Data Analysis; identifying requirements and documenting these using the appropriate types of tools and documentation
Knowledge of data warehousing and ETL processes
End to end experience from project launch to ongoing operation of data, analytics and reporting projects
Ability to identify and run different business and model scenarios
Strong communicator, (both written and verbal), to liaise with the client, contractors and designers
Excellent capability in the use of Excel with ability to write macros to create automated dashboards, graphs and tables
A-Level equivalent in mathematics and/or computing


Desirable Skills & Experience


Experience in an Infrastructure or Defence environment
PRINCE2 / Agile Certification or experience gained
Degree educated or equivalent in an analytic subject
Understanding of Business Improvement Techniques
Ability, or desire to learn, to programme in languages such as VBA and SQL


Additional Information

Our inspired people share our vision and mission. We provide a great place to work, where each person has the opportunity and voice to affect change.

We want our people to succeed both in work and life. To support this we promote a healthy, productive and flexible working environment that respects work-life balance.

Turner & Townsend is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and actively encourage applications from all sectors of the community.

Please find out more about us at www.turnerandtownsend.com/

SOX control responsibilities may be part of this role, which are to be adhered to where applicable.

Company Description

Turner & Townsend is a global professional services company with over 22,000 people in more than 60 countries.

Working with our clients across real estate, infrastructure, energy and natural resources, we transform together delivering outcomes that improve peopleâ€™s lives. Working in partnership makes it possible to deliver the worldâ€™s most impactful projects and programmes as we turn challenge into opportunity and complexity into success.

Our capabilities include programme, project, cost, asset and commercial management, controls and performance, procurement and supply chain, net zero and digital solutions.

We are majority-owned by CBRE Group, Inc., the worldâ€™s largest commercial real estate services and investment firm, with our partners holding a significant minority interest. Turner & Townsend and CBRE work together to provide clients with the premier programme, project and cost management offering in markets around the world.

Please visit our website: www.turnerandtownsend.com

Job Description

Due to growing demand for our services we are seeking to recruit experienced Data Analysts at Consultant, Senior Consultant & Principal Consultant levels to join our team. The role involves supporting a wide range of project commissions and major programmes and we are seeking individuals with a demonstrable track record of delivery in a consultancy environment.

The Opportunity

The responsibilities of the Data Analyst will include, but are not limited to:

  • Providing technical expertise and support to non-experts
  • Developing multi-faceted reports with recommendations to senior management
  • Development, analysis and maintenance of corporate datasets
  • Provide guidance and advice on data quality issues to a wide variety of data providers
  • Develop / use, the mechanisms employed by clients to recharge manpower against projects
  • Responsible for visibility, accuracy and transparency of the project critical path
  • Preparing presentation and other materials for client pitches.
  • Inputting key information into the Turner & Townsend internal database tools.

Qualifications

Required Skills

  • Must have active Security Clearance or, be eligible to receive Security Clearance if needed.
  • Minimum 2 yearsâ€™ experience working as a Data Analyst
  • Strong analytic and numeracy skills with the ability to understand and present data in different representations
  • Demonstrable track record in Data Analysis; identifying requirements and documenting these using the appropriate types of tools and documentation
  • Knowledge of data warehousing and ETL processes
  • End to end experience from project launch to ongoing operation of data, analytics and reporting projects
  • Ability to identify and run different business and model scenarios
  • Strong communicator, (both written and verbal), to liaise with the client, contractors and designers
  • Excellent capability in the use of Excel with ability to write macros to create automated dashboards, graphs and tables
  • A-Level equivalent in mathematics and/or computing

Desirable Skills & Experience

  • Experience in an Infrastructure or Defence environment
  • PRINCE2 / Agile Certification or experience gained
  • Degree educated or equivalent in an analytic subject
  • Understanding of Business Improvement Techniques
  • Ability, or desire to learn, to programme in languages such as VBA and SQL

Additional Information

Our inspired people share our vision and mission. We provide a great place to work, where each person has the opportunity and voice to affect change.

We want our people to succeed both in work and life. To support this we promote a healthy, productive and flexible working environment that respects work-life balance.

Turner & Townsend is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees and actively encourage applications from all sectors of the community.

Please find out more about us at www.turnerandtownsend.com/

Title: Graduate Insight Analyst
Description:
Who We Are

We are an organisation that exists to drive progress. That's the â€œred threadâ€ that connects everyone at The Economist Group (TEG). Our businesses share a devotion to innovation, independence and rigour in their fields of expertise. We empower people to understand and tackle the critical challenges and changes facing the world. Our analytical rigour, global expertise and evidence-based insights enable individuals and organisations to make sense of these shifts and chart a course through them.

We deliver analysis and insights in many formats to subscribers and clients in 170 countries through our four businesses, The Economist, Economist Impact, Economist Intelligence and Economist Education, which uphold our global reputation for excellence and integrity.

The role

This is an exciting time to join the Data & Insights team at The Economist Group. Our purpose is to better understand and affect the drivers of our business through data analytics and research, with a focus on our users, B2C customers and B2B clients. We are value-focused and outcome-driven: we help drive growth and agility at every level, whether through informing strategic alignment and decisions, providing quick feedback loops to operators or creating machine learning models to be integrated into our products and marketing communications.

In this role, you will be part of the engagement and retention insights team working in our B2C function. This is an excellent opportunity to join a multidisciplinary team of supportive and highly collaborative insights specialists, data scientists and engineers.

You will work across a multitude of projects ranging from supporting monthly reporting, working with senior analysts to deliver insights projects and help analyse test results. You will be part of a team who delivers tangible difference and whose work impacts day to day decision making at The Economist.

We are looking for a candidate who is curious, looking to learn new skills and with an aptitude for insight. Experience working with analytics data or other large data sets using SQL or other languages is advantageous but not essential and candidates looking to develop their technical skills are also welcomed.

Responsibilities


Working closely with senior analysts and other members of the team to deliver insights work to product and marketing stakeholders
Supporting the team across a variety of different tasks ranging from reporting, to deep dive insights projects and testing
Collaborating across disciplines by helping to provide technical requirements to data engineers and business analysts
Become an expert in how The Economist subscribers engage with our content and how we can optimise our retention rates
Proactively look for interesting insights and new opportunities


Who You Are


Ability to examine data critically to extract meaningful insights
Ability to communicate findings clearly to non-technical colleagues
Experience working with datasets
Some familiarity with analytics systems
A proactive approach to problem solving


The Following Would Also Be Advantageous But Not Required


Experience using SQL for data analysis
Experience working in a digital subscription or online retail business


Benefits

What we offer

We offer excellent benefits including an incentive programme, generous annual and parental leave policies, volunteering days and well-being support throughout the year, as well as free access to all Economist content. Country specific benefits are also offered.

Our Values

Our values are a collective set of beliefs and behaviours that strengthen The Economist Group's purpose and demonstrate where we want to be as an organisation. They reflect on our mission to pursue progress for individuals, organisations and the world.

Independence

We are not bound to any party or interest and encourage exploration and free-thinking. We champion freedom, both within our organisation and around the world.

Integrity

We are bold in our efforts to uncover the truth and stand up for what we believe in. We inspire trust through our rigour, fact-checking and transparency.

Excellence

We aspire to the highest standards in all we do. We are ambitious and inquisitive in our pursuit of continuous progress and innovation.

Inclusivity

We value diversity in thought and background and encourage healthy debate with a breadth of perspectives. We treat our colleagues and customers fairly and respectfully.

Openness

We foster a collaborative and empathetic culture conducive to the interests, wit and initiative of our colleagues. New ideas are our lifeblood.

The Economist Group values diversity. We are committed to equal opportunities and creating an inclusive environment for all our colleagues and potential colleagues regardless of ethnic origin, national origin, gender, gender identity, race, colour, religious beliefs, disability, sexual orientation, age, marital status or any other status.
